We also got a noodle dish with gravy. Rah nah: they used the pan fried flat noodles with gravy! Very different and very good! Probably my next favorite dish after the pad Thai.

Last by not least, we also got some super spicy dish with boar? It taste very gelatin like( tendon). It was way too spicy and too interesting for me. But if you're up for a challenge, try this dish. The person who was born in Thailand recommended us this. Koo moh yong?
author: Josie H.

description: Love the Thai coffee here. Also love the fact that their ingredients are always fresh. I've had the chicken curry, pad Thai and pad see ew. My favorite is the curry.
author: Allison J.

description: This place was packed when we got here and super overcrowded. But their food made up for it! Our server Ash stole the show! We were a party of 16 so understandably orders get messed up and forgotten. But Ash showed up half way through and fixed everything. I think I would be writing a completely different review if it weren't for Ash. I would abosolutely recommend this place for great take out. Their portions a great for sharing!
author: Erin H.

description:
Appetizer favorites: 
9) Koh Moo Yang. AMAZING. Great portions and good to share. 
4) Thai Herb Sausage. Really interesting combo of flavors and a yummy dipping sauce. Also great to share with a bigger group. 

Entree favorites: 
36) Kang Keaw Wan. Slightly spicy green curry. We got it with chicken and it was really good. I'm not a fan of curry, but this one was too good to turn down.
76) Pad Kee Mow. So delicious. 
78) Pad Thai. Again, not usually a fan of pad thai because it's always too sweet. This was a winner! So amazing and the flavor is so great. 

We went at 6 and it was pretty empty, but once it was 6:30~8:00 PM, it was packed (a Wednesday night). Service could be a bit better as we were sitting and waiting for drinks and water refills, and we had to ask three different people before receiving it.

Will come back here again!
author: Shelley K.

description:
I love love love Lers Ros Thai and so why just a-ok you ask?

Mainly because I ordered some delivery and although I love their pad see ew with chicken, it was about an hour late. Keep in mind, I ordered 3 dishes at 4:45pm and was told it would be there in 45 min. I'm usually pretty lenient and just figured, ok, by 6pm. Totally fine. 6pm rolls around and no sign so I called to check in and she says oh, yeah, it's already on it's way. I live maybe 10 minutes away. 6:30 rolls around and still no sign. 7pm and finally I get a call he is downstairs. Perfect, I have to be somewhere at 7:15 so no time to eat at all. 

Sorry about my rant- lesson of the day: if you need to be somewhere, probably don't order delivery from here. Do it another day when you aren't in a rush, starving, and can just stay home and wait.
author: Leina K.

description: Great place, hip music, great lunch prices and the food was fantastic.
author: Will D.

description: So far the best Thai Restaurant in Town :) its authentic and delicious :) food is so dame good and servers are nice and very polite!
author: Katie E.

description: As a big fan of Thai food, I still give 5* for their Tom Kha soup, one of the best Tom Kha I've tried so far. Good price and good location because it's not easy to find a nice place to eat around Civic Center.
author: Cindy N.

description:
I came by to check out Lers Ros at a recommendation of a friend. I was not disappointed! It was suggested to me to order the Pad Kra Prow Moo Krob (stir fried pork belly). I ordered it hot. I also ordered some jasmine tea to drink. The service was great from the very beginning!

Once the food arrived I dove in. The pork belly was krispy and meaty at the same time. It was a little on the mild side but before I could say anything they brought over the chili sauce tray. :)

Overall great experience. You gotta check out Lers Ros!
author: Jared W.

description:
Truly authentic 100% Thai food, saying from a born and raised in Thailand me. This is what Thai food really taste like in Thailand.

Everything is great here, highly suggest the signature dishes. Stop ordering PadThai don't be that "I don't know what else to order" guy.
author: Todd H.

description:
Pricey Thai food. Ate here several times and have tried several items on their menu.
Favorite: Garlic frog, pork belly, crab fried rice, and green curry( super spicy which I can't finish.)

Location is bad, table setting is basically elbow to elbow with another stranger, food can take a while depending on the time you come, and servers were nice.

This place is popular with their authentic thai food. Some of the items on the menu can be just okay while others are just mind blowing. Check it out if you feel like eating Thai dishes.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
It's a hip, loud restaurant located in the Tenderloin. The menu is super expansive. Makes it hard to decide what to get because there are too many options. 

Tom Yum soup - This was really good. The meat itself is a bit dry, but that's cuz all the good stuff is in the soup. I loved how it didn't taste heavy and the flavors were on point.

Duck rice - Mehh I wouldn't bother getting this. It was very good, don't get me wrong, every piece was juicy and flavorful, but I think you can get similar and cheaper duck at a Chinese BBQ shop. Also the meat was too fatty for my tastes. I wouldn't say it was anything special unfortunately.

Papaya salad - I enjoyed the salad although I didn't know what to do with the half head of cabbage on the side. Portion felt a bit small.

All in all, a good meal, but I wasn't quite blown away. Maybe it's because I'm not the biggest fan of Thai food, but it's not a place I see myself coming back to.
author: Jenny W.

description:
Awesome, awesome Thai food. 

What we ordered:
Duck Larb Salad - my favorite dish of the night. I've never seen this on a thai menu so I was excited to try it. It does not disappoint. Both tables beside us ordered it, too. It must be popular.
Pad Thai - standard dish. Nothing extraordinary.
Fried Trout with Mango Relish - Delicious. Perfectly crispy fish. The mango relish is sweet and spicy. Yum.
Green Chicken Curry - Spicier than expected! Good flavor. 
Spicy Boar - A chewier consistency than I was expecting. It was nice to try something completely different but I don't think I'd ever order this dish again.
You have to order rice as a side (I hate it when Asian restaurants do this!).

Service - Kind of non existent. They only wait on you to take your order and drop off your food. If you need a refill, you've gotta flag someone down.

Reservations - Definitely recommended. There was a huge, long wait outside. We had an 8pm reservation and people were still waiting outside at 10pm! 

Parking - Difficult. Street parking only.
author: Denise H.

description:
Thai food is one of my favourite. I saw reviews before and wanted to try this place. Talking about service in places like this one is Much of expectations. I care about food and there
were no regrets on choosing this place.
author: John B.

description: Service was super slow. Pad thai was ok. I could not finish it as it was a little too sweet for my taste. The crab fried rice however, was very good!
author: D D.

description:
The trip to Les Ros on Larkin leaves indeed leaves one's stomach in a tight knot. It is by the way located in the Tenderloin. Once you make it, it is all worth the adventure--Tenderloin-style. So happy that the restaurant itself was very clean.

AMBIANCE:
Les Ros is modern and contemporary. The plates are geometric and sparkling clean. It is not a huge restaurant but spacious enough.

FOOD:
They offer over 110 dishes to choose from so I am sure you or your picky friend will find and enjoy something. Overwhelming since they have so much choices. Here is what we tried:
~7x7 BIG EATS 2012 #45: DUCK LARB Les Ros Thai's Duck Larb was good. Should you eat it before you die or is it worth dying for--cholesterol and all?
Yes, it was delicious with chopped pieces of flavorful boneless duck skin and meat in citrus-lime dressing. 

My verdict for this 7x7 dish is it is a delicious salad but so was almost every dish that I had at Les Ros. It is worth ordering but it did not send me to foodie heaven. 

~#17 YUM KOH MOO YANG (Pork Shoulder Salad with Spicy Lime Dressing)~ An appetizing dish of thinly sliced pork on top of basil, side of cabbage and generously drizzled with lime, chili peppers and herbs, this dish reminds me of LECHON (Filipino roasted pig.)

Other notables   ~ RED CURRY W/ BEEF
                           ~MARINATED BBQ CHICKEN W/ SWEET & SOUR SAUCE
                           ~YELLOW CURRY WITH TOFU 
                           ~STIRFRIED EGGPLANT W/ BASIL.

The curries were of the right consistency which should not be too thick or watered down. The flavors are lovely and complex and "come alive" in the palate spicy but I love spicy.

Overall  come here is you want Thai food that would not disappoint with great service. Les Ros Thai is the place to bring Thai food novice and purists. The dishes are guaranteed delicious and the flavors bold. The portions are generous and reasonably priced. 4 stars!
author: Maria M.

description: Really great place. Been here twice for birthday events and was impressed with the food. Definitely would take friends here. Pad Thai was excellent. Service was also good
author: Shayne O.

description:
Perfect for: a quick lunch, sharing plates with friends, friends with kids.
Great flavors, great service. Bar seat and community table gives lots of options. Surrounding area is a bit rough.
author: Fumi W.

description:
Where do I begin with Lers Ros? It's been a love affair over many, many years. 

Way back when, I used to live within walking distance. In the midst of so many great "ethnic" restaurants and bars, finding your perfect go-to place takes time. I dated around a little at the various Vietnamese, Chinese, Indian eateries.

But once I found Lers Ros, it was a full-on committed relationship.

What to order? Everything is good, you cannot find a bad menu item (though once I saw a rabbit special listed... wouldn't go there). My favorites include: Tom Kha Kai, Moo Gratiem, Kai Yang, Kang Keaw Wan. Just to name a few. Add some extra spice and feel your sinuses being cleansed! 

Love the servers, they're direct but nice. Food comes out quickly and they turn over tables pretty fast. So even when there's a wait, chances are you'll be seated within 20-30 minutes. 

Even though I don't live anywhere close to Lers Ros, I make it a point to visit and keep the spark alive every few months.
author: Abby S.

description:
Don't hate me!

I wasn't impressed.  But then again, we only ordered 2 items, so, maybe there's more to explore but with the items I ate, it was kinda 'meh'.

! - Shredded mango salad with roasted chicken and sticky rice: this was overly tangy and overly spicy.  It overwhelmed my palette and told me never to go back again.  The chicken was nothing special and I now know that I don't like sticky rice.  It's too too sticky for me.
! - Pad Thai - 7x7 magazine said this is the finest pad thai I would ever eat.  Ding dong...nope.  Had better.  I mean, it taste decent, it wasn't bad but it didn't give out that smokey flavor that the article mentioned, which disappointed me to the core.  
! - Hot tea - they charged a $1.50 for watered down tea.  I've recently turned into a tea snob and have been noticing the teas that are served at every restaurant are not up to my standards.  Including this one.  I wish I can bring my own tea leaves and just order hot water instead.  I guess I'm mad because they charged $1.50 when it should be free instead.  

We got here at 5:30pm on a Saturday, so, we got a seat within 5 minutes.  After sitting down, a long line starting queuing up at the door.  We're happy that we got to avoid the mad rush.  The mediocre food won't prevent me from coming back, I just wish I studied the menu more before placing my order.  My entire dining experience would had been different if I knew exactly what to order.  

NOTES:  Not a lot of personal space, the tables are only 1 inch apart.  Expect to hear other peoples conversations and pretend your not eating right next to them.
author: Jenny T.

description: I got the pad thai and the Thai iced tea. The iced tea was rich in tea flavour and quite sweet. The bean sprouts were very fresh. I could taste the crunchiness of the peanuts. The noodles didn't stick to each other. These were all signs of a good pad thai. In addition, the pad thai came with a good amount of shrimp. The service was great.
author: James S.

description:
The ambiance is great! Love the seating. I don't think I'll ever forget how damn good their papaya salad is. 

Food is on point; if I lived closed I'd frequent this place so much more.
author: Amirah Q.

description:
The bf and I came here for date night on a Friday after 9pm and the place was packed! We had to wait 25 mins for a table because we didn't want to sit at the bar. 

We ordered fried rolls, tofu pad Thai, and yellow curry w/ potatoes. The portions for what we ordered were definitely enough for 2 people. 

The rolls were good. They weren't burnt. The pad Thai was tasty and the yellow curry was very flavorful. I would get everything again. 

Service was decent and prices were reasonable.
author: Fallon P.

description: Probably  the best Thai in the city or at-least from what I know. I've really only had the sausage app, the Tom yum and a couple of entrees. The setup makes you feel like you're in Bangkok.
author: Lokesh D.

description: We came here on the way back down from Sonoma. We originally planned on eating at a pho place across the street, but it closed before we got there. There was no wait for this place, and it got very good reviews. I ordered the duck on rice. My boyfriend got the spicy fish cake special. The food wasn't too overpriced, except for the specials. I would definitely come here again to try something different. The food came pretty quickly.
author: Shu T.

description:
Admittedly we had intended to try out Mensho Ramen this evening, but when we drove by and saw the line, we immediately decided to consider second options. Glad that we did because we discovered Ler Ros and boy was it enjoyable! 

We managed to snag two seats at the bar and soon after, all of the other tables were filled. The waitress who took our order was pleasant and when we asked her for anything that we should order, she quickly recommended #62, pad kra prow moo krob (stir fried crispy pork belly)! We also ordered a vegetable + tofu green curry and a tamarind soup with vegetables + shrimp. 

Food came quickly and shortly thereafter, our hungry bellies were nourished and our faces glistening as we broke a sweat from the spiciness! 

Ultimately we ended up leaving without our leftovers, as we forgot to wait for them after we signed our bill. We called them and they managed to find them and hold them. I wasn't going to let good food go to waste so drove back to get them (about 14 mins each eay). Well worth it for what will be a solid leftovers meal! 

We'll be back.
author: Christopher W.

description:
I lived in Thailand for 2 years teaching English, traveling and worked in a few restaurant kitchens in Bangkok.   I must say, this is the best and most authentic Thai restaurant I've been to outside of Thailand.     If you're going to order Pad Thai, Pad Si Swe, Penang Curry or fried rice, then this place probably isn't for you, since everyone has a favorite Thai place for these dishes.   If you want authentic Thai dishes you can't find at run-of-the-mill Thai places, then by all means check out this place.

Highlights:

-Moo Phing - Pork Skewers
-Koh Moo Yang - Pork Shoulder
-Pla Koong - Raw Prawns
-Tom Kha Gai - Chicken Coconut Soup 
-Larb Ped Yang - Duck Salad - One of my favs....
-Pla Rad Prik - Deep Fried Whole Tilapia w/ Chili Paste
-Pla Trout Tod Nam Pla -  Trout w/ mango sauce

I make a point to stop by here everytime I'm in the Bay area.   Fantastic.
author: Peater J.

description: I'm not a genius but this place is heaven. Need I say more? From the #CrabFriedRice to #Chicken to the #SpinichAndBeefCoveredInPeanutSauce if we are ever in #SF we will eat here again. My lord!
author: Ron W.

description: Highly recommended by some friends and it did not disappoint. I love curry so I ordered the red duck curry. The duck was way too fatty but the rest of it was amazing!!!  My wife loved her noodles. Great place!!  Uber driver on the way home explained that even though the neighborhood seems a little sketch it is actually a very good place for people to get great food and good drinks and that there is nothing to worry about with some Of the 'lost' folks in the street.
author: Sargeant T.

description:
Yelped this place on New Year's Day to get some lunch.

FOOD:
- tom yum noodle soup - good! The soup had good flavor, nice and light and I loved the flat noodles with the soup (you get a choice between flat rice noodles or thin rice noodles)

SERVICE:
INSANELY SLOW. We were seated right away but they didn't take our order or give us water for 10 minutes. We also had to ask several times for water refills. The table next to us also had trouble getting service. Food took a while to come out too. The restaurant wasn't even that crowded!

VENUE:
Pretty large and clean. Long table in the middle where you're sitting next to other parties. Bathrooms are up this maze of stairs and are decently clean.

Food was good, but the super slow service kills any chance of a return visit from me.
author: Yenny D.

description: Food tasted good, but was a bit pricey for the location & ambience. Also, the staff pushed more expensive options & assumed you preferred the higher $ version when there was a choice - not too happy about that. There's better Thai food to be had in SF. Spice levels are more elevated than normal, so be aware.
author: Vikram S.

description:
I normally love this place but today my pad kee mao with beef was all gristle.  I ended up spitting out half the meat. Gross.

Be warned that this location makes everything really spicy. So if you don't like spice be sure to indicate when you order.
author: Josie M.

description:
When I walked in for a late dinner I immediately noticed the strong odor of the restaurant. My friend waved it off saying it was just the ingredients, but it was hard to ignore. 

The prices are more expensive than many neighboring Thai restaurants in the neighborhood, but with lower quality dishes and less comfortable seating in a much more crowded space.

If you're looking for a quality low cost option, I would recommend Zen Yai just a couple blocks over. If you're looking for dinner on date night, try House of Thai instead for a much more refined experience at the same price point.
author: Brandon K.

description: Ordered some Tilapia here from the House Special section of the menu and it was sooo bomb!! Totally recommend it and will def visit again.
author: Hameed W.

description:
I'm really not sure what the hype is about this place. Our experience was so bad. 
We got the crispy pork (#62), red curry with duck, and sticky rice. They were all pretty bad. 
Crispy pork pieces were a hit and miss. Some pieces tasted delicious with a good balance of fatty and lean part and crispy skin. But some pieces were hard to chew. Not impressed. 
Sticky rice was crusty as it it were sitting out for a long time. Props to server who replaced ours with white rice. Thank you. 
Red curry flavor was good, but the eggplant was nasty (so many seeds) and the duck pieces were too fatty as if they just threw in the Chinese roast duck into the curry.  
We won't be back.
author: Melody Y.

description:
This place had some very good Thai food. Despite the service not being the best, I won't even mark them down for it, because the food makes up for it. On the menu I saw they served alligator, but didn't have the courage to order that, so I went with Tom yum with pork and beef pad see ew. The Tom yum was made just right as the broth wasn't too oily, salty and it was still full of flavor. I added extra lime  in my soup to bring out the citrus/sour flavor. The beef on the pad see ew was so tender and everything meshed well together (seriously, how can you go wrong with that pad see ew?) 

When I went they had a sign in front of the door saying they were closed from 4 pm to 5 pm. So if they close at random hours like that without having an official business hour posting, then i suggest calling in to make sure they're open. Also, come right when they open because even on a weekday they fill out quickly and you will most likely end up waiting!
author: Sarah L.

description: We got the pad Thai with chicken and yellow curry. The pad Thai was awesome, we loved it! The yellow curry was good but nothing special. Get the pad Thai here! The service was really good, I'd recommend coming here for some Thai!
author: Susannah H.

description: Excellent Thai food. I am a huge fan of Thai, and Lers Ros hit out of the park for me. I loved their tom kha (coconut milk soup with chicken). The braised and fried pork belly was a big hit for all of us. We couldn't get enough of the pad see ew. And the curry was excellent too. I would say to make a reservation and check Lers Ros out, and you will not be disappointed, I promise.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Super Thai food! Quick efficient service!

We tried the frog legs and it was surprisingly tasty. Be a little adventurous. The Thai curry puffs were a little underwhelming. 
Overall great food!
author: Janaki G.

description:
I've been to the Hayes location and was not too fond of their seasoning and quality of food.

Ordered the tom yum noodle soup medium spicy with fat noodles. I will say the spice is pretty mild. I'd recommend spicy if you typically eat spicy food. 
 
Came with a large group and everyone ordered from the lunch special except for a few of us. General consensus the dishes were a tad too salty.
 
The restaurant is pretty clean and the service is quite attentive. Will return another time to try other items.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Maybe I should have tried alligator or frog type of exotic dishes but I ordered a simple noodle dish with chicken (the first one on the menu under pan fried noodles) and I was disappointed. Not very flavorful, noodles and chicken were not fresh. Wait staff are very friendly though therefore 3 stars.
author: Sophie R.

description:
YOU MUST GET THE PORK BELLY (#62). Must must must. It was fan-f*cking-tastic. 

I just ate the leftovers after they'd been in my fridge for a fair number of days.. and I even give those leftovers 5 stars. 

* 25 - Larb Phed Yang - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lers-ros-thai-san-francisco?select=Jl9RPMDlB3uV0Q5_OwJyrQ#Jl9RPMDlB3uV0Q5_OwJyrQ
(a chunk of roasted duck mixed with rice powder, chili powder and lime based salad dressing. $10.95)
The duck was absolutely delicious. This is a nice dish to complement the pork belly as this has more of a vinegar/tangy-concentrated flavor. I would not get this by itself because it would be sour overload (which is why this doesn't get 5 stars), but get it along with a strong savory dish and you'll really enjoy!

* 62 - Pad Kra Prow Moo Krob - 5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lers-ros-thai-san-francisco?select=Jl9RPMDlB3uV0Q5_OwJyrQ#QgyRnrEOpvunwq2J-jAV6g
(stir-fried pork belly w/ crispy rind and basil leaves. $10.95 rice plate)
THIS IS SO FREAKING GOOD. Warning: I like fatty meat. With intense savory flavor. And with a super crunchy texture. This isn't your normal pork belly, this isn't the most tender meat. What makes this good is how crazy crispy each piece of pork belly is - so that you have to work at it quite a bit, but OH MAN that crisp works so well the way they make it! And the flavor - intensely savory, slightly slightly sweet - SO DELICIOUS. Just stop reading my review and go to Lers Rose and eat it yourself. You will understand.

Mental note to self: next time, also order the whole fried trout & the pork shoulder salad (saw both coming out of the kitchen & they all looked delish!).

Menu salad section: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lers-ros-thai-san-francisco?select=6iS6OqJjrMymmf6sa_oTtQ#6iS6OqJjrMymmf6sa_oTtQ
Menu rice plates section: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lers-ros-thai-san-francisco?select=6iS6OqJjrMymmf6sa_oTtQ#Ps7I9utZeA78_teWftpKhg
Menu desserts: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lers-ros-thai-san-francisco?select=6iS6OqJjrMymmf6sa_oTtQ#biNN8tHQIMBDFacv2d3aGA
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Kang daeng (red curry with eggplant and bamboo shoots): 4/5.

Pad thai (prawns): 5/5. Very fresh prawns.

Thai iced tea: 4/5.
author: Clarence H.

description:
Lers Ros Thai has been on my bookmarked list for what feels like 5 years and finally I've come to try one of the most authentic Thai restaurants in the Bay Area, so they say.  On a Friday night at around 8pm, the wait was about 15-20 minutes but quickly escalated after that.  Crowds eat late around here.

Larb Phed Yang (duck salad) really shocks your socks as a first dish.  The lime flavor hits you until the spiciness settles into your throat and catches you off guard.  I love that you wrap the duck, red onion, and other bits into small cups of iceberg lettuce because it offsets the flavor with a coolness.

Koh Moo Yang (grilled pork shoulder) is a must get like they all say!  It's a big piece with thin slices; some are lean and some have a 1 cm of fat attached.  I wouldn't expect a tender piece of meat but something that's more smokey and almost veering towards jerky (although not quite).  They really know how to work their sauces here because it was a great balance and not as tart as the salad.

Pork belly was a dish I couldn't find on the online menu but on the physical menu at the restaurant, it's number 60-something.  I would say this was one of my favorite dishes of the night.  The pork was roasted Chinese style with an uber crispy skin.  Again, some pieces were tougher than others but I'm thinking that's just how they do things here.  Don't expect the succulent, braised juicy pork belly with the glistening fat you're used to seeing; this is a more raw, homemade version.  Medium spiciness is a good level because you get the spice but that's not all you're thinking about.  Unlike the previous two dishes I mentioned, which were more appetizers, this dish is saucy and goes well with rice.

Pla Rad Prik (whole fried tilapia) surprised me that it was on the house specials list. Given that they do not make it generic with bottled chili sauce like other Thai restaurants, it does start tasting similar so I might have scratched this out to get a curry or soup for next time.  Website claims that fresh fish is guaranteed each day but it's hard to tell because it's fried to very well done and I couldn't distinguish the flaky texture of typical fresh fish.

Rad Nah (house secret gravy sauce with marinated pork and flat noodle) was another regret.  We wanted a noodle dish to fill us up and balance out the other dishes but this was more of a gravy entree with a small chunk of noodles, lots of veggies, and marinated pork.  Pork seems to be the theme of the night also so by this dish, I was porked out.  BUT...if you're craving rad nah, the gravy is pretty solid and goes well over your rice.

Places like these shame generic Thai restaurants.  Like a Chinese person craving Panda Express, I suppose there will be moments where I'll just want a pad thai and the closest joint is good enough for that.  Lers Ros is definitely a special place though and I would gladly take anyone who claims they like Thai food.  We'll see what they know!  Also, service is fantastic.  Hostess joked with us and the server was cute as a button.  Our waters were refilled over 5 times that night!
author: Shannon L.

description:
Whenever I go to a Thai place, I usually try out their pad see ew. The pad see ew here has Chinese pepper powder, which tastes less than classic. I ordered a fatty pork rice plate here once, that was pretty good. But from the side of sour veggies, it was pretty clear the chef may indeed be Chinese.

I've ordered the fried tilapia at least twice here. Pretty good, though it was super spicy one time.
author: Vicky J.

description:
One of the best Thai places that I've eaten at, ever. The Pad Thai was excellent, the yellow coconut based curry with prawns has a sauce that was drinkable and the pork belly? You MUST eat it. Pork belly with basil and peppers. The crackly skin with a layer of melt in your mouth fat sandwiched between it and the perfectly cooked pork is something you have to experience. One of my favorite Thai dishes ever!

A note for travellers, it's not the best neighbourhood. Be prepared for cop cars using megaphones to break up anyone gathering together in groups. Just park safely, etc. you know the drill ;)
author: Karlynn J.

description: Ordered lunch via Postmates. Pad Thai was pretty tasty and didn't have an overwhelming smell (very important when eating in the office). I was a little disappointed with the portion but figured I can't expect much if ordering a to-go lunch. I would definitely order again regardless as their Pad Thai is much better than many SF restaurants.
author: Jess T.

description: Food was ok! My concern is that they have a whole "vegetarian" section that contains fish sauce. Fish are not vegetables...I think, right? They have moms.
author: Krimsey R.

description:
Not your typical Thai food. If you are adventurous, they have rabbit, alligator, and frog on the menu. They also have your typical pad thai, and tom yum gai stuff going on.
Food : good to above average compared to most places in San Francisco.
Service: they tend to forget some of the food you order, or give you the wrong order. That's ok ! What Thai place doesn't? Always service with a smile.
Parking: street parking in the TL.
Great place for late night eats. However, sometimes can be quite crowded.
author: Dub C.

description:
When you are in SanFran and hankering some Thai, Lers Ros is the "it" place. Lers Ros." Even the San Francisco Chronicle has Lers Ros noted as a top 100 Bay Area restaurants of 2014.

After reading all of the great honorable mentions on Lers Ros and hearing great things from friends, I was ready to take on the challenge and eat incredible Thai food. Though nothing was disappointing, nothing stood out and made my experience an incredible one either. The one positive thing to come out of dining at Lers Ros was they actually know what "thai spicy/thai hot means". It seems like a great date spot, but they definitely try to turn over tables quickly so keep that in mind before hitting this location.
author: Kendal Ann M.

description:
Oh my goodness, this place is wonderful. It's by far the best Thai restaurant in San Francisco, and I've tried a few. The staff is great, welcoming and you can tell they like people. 

The food was AMAZING! The quality of the food was great, the presentation was fantastic and the portions were huge....and let's not forget the taste....OMG!

I'm definitely going back here again with more of my friends.
author: Tré S.

description:
Date night!!!

Nice little place, hard seats though but on to the food.

That's Ice Tea
Very strong but very good.

Smokey Pork Shoulder with spicy sauce #9
OMG... this was really really good. The Pork was sooooooooooo tender. The spicy sauce was hella spicy so dip a little for just the right amount. Order 2!

Pad Thai with Shrimp
Very strong flavor. Tasted very very good as well.

Crab fried rice
The crab was over powered by the fried rice otherwise still pretty good.

Customer Service 
Bar none, great service very attentive. 

Go get your Thai on!
author: Adam C.

description:
Frog Legs? 
Wild Boar?
Alligator Meat? 
Rabbit Meat?
Prepared in wonderful spices and curries?

You got me hook, line and sinker.

I am game when it comes to "Game" meat, and the more exotic the better. Wifey and I wanted to try something new for dinner as she picked me up from work. Couldn't decide between Japanese, Korean or Vietnamese. Wifey checked this place on Yelp and started browsing the photos. She began drooling at the photos of gorgeous slices of Pork Shoulders and I zeroed in on the exotic meats.

It was decided there and then and we navigated our way through the prostitutes, pimps, hustlers, junkies, dealers and cray crays in the Tenderloin. This place is open late and it was packed full of people; however, our wait time didn't take long since I persuaded the Wifey to sit at the bar. Hey, I wanted to have a great view of the Giants game on the monitor.

We ordered the Koh Moo Yong (Pork Shoulders) for starters (but had it for a side dish) and comes with a Chili & Rice Powder sauce. That sauce was legit and I used it liberally. For entrees, we ordered the Pad Ped Alligator, Pad Ped Moo Pah (Boar) and Pad Kra Prow Moo Krob (Pork Belly) with a side of White Rice and Brown Rice. 

The slices of Pork Shoulders comes with just the right amount of fat and cooked to perfection. It was tender, moist and tasty. The Alligator was spicy and full of wonderful flavors. The dish also comes with a Thai Eggplant that I've never had before and I was digging it; and got me digging into the dish. As I mentioned, I like game meats, and the Boar did not disappoint. You can taste the gaminess of the meat and I just wished they used less chili paste on it. And the Pork Belly was spot on. The skin was crispy and the proportion of meat to fat is just right to satisfy even Anthony Bourdain. 

Exotic?           Yes!
Authentic?      Definitely!
Delicious?      Exceptionally!

Quite frankly one the best Thai food I've had in a while.
author: John G.

description:
Been meaning to try this place for a while now, so opportunity presented itself after HH with a buddy last night.  

It's a bustling place without feeling claustrophobic. Our waitress V (or is it Vy or Vee) was super attentive and friendly and laughed at all my jokes, ha.

At V's recommendation we ordered the Kra Dook Moo Pad Ped (pork spareribs in a chili paste peppercorn sauce), the northern style sausage served with peanuts lime ginger and red onions, and their house specialty the Lek Tom Yum Heang. All this along with two ice cold coronas (you have to drink these with lime and rim the bottle with salt, it's the only way).

Man, were we impressed with the food. The Lek was a delicious blend of flavors (reminds me of the vn Nam Vang noodle, very similar in taste and texture with the added crunch of crispy pork skin), and the sausage... wow, so simple but who knew so packed with flavors. The Kra Dook was the only disappointment, kinda bland. We finished our dinner with sticky rice topped with durian, and roasted almonds ice cream.  The durian was not overly strong and went very well with the sticky rice and coconut milk. 

My buddy is a white dude who said last time he was here they didn't respect him when he asked to kick the heat up a couple of notches. I told him not to worry, he's with me this time, and we were satisfied with the spice level. Respected!

Definitely will be back to try some other dishes
author: Dean N.

description: Okay so here's the deal: take your crummiest car because you'll be parking in the tenderloin. Leave your mercedes at home , or Uber it. Whatever you do, it'll be worth it, because a group of 4 of us went and one of my buddies said need didn't want to go, because he hates Thai food. Well, in his case he's biased because he's Chinese, but we forced him to go and guess what? He loved it and was forced to tell us that he did;. We ordered everything like Ton Kiang and chicken satay, but BBq beef, yellow chicken curry, mussaman curry, garlic fried rice and pad thai. We also had their fish special, which was on the expensive side, but worth it. We ordered it 'medium' and it came still on the spicy side, the mango dessert was awesome and we ended up ordering another one. The bill was under $100 bucks, which for 4 people and everything we ate, is good.
author: Mack L.

description:
Pretty busy place for a weekday evening, but still no wait which was great. It's loud, and feels a little hectic, especially because we were near the kitchen end of the restaurant. 

Food was pretty good. I heard great things and also was craving Thai food, so I came with high expectations. Started with the plain papaya salad. The waiter warned us that it would be medium to spicy, and it was definitely on the spicy end! Given that I usually like papaya salad for its fresh taste, I probably wouldn't get this version again. We also got Lek Tom Yum Haeng, a dry rice noodle dish with pork belly, fish cake (sprinkled with a bit of sugar!). Unique but a little cumbersome to mix!  Pad Thai was great (not surprised!). Comes with delicious sautéed shrimp and also a side of fresh bean sprouts. This dish took a while to come out. I think they try to bundle the same orders from other tables.

Thai iced tea was sweeter than the usual, but was really good to balance out the spicy from the papaya salad! Overall, a great place for last minute Thai cravings and no wait. I'm curious to try the other locations.
author: Linda Z.

description:
My wife wanted to check out Lers Ross in the 'loin for dinner one night and we were not disappointed.  The food was tasty and beautiful.  We had thePork ribs with hot sauce, yellow curry with potatoes and beef and a seafood soup.  All of the dishes were really good and had a taste that reminded us of our trip to Thailand last year.  My only complaint is the noise. I like a restaurant that has a moderate to high noise level, but Lers Ross was deafening.

The neighborhood has improved a bit since I lived there in the 80's, but it is still a bit dicey.  Great food will bring us back though.
author: Bob M.

description: Authentic Thai taste just like in a nice restaurant in Thailand. The tender Ko Moo Yang (grilled pork shoulder) is a must. We also ordered shrimp omelet, duck red curry, pad thai, and salted fish Chinese broccoli. Everything was very very good. SF has a long list of really good Thai restaurants. This is definitely one of them.
author: K T.

description:
I went to Lers Ros on a Friday night with 2 friends, around 9pm, as we were in the neighborhood craving for some food. There was no line at all.

I ordered the green curry: the sauce was wonderful! It was a bit spicy, I am okay with spicy food but not evreybody is so I recommend you to ask how spicy your dish is before ordering. The quality price ratio is really good: cheap, excellent, and the portion is quite big.

The atmoshpere of the restaurant is cosy; I'm definitely going back!
author: Marion K.

description: Solid Thai spot. We got there at 6:15 on a Thursday night and there were a lot of open tables and we were seated right away. But by the time we left an hour later, there were at least 8 groups waiting for a table.  We had the green curry and pad thai and enjoyed both!
author: Gloria N.

description: This place has Horrible customer service. The waitresses are rude and have that ugly don't talk to me/your request bothers me face. When I asked about an item on the menu, the first waitress was getting mad over it? The FOOD however is delicious. I liked all three entrees I ordered. I probably would come again but honestly the service is a turn off. I didn't even drink the water the waitress brought me fearing she'd probably spit on it. FOOD: delicious, SERVICE: bad. Given my first experience at this restaurant I give it 3 stars.
author: Vanessa A.

description: Fast service, food came out as fast as we place the order. The grill shrimp papaya salad was killer.
author: Yale D.

description:
Lers Ros is such a shining jewel in an otherwise awful, disgusting, vile community; bring commandos, secret service or at least a good body guard because you may need to be shielded from the anti-eye, nose and ear candy found in this pit of depravity.

Are your taste buds worked up into a frenzy...not yet?

Well, I wanted to go Xtreme veggie, okay, just vegetarian, but really wanted to try their coconut milk curries, however all of them come with meat of one sort or another. Our waitress indicated that not only could I get any of the coconut curries without meat, but would be charged a discounted price to boot!

Even without meat, the Kang Daeng (red curry) was magnificent and the person I was with ordered the Kang Keaw (green curry) with prawns, what a delight. 

Good service and very good food at reasonable prices.
author: George S.

description:
When I'm eating here so many times in a matter of weeks, you know it's a sign. I haven't had to wait more than 5 minutes for a table, even when they tell me that I'll be seated in 20 minutes. It's quick, efficient, and delicious. What more could I ask for?

I've found the "special" dishes to be great, but a little pricey. I don't need to eat alligator, boar, or rabbit to feel special. I stick to the regular items on the menu, and it's a solid meal. Order three items for two people, and you'll take home some tasty leftovers. 

Wondering what to start your meal with? I'm a huge fan of the Yum Woon Sen and Larb Moo!
author: Tinna H.

description: I've backpacked through Thailand multiple times and their Pork Shoulder and Prik King comes closer than most to real street food quality of Bangkok. For a trendy SF food spot, I think it's pretty authentic. Their prices are only slightly higher than other Thai restaurants considering their portions are a tad smaller but still very affordable. Besides I think we should stop expecting Asian restaurants to be cheaper just because we are use to it. They spend just as many hours burning the stove as any other cuisine. Servers are nice. pretty crowded most nights which equals credibility in my book.
author: Yvonne N.

description: I had tom yum moo rice noodle soup with pork and didn't enjoy the soup. I didn't like the flavor of the soup at all. I am disappointed by the quality of food they serve given the high reviews. However, based on other people's review, pad thai seems to be a good chioce here.
author: Iris S.

description:
Oh, happy place. Lers Ros is all that it is hyped up to be.  My coworker recommended this, and I thankfully bit.  Skimming the Yelp reviews, I learned that the LEK TOM YUM HAENG was where it's at, and yes, I resoundingly concur.  My regrets are: (1) I shared it with three other people (could have kept the entire dish to myself), (2) I didn't order two of this same dish for our table of 4, and (3) I didn't hijack the ordering and get the other pork belly (with basil) dish.  I definitely want to come back so that I can have more of the Lek Tom Yum Haeng and try the basil pork belly entree. 

The Lek Tom Yum Haeng comes with perfectly crispy pieces of pork belly (and if you know me, pork belly, especially the crispy variety, lights up my life).  It also comes with some other extraordinary features such as ground pork and fish cake (what an interesting combo they all together make), with a delightful slightly spicy sauce and skinny rice noodles.  The seafood green curry and chicken red curry were delicious as well.  The pad thai was well made and I can still recall its great flavor as I write this review.  

My plan next time is to try the Pad Kee Mow (which other Yelpers have raved about), more Lek Tom Yum Haeng, and more pork belly.
author: Alice T.

description: Thank you, good people of yelp, for suggesting this place. It was delicious. The service was on point. I'll definitely be back.
author: Bess K.

description: Pork belly rice plate was delicious. The yellow curry was creamy and had a slight sweetness that was just perfect. Top notch Thai food, really no other place that beats it in SF.
author: Elisa L.

description: Loved all the dishes we ordered. Great, fresh flavors. Was nice to see unusual protein options you would t find at most Thai restaurants such as rabbit, venison, frog legs, and alligator.
author: Mao X.

description: Best thai place in the city! Amazing authentic thai food and so much variety! They have 3 locations! A must have
author: Lara C.

description:
It was my dear friend's bday and we were looking for a restaurant close to our school to grab dinner and champagne after class to celebrate. One of the girls picked this place. Since it's a block away from campus and on the muni 19 route, I was all for it.

2 out of 3 of us are vegetarians (this is my 10th day, she's been one for the past 6 years). We ordered the red curry tofu: AMaziNG
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/WFgRFq_KxIs2fkYo1iD6Tg?select=Mv5EeBsxgZ0qhZEzpdraxg#1pZkIWbffxV4eAI68sYk7w

We also ordered spicy tofu (was much too spicy for me to eat at the time, but still very  good), Jasmine rice, veggie fried rice & honey prawns: 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/WFgRFq_KxIs2fkYo1iD6Tg?select=Mv5EeBsxgZ0qhZEzpdraxg#frxqqvyGzY1IbjYC8j30yQ

The best part of the evening was that the restaurant let us bring our own cake to celebrate. When it was time for dessert, they dimmed the lights, lit candles and sang to her. That was very polite and considerate of them: 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/WFgRFq_KxIs2fkYo1iD6Tg?select=Mv5EeBsxgZ0qhZEzpdraxg#bME0T0zuAWKnu01YRby0RA

This place has very good food, champagne, and a friendly staff. While celebrating, the debate was on TV and we were all ecstatic that Obama won (we all had a feeling he would).
author: Court S.

description: Growing pain have hit this once quaint restaurant but if you stick to the basic you are still going to be very happy. Their duck larb is phenomenal. Pay close attention to the little bits of toasted rice powder in this dish. Absent in around 98% of Thai restaurants in the American, this little detail adds the required texture to perfect this dish. It's painstaking to make and as such is usually absent. Another excellent experience in the som tam with fermented crab. Don't worry, although raw in consistency, it is cured; I've eaten a dozen times with no problem. One try and you will be addicted. Another great app is the dried beef. Paired with a semi-spicy flavorful sauce, it's a perfect app to share with beer and friends. Arroy mak!!
author: Brian J.

description: Waited a bit longer than anticipated, and even after we were seated we had to wait a long time to get our food. Table for 3 and they didn't bring everybody's food at the same time. I got mine, 10 minutes later my husband got his and then our friend got his meal about 10 minutes later. That totally blew our dinner, but the food was amazing. That's why I'm giving this place 4 stars. They made it right with the food. Otherwise they would have gotten only 2 stars. That's how bad the service was!
author: Shirin P.

description: I've been this place several times and food are always delicious and clean. It's it a little bit busy at dinner time, but it's okay. The food setting looks clean and fresh and people who work there are nice.
author: Amy L.

description:
The food: we ordered Pad Thai, Fried Rice, and Pad Kra Pao. The Pad Thai was good. The food overall was good. It reminded me of some of the Thai restaurants I've been to.

The service: could be better. Our drinks weren't refilled. While I think it's nice that the server offers to pack our food to go, I do prefer to pack it myself.  The server didn't understand what I was trying to tell her and took our food to the back and packed it. She took a while to pack it. Having watched too many restaurant shows, it made me uncomfortable not being able to see where my left over food went and why it took so long to pack two plates of left over.

Anyway, this place was good. But it wasn't anything out of this world compared to all the other many, many thai restaurants I've been to.
author: JD W.

description:
Overall: 3 stars 

First dinner of the new year with my boyfriend and his family who were visiting from out of town. Came upon Yelp recommendation. 

Decor/Ambiance: This place is quite trendy. The quotes on the wall are so meta. And I really like the tables and chairs. It's very modern yet authentic. 

Food: My party and I were totalllly eating with our eyes so ordered a ton. I got the pad see ew with beef, my boyfriend ordered the one of the soups (can't remember the name - has lime in it), tilapia and some friend rice. The rest of the group ordered more fried rice I believe and a curry dish. So I loved everything my bf ordered and hated what I got.. go figure. The pad see ew was EW. It was SO bland. I can't even express how disappointed I was by the utter lack of flavor. Bleh.  

Service: Service was fine, no complaints there. My party actually ended up staying forever - like literally 4 hours - and no one at all made us feel pressured to leave. Granted the drinks were a'flowing so it was in their best interest to make us feel at home, but still... you know some restaurants try to get you in and out asap. That was not the case here. 

Pro tip: Definitely make a reservation, no matter how small your party.
author: Jennifer O.

description: Food was ok but not great. Waited almost 40 minutes to get it though.  Nice atmosphere and nice staff just need to get their act together.
author: S C.

description:
I have to say that this thai food place has some definite authentic taste.

I ordered the papaya salad, the curry, and the Pad Kra Prow Moo Krob (crispy pork). They were all pretty good but I do have to say that the portion was pretty small. However, this place is way more flavorful than the tasteless King of Thai Noodle House, and definitely worth a try

In terms of service, a worker did spill a full cup of wine on me but it was clearly an accident. They did give us 20% off the whole bill so I guess that's fine. The ambience is very nice and it is somewhere you can bring a date.

TLDR; food is good so try it here, but beware of the wine spiller!
author: Edward C.

description:
Tucked away in one of the seedier parts of the Tenderloin is this gem!  The menu does have some of your typical Thai dishes, but one should not go after those such as the Pad Thai!  Their menu is extensive and has such attractive items that you may not find at other Thai restaurants such as pork belly & for the adventurous, frog.  I was surprised, that they were able to take reservations for the same day for a smaller party of 3..especially knowing how popular this place is, but glad they did of course!

We shared: the duck larb salad, pork belly, yellow chicken curry, & mixed veggies with tofu.  My friend can't handle heat well so we ordered the pork belly & chicken curry, "mild."  However, the mild definitely does pack heat; the proof was in the glasses of water we were chugging through out dinner & my heart burn that I got after.  Nonetheless, the food is AMAZING!  The duck in the duck larb salad isn't greasy at all, and the lime dressing gives the perfect contrast to the salty & fatty flavor of the duck.  The pork belly was tantalizing and yes...still hot even though we requested mild, but I do like my spicy (spicy enough) food.  The yellow curry & the tofu with veggies were pretty good too, but the stars of this meal were of course the guilty pleasures of the fatty pork belly & their highly regarded duck larb salad.  I'm so glad our first time trying duck larb was at Lers Ros.  

Service was very friendly and it started getting crowded when we started eating on that Friday night.  Portions are generous and prices are reasonable.  I suggest you call ahead to make reservations.  I will be coming back to this location (the original) or the Hayes Valley one for more delicious (not widely seen) Thai food).
author: Cat C.

description:
Visited today for a Quick bite. I've had take here before but never sat down in the restaurant. As always the food is great, today I had a lunch special BBQ chicken and green curry. 
Service is great, Sara greeted me promptly and took my order. Definitely need to come back.
author: Agustin B.

description:
I highly recommend ordering the pork shoulder appetizer. It's perfectly cooked tenderness marinated in deliciousness. 

All the other dishes I've tried are also pretty tasty. :)
author: Lainey D.

description:
We've had a lot of Thai food over the years, with most being super Americanized and in a environment that is less than desirable.  With that said, I have no issue with going to restaurants that look like a dump but have great food.  In the case of Lers Ros Thai you will get the best of both worlds, great food in a modern CLEAN restaurant setting.

Only one simple recommendation.  Stay away from the basic Pad Thai dishes.  Not that they are aren't good, but this is a place where you want to experience real Thai food. Pick from their "Specialties" menu and you won't be disappointed, plus you may run across a flavor you have never experienced before.
author: Jim G.

description:
Love the pork shoulder appetizer! Grilled to perfection and seasoned generously with chilli and rice powder. I wanted to have more!

The thai herb sausage is pretty good too, though slightly on the spicer side.

I came here with a friend and both of us shared the two appetizers and a fried rice. We had enough to take home :)

Definitely coming back again to try some of their more exotic selections on their menu!
author: Christina N.

description: You would not guess it by its location but the food here is incredible. I came here with a large group from work and we waited a good 30 minutes, but it was worth the wait. We had family style dining and all the dishes were delicious.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
Made an online reservation for 5 a few weeks in advance and although they weren't too packed, they still had our table waiting for us even with us being 15 minutes late. 

Heads up, as this is in the middle of the Tenderloin, parking can be difficult to find (especially on the weekend).  Also, definitely make a reservation online if you're coming on the weekend of expect a 30+ minute wait. 

We all ordered dishes a la carte and shared family style. So. Much. Food. MUST ORDER #25 DUCK LARB, SPICY. I could live off this dish and this dish alone. So tangy and spicy - it's perfection. I don't think I've tried a dish I didn't like and this is our third time here.
author: Ashley Nicole C.

description:
What an exciting menu! Venison, wild boar, frog, alligator and more. I was very excited to dine here and was looking forward to tasting the house specials. 

The food was great and the menu did not disappoint.

Papaya salad was delicious and very flavorful. The fish sauce was prominent but in a pleasant way. My "mild" spice level salad was quiet spicy (which I suspected would be the case and glad I asked for mild). Too bad that the generic tomatoes were used instead of the cherry or grape. The other two dishes - alligator and venison in light coconut curry had more than a kick. The alligator was so good that I almost ordered another. And for desert, of course, it was mango sticky rice. The rice was a bit al dente but still succulent. 

I usually don't care too much about the service (unless it's (amazing or bluntly shitty) but today's service was worth writing about. I don't even know where to start except from its core definition - dysfunctional. When we arrived, there was a substantial line outside. We came inside to put our names on the list. It only took 5 minutes. The running sting waiters seem to be too busy to pay attention to us. Then we tried to ask whether we could sit by the bar and the waitress would run by us with "just a moment please." She did that 4 times. I started to feel amused . 20 minutes later we received an invitation to sit by the bar (that was empty during this time) and a long explanation of some imaginary process. Ok...busy night, no problem. We ordered our food. 30+ minutes later, we received our appetizer. Then a relatively short wait to the main course. During the meal, we asked for water and beer. The beer was served quickly but I had to ask for water 3 times, despite that it was already poured and waiting to be given to a certain individual (at that point) dying of thirst. And then, I had nerve to ask about ones. A blank look later, I gave up. 


Tips:

1. Do not come here if in a hurry and in any case, make sure to bring a healthy dose of patience. The service is utterly dysfunctional - slow, confused and disorganized. 

2. It's pretty spicy. The mild (as in my papaya salad) means at least medium. 

3. Don't forget to bring your curiosity and open mind and try the more exotic dishes.
author: Anat N.

description:
I surely don't write reviews for the owners of these so called, hip delicious, exciting joints (how is food exciting anyhow?).  It's for the unsuspecting people who would waste their money in a clip joint like this.  Firstly, not their fault but if I wanted to step over bums and sniff urine and vomit on my way to eat, I'd eat here.  No, I don't think any of that is hip or cool.  Again not their fault, the fault of the Mayor etc. Bad area!!!!!!!! Especially at night!!!  

   However, this is for food and service.  Bottom line, the food is hit or miss but it's expensive and nothing was "amazing".  Typical wait staff, poorly training, I don't give a crap attitude, not smiling with a face like they just ate a crap sandwich plastered on their mugs.  Who needs it, not me!!! Smile a little, say thank you, your welcome, my pleasure ANYTHING!!!  Last time in - left zero tip.  Sorry folks not a millennial, "maybe they were having a bad day".  Nope, really bad service, no tip.  Ooooo sorry, here's a tip for them, train your staff, smile, make money.
author: Rusty G.

description:
After the Asian Art Museum, we wanted to have Thai food and went to Larkin since it was near by.  The service was good, lots of smiles and attention.  The decor was OK, they had a nice natural wooden counter.

Portions were adequate, looked big due to the large plates
The fish cakes was pretty standard
The belly pork was scrumptious with the crispy skin
Beef pad Thai did not disappoint with lots of bean sprouts though.
The curry duck was good but not enough duck
Rice was only $2 per portion
Overall a good experience, will go back to try other dishes.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Lived in Bang saen fo a while and the food here is spot on!  Owner is from Chonburi and the food is authentic and local!
author: Bob N.

description:
First time here today and I must say the food is delicious! I really loved the Thai style papaya salad. Everything we ordered were so good. There were nothing to complain about! You must try their coconut juice. I had three cups so you know it was yummy!

I will definitely be back here soon! :)
author: Stephanie N.

description:
I'm no Thai food expert or have ever been to Thailand, I have to say the Thai food here is very good.  I was discouraged by the wait and Brenda's, so I made my way here.  I've seen crowds at this place many times as I drove by during the evening and the reviews seem to back that up.  Walked in about a half hour after opening and was the first customer of the day.  Inside was clean and service was good, which I didn't quite expect because of its ghetto-ish location.

I ordered a lunch special with two items - beef red curry and chicken basil.  The thing that stood out was their pungent flavor...some places I've been to just turns up the salt to add flavor, but this was not the case.  Made me think this is what Thai food probably tastes like in Thailand.
author: Leland H.

description:
For all the Thai options in the tender, lers ros looks nice on decor but is way overhyped. Pad thai to go was horrible. Lacked flavor, barely had any prawns, was dry and portions were sad. 

Last time I came to sit down, I got some noodle soup recommended by the server. Can't really describe what was so average about it but that says something in itself for the price. One positive aspect is that they have a lot of options.
author: Connie W.

description: If you love MSG, this place is for you. An added feature is that at least 2 workers watch you eat until you're done. At your last bite, they bring a table right next to yours so you get the hint that you are to leave. Enjoy.
author: Nadeem M.

description:
I have been searching San Francisco for good Thai food and I finally found it at Lers Ros Thai! All Thai food lovers should absolutely pay a visit. They have an extensive menu of, what I have been told, is authentic Thai food. I stuck with ordering Pad Thai, as I wanted to compare it to other Pad Thai dishes I have had in San Francisco. The Lers Rose Pad Thai was the best I've had in the city! It was a large portion, leaving me with enough leftovers, for only $10. The coconut curries are also delicious. 

They did try and rush us out the door as soon as we got our food, which I didn't like. But either way I would still recommend Lers Ros as a must try in San Francisco.
author: Aletta B.

description:
I was just visiting from LA. The uber driver told me this is the best Thai place in town so I decided to get lunch here.

The place looks clean and sleek. I sat at the bar and ordered the papaya salad with grilled prawns and the yellow curry with prawns (can you tell I love seafood?). They were really delicious. They have a nice selection of wines. I think the portions were a bit small so I took a star off. I do recommend this place though.
author: Hannah T.

description:
One of the better restaurants in SF. 
Their ingredients taste super fresh which was a plus.

11) Garlic Frog   $9.95 House special dish, fried Frog with a rich flavor of garlic, served with hot sauce
It was good. It was crispy and garlicy.

62) Pad Kra Prow Moo Krob     Stir-fried pork belly with crispy rind and Basil leaves
The crispy pork was my least favorite.  The skin was too hard and I was indifferent to taste of the pork belly.


13) Som Tom Koong Yang     $9.95 Shredded green papaya salad with chili, tomatoes, lime based salad dressing & GRILLED PRAWNs
This could have been more tangy but it was still good. We got that extra spicy and it was a good level for me. Not too spicy but not too mild. Very flavorful and fresh.

32) Tom Juerd Pla Muk Yuud Sai      $12.95 Stuffed calamari with house special broth, vegetable and egg tofu
This was good but the squid was a tad tough.  It tastes like radish broth more than seafood.  

111) Tom Yum Pla Kra Pong      $29.95 Whole fresh sea bass in spicy and sour soup (Guarantee fresh fish everyday)
The steamed sea bass was great.  Yes it is $30 for this fresh dish but I think it was worth it.  The sea bass was soft and tender and the Tom yum broth it was in was flavorful.  

I liked my Thai Iced Coffee as well. Sweet and creamy, just the way I like. 

I would definitely come back to try the other items on the menu.  They have a lot of choices. No wait at 3pm on a Monday.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Okay, okay, this update is long overdue, considering I've had Lers Ros four more times, in the last month or two alone: thrice for delivery, and once at the restaurant proper. And boy, what a difference it makes when you have someone who knows what to order!

My defaults now include their green papaya salad with prawns, crispy pork belly, pad thai, and crab fried rice, with a few new dishes here and there just to explore their ridiculously extensive 11+ page menu. The defaults are defaults, because, well, they're pretty damn good: the papaya salad is nice and refreshing, yet with a fairly strong kick to it; the pad thai and crab fried rice, while being fairly typical dishes, are done very well, with the pad thai not made as sweet as at many a Thai restaurant; and the pork belly is simply awesome delicious.

Other dishes I've tried, and recall, include their tom yum soup (also quite good), their sweet and sour chicken, and their fried tofu, both of which were a bit lackluster in comparison.

Their free delivery within SF is certainly a huge plus, usually delivered within 45 minutes to an hour after you call in. And if it tastes this good delivered, it can only be better in person right? RIght - especially for things like the pork belly and tofu, where their crispy skins suffer from being steamed in the take-out boxes. So, if you can, go in person. And either go on an off-night, early, or with reservations, because, as my previous review will tell you with painful repetition, waiting for a table sucks. And if you really don't want to wait, and are familiar with the menu, you can even call in your order so it's ready by the time you're seated!
author: Johnny W.

description: The dish was excellently prepared. But waiting for a table seemed like a hassle even after having a reservation. The service was extremely slow. After waiting 30min to get seated we waited another 10min for water, then waited another 20min just to order. Only came to us after we flagged the waiters down several times. Overall food was great, but service can be better.
author: Marten P.

description: With high reviews, my husband and I gave it a try. It was pretty disappointing. The food is just all right. The chicken is kinda dry. Papaya salad is too salty. And the fish better, but still dry. The services is quick and good.
author: Ting W.

description: As you are walking through the tenderloin you never would expect to walk into this lovely delicious restaurant. But here we are, dinner before a show at the American Music Hall. Curry puff pastry as a starter was like a light and fluffy samosa. Steak special and green papaya salad (with prawns!)... Reviews said authentic, I agree! hott too! Nice range in the wine list and service was friendly and easy. We will be back!
author: Pearl P.

description: Pad Thai was great, as well as Tom kha kai. The sweet and sour chicken was definitely lacking and there was barely and chicken, vegetables were hard and obviously barely cooked.   Constructive criticism
author: Genevieve G.

description:
I love tom yum, it's one of my favorite soups. I heard great things about this place, so our table ordered one to share. When it came, we were so excited, but after one sip we all started coughing because of how spicy it was. We told our waitress that we couldn't eat it because it was just too spicy ( and trust me, I can eat spicy) and asked her if they would re make it. She said " once it's done, then we cannot change it, we can do it better next time" our table was like... "Uhh what, you didn't even asked us how spicy we wanted it" and she just ignored it. How rude is that? We told her to take it away, and she did and still charged us for it. None of us could even finish one small bowl. This level of services is unacceptable. Making tom yum is not hard, and I've had more than I can count ( including the time I went to Thailand) sigh ... I was expecting more of this highly rated place.

Garlic rabbit was ok. A little dry
Tofu with eggplant was good.
Pad see ew was bland.

Im usually pretty generous with my ratings, and I don't give many one stars unless things are terrible, but a bad service and attitude always deserves a -2 stars. Not coming back.
author: Mily W.

description:
Great thai place in San Francisco. Went there with a group of friends and it was worth the wait. The place is not huge; however, it was larger than expected.  

Crispy Tofu- Was a little disappointed in this dish to be honest; hence the 1 star knock down. It was bland and not even the sauce (or sriracha) could save it. 
Chicken Pad Thai- An amazing rendition of the classic dish. Flavorful and a huge portion. More on the peanut side of pad thai which I appreciated. 
Pad Kee Mao- This dish definitely has a spicy kick and is probably not for those who are very sensitive to spice. I was able to handle bites of my friend's dish (which was delicious), but probably would not have been able to finish it myself. 

Will definitely be back to try other dishes when I'm in town next.
author: Diane J.

description:
Amazing! The wait staff was attentive and polite.  Their menu selection and drink selection are huge with all your favorite options. The lunch specials are $8.95 and come with a side salad with a lightly flavored coconut vinaigrette.  You can select two main corse lunch items.  The green and red curry are delicious!
Best Pad Thai ever!!! The Garlic pork was super good too!! The atmosphere at lunch time on a week day was really loud.  We arrived at 11:45 AM and the place was empty; within 30 minutes the place was packed...a large group arrived with about 30 people and they had their table set and ready for them with food. Can get kind of jot in there but worth it!
author: Amy L.

description:
Good food- Terrible Service
I went to this place yesterday. The place was packed with people which was good since it meant that they had good food. However there was no air-conditioning. It was hot and humid as hell inside. 
I went with a large group and we ordered our appetizers and then the entrees. They took more than half an hour to get an appetizer which we accepted.
When it was time for the entrees, they got 5 out of 7 orders within 30 mins but took more than an hour(yes) to get the remaining(the one remaining was pad see ew, a dish fairly easy to cook). Since we had to leave by 8, i had to cancel my order since there was no point having it to go. 
Management- please install an AC and improve the order management system.
author: Dipanjan S.

description:
A total hype in my opinion.

Pros: Accepts CC, good Pad Thai, great customer service
Cons: Loud, somewhat salty pork belly, greasy noodles,....

My friend and I came here for lunch around 12:30pm and there was a large volume of people in the restaurant. Luckily for us, it looked liked the end of the long center row of communal tables opened up and we were seated rather quickly.

After the waitress took our order, it was a quick five to 10 minutes before my Pad Thai came out and shortly after, my friend's Pad Kee Mow and our pork belly. The initial tasting of both of our noodle dishes was that the noodles were very greasy. As good as both dishes were, I think I would have liked them more if they were a little more dry. But nonetheless, the pad thai was very good in my opinion. The pork belly was a total let down. A lot of other yelpers have said that the pork belly was delicious, but my friend and I have definitely have had better pork belly from other places. The pork belly, or I should say pork rinds, because that's what they were basically, were resting on a pool of salty oil. The bell peppers were my favorite part of that particular dish.

The waitresses are very friendly and very attentive despite the fact that I could barely hear my friend in conversation. The only thing about the one waitress that we got the check from was that when she took our leftovers to get packed togo, the bean sprouts from our plates were gone, my lemon was gone and everything was stuffed into itty bitty takeout boxes. Not cool. 

I also ordered togo orders of Pad Thai and Pad Kee Mow and I can't tell if the proportions were the same as dining in, but then half of the pad thai was bean sprouts and the Pad Kee Mow looked measly. I can't help but take another star away....

I can definitely find the same quality of Thai food closer to my house, and at somewhat cheaper prices. I am not saying this is not a good restaurant, but this is definitely not "The best Thai place in SF."
author: Alex T.

description:
On our latest foray to Lers Ros the other night, we took quick spots at the counter.  The renovation has greatly improved the ambiance over my last visit.  However, the food...
We ordered:
Kao Mun Kai Tod (garlic rice with crispy chicken).  The rice was great.  But the battered chicken, while mildly seasoned with SE Asian flavors, was better suited to a basket of fish and chips.
Pad Prik Khing with pork.  Way too much galingal.  Green beans were actually UNDER cooked.  Unpleasantly salty.
But, on checking my bank statement online a few days later...
I WAS CHARGED TWICE!
I called them immediately and they started to give me a runaround until I became quite forceful.  They refunded my card the following morning to avoid my in-person visit.
Had I not noticed, they would have obviously not done anything about it.
My feeling, just a gut feeling, is this is a lapse that happens frequently here; the second charge was levied the morning after our dinner.  So, their accountant is in the habit of going over all charges and running them again if there is any abnormality (our dinner was quite late...?).  Apparently without doing a thorough check to verify payment.  Not cool.
Buyer Beware!
author: Josh K.

description:
Our friend is a big fan of this place (he lives right around the corner) and insisted that we come here. I'm really glad that we did :)

We came after the last night of Outside Lands at about 11pm. Food and the service were great even this late at night since it was still quite busy! I ordered the #41 Pad Pak Raummit  Rice (a stir-fried mixed vegetables and tofu in bean sauce dish for $9.95) and the #48 Pad Thai Pak (a stir-fried and thai noodles dish with tofu, egg, mixed vegetables, bean sprouts and crushed peanuts for $9.95). Both are vegetarian dishes and I thought they were very tasty. My fiance and our friend shared these dishes with me as well as the yellow chicken curry and a beef dish (sorry, can't remember these numbers!). 

We had...some thai, some beers, a few laughs. Our f*****g troubles are over, Dude.
author: Amanda C.

description: The best Thai food in America hands down.  I've tried everything here and it's amazing.  I recommend this place to my friends who ask me where they should eat when they are in town.  Duck Larb, Shrimp Paste Fried Rice, Pad see ew, Yellow curry all amazing!
author: Jay H.

description:
I came here expecting just really good standard thai fare. Instead, what I got was exceptional, unique variants of thai dishes with unexpected meats, like venison and eel options. Service was FAST as well - so as soon as you get seated (which can take a while if you come on a busy night), you'll at least be eating shortly after.

We had the:
Thai curry puffs - 5/5 - basically curried potato samosas in puff pastry shells, with peanut dipping sauce (...obviously it was good). Four of them, decent sized but not ginormous.

Duck salad (it was called the duck lard or something?) - 5/5 - lime dressing on the salad is killer - nice and light. Really worked with the chunks of roasted duck (with a bit of crisp on some of them) and crunchy red onions spread throughout it. 

Venison - 4/5 - sauce was spicy and oily, which was nice because the meat, although excellent, was a bit on the chewier side (which was to be expected). Overall I'd definitely do the dish again.

We ordered things SPICY but it could have been even spicier. He handed us a jar of chili flakes that I dumped over everything, including the rice. 

But damn. The meal was really good. Next time I'm going to ask for even spicier and try a few of the other "out there" items.
author: Sylvia L.

description:
Just had their vegetarian tofu yellow curry with brown rice tonight! Sooooo delicious! Wish I took a pic but we all dug in too quickly.

Ordered at 11 15 and the delivery guy arrived shortly after!! Really love Ler Ros Thai's efficiency and consistently stellar food! 

** delivery minimum is 20usd, which is easily met after you order a curry with brown rice & another appetizer or something!
author: Amber S.

description: Great Thai food. We had the Pad See Ew with shrimp and the red curry chicken. Just the right amount of spicy with the curry. Lots of flavor. The Pad had perfectly cooked noodles in a sauce that was rich without being overbearing. The only real and big problem with eating here was the temperature which was in the high 80s. No A/C and one puny fan doing little good. It wasn't till I was outside afterward that I felt any relief. I won't eat in again, but I'd order take-out in a second.
author: David A R.

description: Cute atmosphere - food was really good (chicken Pad se ew and Chicken Pad thai).  service was very attentive.
author: Darlene O.

description:
My sister made res. for three. Thank god she did because the place was packed!! 

This place was amazing! We ordered the fried trout and it was fried to perfection! It was nicely balance with a spicy sauce on the side. Definitely one of my favorite thai fish dishes. We also ordered the spicy papaya salad and pork belly. All of which are equally delicious! The pork belly had so much flavor to it and even though it was a little fatty, that's what made the dish! The flavor and texture. 

I still crave this place. I can't wait to go back to SF to stop by here again. One of the top Thai places i've been to, ever!
author: Christina N.

description: Some dishes are great but the servers can be rude.  10.95 for rice and broccoli is ridiculous.
author: Peter R.

description: We order delivery from here every couple months. The food is fantastic. Only dropping to four stars because it can be tough to order (lots of background noise on their end), and delivery takes longer than most places -- regularly over an hour. If you aren't starving, definitely worth the wait.
author: Christopher J.

description: Came here on my birthday last Friday, it was packed at 11pm. Still got a table so it was cool. Ordered some chicken satay, Tom kha gai and some vegetarian dish with bamboo shoots and curry.  Definitely will be back to try some other items just because we were trying to be in and out and head to temple. The workers are really nice. Reminds me of my laotian side of the fam.
author: Deven P.

description:
My girlfriend got us tickets to the SF Symphony and to make it extra special since we're still celebrating my birthday from 2 weeks ago, she said she took me to dinner too.  

I have never heard of this place before.  We walked in at around 5:30pm and there was nobody there but towards the end of dinner, the place was packed to the brim.  

We got seated and that's when they announced all drinks were free because they were celebrating their 6th anniversary.  I wasn't sure I heard them right so u asked again 1 drink for free?  They said no, ALL drinks are free.  Wow, it's indeed our lucky night.  Not only that, they had a live jazz band playing while we were having dinner!

We got the sea bass from their chef menu, beef in garlic sauce and papaya salad.  Everything was delicious - to die for!  Our server, Preow, presented us with a table cloth from Thailand as a souvenir after we finished eating.  Who does that?!

Incredible service, amazing food and the nicest restaurant I've ever dined at in my 43 years.  I will be back for their 7th anniversary.  I love this place.
author: Sharon C.

description:
I came here for dinner with my husband on Saturday night. There were a decent number of people waiting  outside the restaurant but it took approximately 20 minutes to get seated. 

The tables are close but it doesn't seem invasive. It's  loud but not to the point where you're yelling across the table. The food is fantastic, especially for the prices. I ordered the pad see ew and it was reasonably priced and it was a large portion. 

The only downside is the service. The waitress didn't reach us for about 10 minutes after we sat down and my husband's food came about 10 minutes before mine arrived. It's a bit awkward to receive your food after your husband is already halfway finished his own dish. 

Overall, great atmosphere and great food for the price.
author: Joyce P.

description:
Pretty good experience! Not a long wait for a Saturday night, which was well appreciated, about 15min. The food was quite good.
