Lers Ros is authentic, inviting, clean and pretty busy because it is one of the best places to grab Thai Food! While it is located in a rather... questionable part of town, as soon as you step inside.. you will be so glad you did. I ate past the point of fullness and then ate some more!

Spicy Scale:
Mild- Probably the equivalent of hot cheetos and siracha
Medium- You will need water. Your mouth will be stinging  and you will be doing that hissing thing sssk sssk.
Spicy- All the ice and milk in the world won't help you now.

We ordered:
Larb- Really good! Authentic to what I tried in Phuket. Great sharing portion and they aren't heavy with the rice powder so the texture and flavor is really good! For all you healthnuts, this is a really great dish that packs a ton of flavor

Pad Kee Mow- flavorful and not an insane amount of grease that will leave you all lip glossy. :) I really enjoyed this dish a lot

Pork Belly (Pad Kra Prow Moo Krob)- DELISH!! Def not the healthiest...obviously a bit greasy but so worth it! Great texture, definitely crunchy and the sauce goes well with it.. not too overwhelming. Must try! It's different from most dishes I have had at other thai joints. I would not advise leaving any left over because it tastes best fresh.

Mango sticky rice- This was very good and quite different from the other ones that I have tried. They don't give you a lot of mango, but the rice to mango ratio was perfect anyways. The rice his more moist than I usually have but it was amazing. I think they use more coconut milk in their recipe. Also the sesame crunchy thingies sprinkled on top is such a great addition to this dish.
author: Jenn L.

description:
RUDE!!!!!

I can't even comment on the food since we weren't even able to get into the restaurant. I know one thing, I will never spend my money at this place. 

We didn't know they open at 5 for dinner (according to the sign on the door) but we were there around 4:30. We decided to wait around since we've been wanting to try their food for a while.  3 minutes before 5pm we walked to the front door and saw the workers standing there so I opened the door and asked politely if we can come in and the one lady answered "No, you can't. We still have to finish cleaning up." Knowing that sometimes things happen, I asked, "10 more minutes then?"  She said "NO" Who would want to stay after being treated like that? We didn't even have a chance to try their food or have a chance to experience their extremely rude service
author: Nume C.

description: favorite thai place so far in this part of the city
author: Sandy J.

description: Went with a group of 5 and loved every dish I tried. I'll get the crab fried rice and crunchy, garlicy frog legs again.
author: Catia G.

description: Very good. Authentic. The tom yum soup is legit. Not sweet like all the other thai restaurents in america. A thai friend recommended this place to me. You know it must be good ;)
author: Ken T.

description:
I am used to southern California Thai food.  HOLLYWOOD Thai food.

Ever since moving to SF/ Bay Area I have been on the hunt for really good authentic Thai food. My favorite dish is Pra ka prow moo krob ( chilli and basil with crispy roast pork).  Most restaurants don't even carry the crispy pork.

I was so happy to find Lers Ros Thai.  Creeping through the yelp photos I found my favorite dish on here.

I went last night with my BFF from LA and he is also a huge Hollywood Thai fan and we both agree this place is totally legit.  It is pretty nice inside and totally doesn't look or feel like a hole in a wall.

The dish is not as good as my usual spot in LA  http://www.yelp.com/biz/ruen-pair-restaurant-los-angeles

but... a great alternative if im not in LA.
author: Anne-Mary P.

description:
Amazing.
I'm not Thai and I haven't eaten in a thousand Thai places, but I do love Thai food. I ordered some type of duck in an amazing sauce and I couldn't get enough of it.

Seating is tables as well as a picnic table type of set up that is more communal. Service was by several Thai young ladies and was very good. Prices are very reasonable. The location is a few steps into the Tenderloin, but that's no big deal.

Even in a city with so many amazing restaurants, I will go back there again soon.
author: Robert D.

description: A well executed Thai Restaurant! Blindfolded, and pick one from the menu, the chances are they are good or very very good! Highly recommended are their family style menu, since these are their main forte. The crispy stir fried crispy pork, pat prik king, papaya salad, duck salad and grilled shoulder pork are my personal favorite. Try to broaden your thai food acumen by ordering beyond pad thai! You will discover a hidden gem, chest of treasure gourmand at this place!
author: Dan A.

description:
Delicious authentic thai food! 

We ordered the #9 Koh Moo Yang (roasted pork shoulder), the #25 Larb Phed Yang (duck larb), and the #78 Pad thai. The pork shoulder was super tender and had a delicious fatty taste almost like pork belly. It also came with a super yummy sauce to dip in. The duck larb had great chunks of duck in it, and a zesty limey sauce. Finally the pad thai was probably the best I've ever had at a thai restaurant. 

Definitely would come back again!
author: Jeff C.

description: Crab Fried Rice... best I've ever had. They have good iced Thai tea as well. Just a great place for some Good Thai food!
author: Roy O.

description:
This place overall is awesome. I have been there two times for dinner. 

Usually it is very busy. I am not sure if it accepts reservations. Have in mind that there will be 15 minutes waiting. The food is great, tasty, and high quality, the portions normal and the prices as expected, not expensive. The environment warm, clean with nice decoration. 

Why do I have 4 stars instead of 5? Because the waiters never smile. Both times I felt bad because the people were not friendly and welcoming. The service is fast, I do not have any   specific complaint. However, they are too "cold".
author: Elpiniki A.

description:
Where to go when your flight into SFO arrives at a crazy late time? Great question. Answer = Lers Ros Thai! I was debating between a couple late night restaurants that would still be open on a Thursday evening (trust me there's only a few good ones) but we ended up settling for thai. We arrived around 11:30pm and the place still had a decent amount of people in it. Surprisingly, we weren't the last ones to show up!

We were hungry so we ordered a couple dishes to share. We barely had to wait, food came out very, very quickly. We had:
- One of the noodle dishes on their daily special page ($9-10) - noodles with vegetables and pork. I'm a sucker for any type of noodle dish and this one was great.
- Frog ($14) - came with vegetables and bite sized pieces of frog (think chicken wings). Very tasty but my dad didn't like how there wasn't much meat on them. Guess it's a specialty for a reason.
- Kang keaw wan ($12) - green curry with eggplant, bamboo shoots, red peppers, lime leaves and chicken. So delicious and perfect with the rice.
- Jasmine rice ($1.50)

Everything was delicious and the service was crazy fast. Love how this place is open so late! Yay for good late night eats and not having to eat some crappy junk food. Definitely agree with everyone else about this place being one of/the best Thai place in SF!
author: Jonny M.

description: I really enjoyed my experience here and would definitely recommend it to others.  The place has a clean minimalist vibe with writing on the wall explaining what the restaurant name means.  The staff were quick and friendly.  I think I had some sort of spicy noodle beef dish and it was a really good time.  I told them spicy and it came out spicy.  They brought out more spice and jalapenos for me which I really appreciated.  I totally want to go back.  Oh!  I also had beef skewers and they were quite large, so I had plenty to eat that afternoon.  Definite 5 stars!
author: Shaun W.

description: We've been here twice in a week, and both times absolutely amazing! It's a smaller restaurant, but they're quick to get you seated and very accommodating.  The food is absolutely delicious.  Each of the items we got- tom yum soup, drunken noodles, pad thai, red curry- were all awesome... perhaps the best we've ever had.  Highly recommend this place.  Can't wait to get back.
author: Veeral S.

description: The pad Thai was good but when they delivered my food to my hotel room they didn't give me utensils and when I said why isn't there any in the bag she said " you didn't ask for it"  I shouldn't have to ask!! they should always Put it for delivery. Didn't like that at all. Let's see how good their food is..waiting for the food to digest... so far good.
author: Bita N.

description: This is an authentic Thai restaurant with great dishes and an extensive menu. Not your ordinary Thai restaurant. The crispy pork belly, moo ping, papaya salad were al hits. Dishes were full of flavor and reasonably sized. Prices were consistent with San Fran, not cheap but not too expensive. If you want to experience real Thai food,stop in here for a meal.
author: Nic J.

description: The food was wonderful! I enjoyed every dish I ordered. This is the place to go if you want good Thai food in San Francisco.
author: Angie N.

description:
My newest obsession. I honestly can't believe it took me so long to discover this place.  EXTENSIVE menu with so many delicious, authentic items.

Everything I've tried so far has been so tasty: pork belly, curry...and can we talk about the pad thai for a minute?

People are right, even something I consider basic was honestly the best I've had. The texture of the noodles, the umami taste...so many other Thai places I find myself eating the toppings and ditching the noodles but this pad thai is like when you find yourself eating the crust of a pizza because it's that good.

Best of all...they deliver. Free. Until midnight. I ordered delivery just days after my first experience and the process was easy and the delivery time around an hour.  Danger alert.  I feel myself becoming a serious regular.
author: Jen E.

description: I wish I can be more accurate and say this place is 4.5 stars, but rounding up since it was still very good. I ordered a Pad Thai and, in comparison to other thai places I've gone to, it's a little sweeter and the serving is huge (I'm a petite woman though and I couldn't finish maybe the last 10%). the decor and the music choice shouldn't intimidate you because this place was packin' after their 1-hour lunch/5pm. If I'm ever in the area again, be sure I'm coming straight here to eat.
author: Amy H.

description:
Yum.  Went here this evening to celebrate a friend's birthday.
So good.  I got the Kuay Tiew Rua with beef.  The broth was so delicious.  The papaya salad with shrimp was also tasty.  The pork belly was divine.


Prob the best Thai food I have ever had in SF.  I will be back, even if it is for another bowl of the kuay tiew rua.  mmm

Nice service as well.
author: Lisa M.

description:
Everything south of Geary, north of Market, and west of Van Ness is a bit sketchy at night (its the heart of the Tenderloin) but Lers Ros is located just on the edge of sketch so you're probably good. Definitely call ahead for a reservation if you want to eat in but they do have takeout which is a decent option because of the foregoing reason.

The place is pretty small and easy to miss. It is marked with a black awning with red lettering. Inside its nice and modern and elegant. Ambience is definitely suitable for a date and so prices are probably a bit more than your average Thai restaurant. 

The food here is absolutely delicious and probably my favorite place to eat Thai food in the city.  I love the larb duck salad, the pad kee mao, the green curry and the crispy pork belly. They use fresh ingredients, the food is clean tasting and flavorful.
author: Huy V.

description:
Som tam Thai (not on menu)- just like in Thailand. I requested this with the expected "???" Look or "no we don't have dried shrimp" but nope, with a smile she said "yes" and it wasn't skimping on the dried shrimp! Good hand sliced green papaya, sweet spicy fresh lime dressing, tomato, Asian snake green bean (wow! Not the thicker cheaper American kind)
Neur tod- just amazing, thin sliced beef, perfectly fried and spiced, fresh lime dressing. I should get it mild
Sticky rice- I wish mine came out as perfect as here, never overcooked, grains retain shape and chewy texture. 

Next time (note to self) 
Larb gai
Dried beef (must)
Sticky rice (must)
author: Sujan P.

description: Ive always loved ordered delivery from this restaurant. I'm rather disappointed that the last two times, the food has not been tasting as it should. I hope u will improve soon.
author: S L.

description: Fast service, delicious food! Loved this place! I just love pad thai! Will be back if I'm ever in that neck of the woods.
author: Carmelo W.

description:
Portions = huge. Bring an eating buddy.

Speedy service, delectable Thai food. The menu is large and in charge so be prepared to struggle to make a dining decision. We ordered a variety of items, sharing bites of each dish. 

On our Sunday night visit, this place was jamming. Countless hungry guests arrived anticipating a delicious Thai meal. Perhaps held up by patrons like us who took over 20 minutes to decide what to order.

I highly recommend the FLAMMING soup pot of Tom Kha Kai - coconut broth is a treat, just a hint of creaminess. The curry dishes are divine along with the noodles. Use your best judgment and order at will. Not much could go wrong. Unless you order the chunk frog legs, I suppose? We got a kick outta that one.
author: Breanna B.

description:
We'd tried the other location down in Hayes Valley a few months ago so when we were craving Thai for lunch, we figured we'd check out this location, a bit closer to our area. We showed up around lunch time on a Saturday and got seated quickly. 

I chose the Pad See Ew with tofu, one of my staples at most Thai restaurants while my companion picked his regular choice, Pad Kra Prow (spicy). Our dishes came out at different times but within a reasonable span. 

Both dishes were well-done and extremely flavourful. The servings aren't too large so it's easy to clean your plate. We didn't order an appetizer but felt like we were full enough without leaving any leftovers. 

This is a pretty good option if you want good quality Thai without being too expensive. It's a bit fancier than some of the more smaller places in the area but reasonable for lunch. 

I'm not a fan of the seats though.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Came here with a group of friends and we ordered take out. I bought the Duck Larb (Larb Phed Yang - Salad)

+ Friendly service
+ Tasty food
+ Nice environment
+ Value

I really enjoyed my visit and hopefully try more items on their menu. The duck in the salad was really savory and juicy and had that quality of spicy, sweet, salty and umami that makes Asian food so good. Just writing about it makes me hungry! :)

BOTTOM LINE: TASTY, THAI FOOD IS HERE
author: Jack T.

description:
Two things:
1. Get the pork belly, you will not regret.
2. Mild is spicy. Medium is on fire. Spicy is hell on Earth.

On my walk over here to Lers Ros in the TL I saw one crack whore butt crack, two peeing men, and one more doing the unspeakable. If you feel like braving the various stages of human digestion, come on down.


The servers at this bustling little hole-in-the-wall are quick and efficient without edging into pushy territory. Decor is cute-- random food quotes on the walls; dark wooden benches lining the restaurant instead of tables and chairs.

The seafood papaya salad is insanely spicy. Could not taste the other flavors besides heat. But papaya was nice and crunchy.

The waitress saw us suffering after we dug into the papaya salad and offered to change the spiciness level for our pork belly from medium to mild. The dish came about 30 seconds later so either she works at the speed of light or we ended up with medium heat anyway. Either way, the spiciness was actually just right. The skin of the pork belly was fried to a crisp so that you didn't feel disgusted eating whole chunks of fat. Some portions were too hard and almost took my teeth out. The lean meat portions were very tender and juicy. All in all my favorite of the night.

The pad see ew was sweet and savory. Packed full of flavor without being ridiculously oily like most pas see ews often become.
author: Chia L.

description:
Was here recently for lunch and we ordered from their $8.95 lunch combination menu.  You get a salad and two entrée items from a choice of sixteen items with white rice or brown rice for 50 cents more.

Kai Yang : BBQ marinated chicken, served with sweet chili sauce.  You get a leg/thigh for your entrée.  Good flavor.

Pad Kra Pow Kai : Minced Chicken stir-fried with Basil leaves and house special sauce.  Yum! This was delicious.

The waitress that took our orders and the servers that brought our dishes and refilled our water glasses were friendly and efficient.  

Overall, the food and experience was very good.  Will come back and try out the dinner menu and items suggested by other Yelp reviews
author: Al L.

description:
For a quick bite with familiar flavors of Thailand, I go to King of Thai.  For a real sit down, take me back to Thailand, I want more, don't let me come home, pray to the gods at the temples, play with the stray dogs, let's go see the ping pong show, type of authentic thai meal, I come to Lers Ros Thai in the TL.

There are more than enough reviews and pics here on Yelp for Lers Ros so I'm not going to get into how each dish makes me salivate like a mad dog with rabies.  I do, however, highly recommend coming here for your authentic dose of noms noms if you should ever find yourself fiending for real Thai food like all the crackheads for dope on every street corner here in the TL.

There are plenty of reasons why I am more of a die hard fan of Lers Ros Thai than I am of watching Krappernick play as our QB.  Here's a few of them...

I love how their grilled selection is done so authentically well that it brings me back to all those moments where I'd be at a random food cart in Thailand picking up perfectly grilled marinated pork neck, pork shoulder, and juicy chicken leg quarters with sticky rice served hot in clear plastic medium sized sandwich bags.  My Thai friends and I would pig out straight from those bags of grilled goodies and rice... no forks, no spoons, no knives, no toothpicks, no napkins. Just all out good ole primative chomping action. 

When we got to enjoy these grilled meats at a restaurant setting throughout Thailand, they would be served with a ridiculously appetizing dipping sauce made up mainly of lime juice, onions, rice powder, white pepper, cilantro, and often a few other spices.  I NEED that sauce in my life during my Thai dine ins ALWAYS these days.  They have that here.  I feel more complete with it by my side when taking down that delicious juicy fatty tender pork neck for the most part (my most favorite and nostalgic choice of meats).  

What I go nuts for is their selection of meats that sends me into a daydream of being back in Bangkok... the frog, the boar, the alligator, the tiger prawns, the raw shrimp, the rabbit, the quail, and then some.  I cannot deny my love for their menu for just those reasons alone, but I love them even more that there is more to love.  

Their lip smacking savory sweet spicy curries have those little eggplants that you don't normally see in restaurants here in SF, but these are just the same exact little eggplants you'll surely find on your travels there.  Then there's the stir fried rice noodle plates like pad see ew, pad kee mao, pad thai, and rad nar that I would assume is more addictive than the dope they sell just around the block.  It's impossible not to fall for the sweet savory exotic and spicy flavors that Thai food is so specially known for.  So addictive it should really be illegal in my honest opinion along with that pork shoulder and pork neck.

My visitors and clients can't get enough of this place once I put them on game.  Should you ever come here due to my review here on Yelp though, be sure that your addiction for real authentic Thai food doesn't get you mistaken for a dope fiend here in the Tenderloin.  I'd hate to have your mug shot on my conscience the next time I'm trying to get my fix here.
author: Colin M.

description: Love their food-  we go back for the Pad See Ew, the curries and the papaya salad. The prices are good and it's always easy to make a reservation - things one appreciates in SF :)
author: Naya L.

description:
Lunch experience.
The food was not really good.
Nothing excpetional.
I won't try it again.
author: Max G.

description:
Been here twice now and I can't think of anything bad to say about this place.  There is an extensive menu that can satisfy your Thai food fix.  The garlic quail is my favorite.  Their green curry is more on the spicier side, which I don't mind at all, but just a fair warning, cuz my friends couldn't really handle it after a bite.  

Everything was good.  Service is quick because I think they would like a quick turnaround since this place does get packed and crazy.  

Bottom line: It's a repeat.
author: Meshell C.

description: Quotes of inspiration all over the walls especially for those who enjoy cooking :).  I loved the atmosphere and the food was excellent.  Be careful, they make it spicy so make sure you tell them exactly how you like it.  I went on a weekday with my 2year old and my sister.  It was very fast paced with people coming in on their lunch breaks therefore i didn't feel it was very kid friendly.  But the waiters did not rush me at all.  Great service and great food, also if I remember correctly, Lers Ros means excellent food :)
author: Deepika S.

description: All I can say is "smack city"! I love this place. Their food is absolutely yummy. I took my mom and aunt there recently. We are SF natives who are used to really good food. They were feeling some type of way about the area (larkin at around 11pm) but after they say down and tasted the food, everything else went out the window. My mom had eggplant with chicken and garlic, my aunt had pad see ew, and I had a special of the day that tasted like Jesus made it himself. The food is awesome and their prices aren't bad either. Check it out if you haven't already.
author: Amina S.

description: Stopped here after searching Yelp for Thai food. We had narrowed our choices to this place or Ben Thai. We arrived and it was packed a sure sign we were in for a treat. We were seated at the bar- no problem. We placed our order- no problem. My husbands Ginger chicken dish comes out in a timely manner and looked/ tasted AMAZING but mine takes an additional 20 minutes. Had to remind waiter that I hadn't received my food. It comes out finally but my husband is done eating and I'm just trying to eat and leave. Bill comes- charged for entree $16.00 and the rice separately $2.50... Huh? Never seen that anywhere... Rice usually comes with meal. Paid for it but annoyed by the poor service and no acknowledgement of the issue with timing of food. Same thing happens to lady and her friend sitting next to us. It's whatever- yummy food questionable service.
author: Kuma R.

description:
Really tasty food here! 

I'm not a huge thai food fan, but I like the food here.  

I've ordered delivery and have eaten in. The Duck Larb is truly amazing and a must have. Crispy duck skin, succulent chunks of meat combine with the well balanced fish sauce to make for one tasty dish.

The Pad see ew and Rad Nah? were also tasty, but nothing special.

My favorite dish though was the bbq chicken (i'm sure there's a thai name for it). So good. So so good. If you're only able to order one thing, this is the one to get, you will not be disappointed. Juicy chicken and the sweet glaze that they give you just ties everything together.

It does get packed though (even on a wednesday night) so come early or order out!
author: Tu T.

description:
I came in here after hearing about this hole in hell kind of place on multiple sources. Both from the ratings on yelp as well as the places to try before you die list...man..if this place falls on its ass here..then I'm I know I'm on way out...

Contrary to how I usually conduct reviews at places. I'm going to start at a 5 star rating and bump them off for each violation located at this establishment.

Menu: Clear and detailed and explicitly states when and what time times are made available from on a daily-weekly basis....however they put several separate  sections that have not bound together.. so sometimes if the waitress isn't careful..that just looks sloppy and scattered when you put it down...(-1)

Lunch specials. Green curry runs along the bland side however red curry has the perfect kick in hotness in it even for the chicken variant ..I like.... ( + 1)

Grounded and minced chicken w/ basil. Actually better than I thought..fits with the complimentary rice and salad servings that come in the 9$ combo...(+1)

The salad dressing is a little different on the sweet side but it works for me. However I'm not impressed by it ...

HOWEVER  The Thai ice tea here.... I like very much. (+1)

If you can get parking there's really not much  else to complain about.
author: Eric C.

description:
I had the pad kee mao noodle dish, which is pork 2 ways over ramen-like noodles. The dish surprised me in its simplicity (no colored sauce) and pleasant flavors/textures. I initially thought there might be too many noodles, but it was the perfect noodle to pork/veggie/peanut/onion ratio. My wine was also very nice, as were all the staff. This is the first Thai restaurant I've been to where no wholesale sauce was used and the dish seemed like something I'd eat in a modern/urban Thai home made by a 'friend'. In comparison, much, much better than SPICE in NYC -- more homestyle.

On the two weeknights I've passed, the restaurant is largely empty, so there's no worry about getting a table Monday through Wednesday. My sister went on a Thursday night and it was packed with only room at the bar...This location is in the heart of the Tenderloin, so I think it gets less traffic than the other locations in better areas...

Would definitely go back again to try more dishes.
author: World T.

description:
I came to this restaurant on a huge wave of appetite for Thai cuisine and did not feel disappointed with the food at all but the service. I ordered the authentic Thai style beef boat noodle soup which is reasonably priced at 8,95.

The soup broth is rather too little for such a big bowl and it looks very thick as if it is an essence soup or something. Obviously it is tasty and very juicy, it comes with two beef balls and few slices of beef. The waiter will ask you to choose over flat noodles or thin noodles, which I went for the thin noodles. The beef balls are just nice, I love the beef slices a lot though. It's the bomb of the meal! It is very juicy and fatty! 

But the service was rather meh. We came dining at 4pm so obviously there was none in the restaurant, only us. And the restaurant is pretty big and there is no line whatsoever. I was busy catching up with my friend and sat there for over an hour and this waiter kept checking on us every five minutes which was annoying. Can't we just talk in peace for more than 10 mins without your interruption or your weird stare from the register, for Christ sake? 

All in all, the food is nice but don't expect to chill or hang around in this restaurant after your meal because the waiters will keep checking on you or giving you weird look! As if it is a full house, give me a break!
author: Matthew A.

description: Lots of crazy exotic stuff on the menu... gator, frog, and other 3rd world cuisine ... so in an effort to live outside my comfort zone, I ordered some sort of whole deep fried fish... like a trout I think.   it was pricey... and I am no fan of it.    it was just a crunchy mess of grease soaked nastiness that was extremely hard to eat.   Played with it for a while and left most of it there.   Fortunately the Coconut soup saved the meal.   OMG... the bathrooms in this place are about as Non-ADA compliant as imaginable.    I was not terribly impressed with the food, prices, service or atmosphere.    I think they are resting on their lorals and can step it up, and clean it up as well.
author: Vlad C.

description:
O. M. G. This place is pretty bomb!  3.5, but ding'd mostly for service.

Came here with a giant group of friends. We put our names down an hour before, and were told to return a little over an hour later. We did...and still had to wait another 40 minutes to be seated. Oh...I wish they would just tell us to return even later. We went inside to wait, and hopefully show the other large party that we were there. They left...and I gotta say, one of their party needs to learn how to dress. This has nothing to do with the restaurant, but young white girl who had a dress that looked part-bikini, part-dress, DO NOT WEAR THAT THING OUT TO DINNER UNLESS YOU WANT TO GET LAID. Forreals, a girlfriends dinner is NOT the place to show underboob. But, I digress.

We were seated near the back at a table, and I got the crap chair in the corner that was about 2 feet from the tables behind me. So I had a gap just large enough to squeeze through - if the person squeezing bumps me. Which the waitresses did. Frequently.

Food-wise, everything was either decent, or AMAZING. All the curries we got were just decent. The DUCK LARB is. SO. GOOD. If nothing else, get this.

Papaya Salad, you should look at your spiciness level. I'm a good spicy eater, and medium was just right for me. My mouth was a bit numb after eating...yum. If you're not a big spicy fan, or if you're just "ok" I'd suggest mild.

We also got a roast chicken-like thing, with more papaya salad on the side, and this was REALLY GOOD. No joke...this chicken is super flavorful, and delicious. 

If you don't get the duck larb, you're going to regret it...
author: Lily W.

description: The food wasn't bad and the person taking the order was very helpful and the delivery person smiled enough.  However, this company needs to learn the modern ways of marketing orientation.  They failed to deliver silverware.  I called to ask if they could send some. The response was horrendous. The first response was "it's not our restaurant policy to send cutlery".  Really?  Do you think you could mention that on the phone?  That's free and solves the problem they created.  I mentioned how it was my first night in this city and had no idea where to go to find forks and spoons.  It was a really inconvenient policy in my situation. After a minute, the next response came "delivery drivers went home for the night".  My thoughts - "5 minutes ago? Do you think you might have them do a favor and stop by again?"  I gave a $10 tip, good will could have been returned.  A customer oriented manager might have offered to pay overtime so my situation could have been alleviated.  Inconsiderate and non-business minded people!!!
author: Billy N.

description:
I placed an order for delivery.

appetizers- 1A) Fried Tofu     : delicious

Sides        -      Cucumber Salad: It was okay for a mini salad

Rice soups -   Rice soup    :   So yummy, light flavor.  Once a while back I took a plane to Asia and one of the meals on flight reminded me of this dish.  It was a porridge with other things.  This was so simple , basic , just rice and hot water, it almost was like having a hot cereal for dinner.  This is a must to order.  I didn't order any of the toppings to go with it, but next time I will have to try one of them.

House specials
Original Thai style-114) Pla Rad Prik    ' I didn't care for this dish at all.  It was a deep fried fishy fish.  I guess I read it wrong , but when I ordered this I had in mind a light fleshy white fish meat dish, but that is not what I got.  My friends ate it though and said it was good.  It came with a sauce on the side too.

Desserts  - Sticky Rice with Durian: I didn't like this at all.  Again when I ordered it and I read durian I thought it was a purple fruit( I got it confused with Taro) I forgot it is a fruit that stinks really gross and you either are a person who loves it , or repulsed by it(It is a distingued taste apparently)

Thai Iced Tea - great came with tape on top and saran wrap and in a rice box so it would tip, fall or , slip Great!
  

Delivery guy came very fast!
author: Jennifer G.

description:
One of the best Thai restaurants I have ever been to, other than Lotus of Siam. We ordere the duck larb salad, papaya salad with raw crab, pork shoulder, crab fried rice, an the special Tom Yum noodle. 

All of the dishes were packed with flavor, well balanced and cooked perfectly. It was nice that the salads were accompanied with lettuce/cabbage pieces to wrap the salad contents. This helped to cut through the intense flavors.
author: Y L.

description:
Got there almost 2pm, there were still quite some people eating. And people kept coming in during the time I was there. Not sure it's because the reputation of the restaurant or the area. 
I had the lunch special with spicy tofu and chicken satay. The salad looked so-so but the dressing made it quite good. It had the distinctive ginger flavor, which I absolutely loved. 
Spicy tofu was spicy and spicy. Great dish. Although the first time they made it with tofu that already went bad. Or I would give this place four stars. They replaced it for me without hassle, the second one was good. 
Chicken satay was good but not amazing. It's moist, and the seasoning is okay.
author: Lynn C.

description: Want Thai food....like real Thai food.      Must try.   Location is a little tricky but food was fabulous.    Go early for dinner or wait a long line.    Lunch is a bit easier.  Been there every month or so for many years.    Highly recommended.
author: Oranee D.

description: Best boat noodles ever! I am from Thailand and this is the best Thai restaurant in the US for me. They have Po-Tak (Thai seafood tom yum in tamarind base so it is not as oily as the traditional tom-yum). Their Tom-Zabb (soft-bone pork north eastern authentic tom yum is also really great). Pair it with sticky rice and you will thank me! They serve very authentic Thai food and their medium spicy for Thai people is indeed spicy! Their red ruby dessert is also the best. They usually run out so if they have it, try! Make a reservation for dinner. It gets super crowded.
author: Norases V.

description: They really turned this place around with the renovation.  It's fancy looking on the inside and the food is excellent.  Service was great!  I would definitely come back.
author: Chris L.

description:
Due to a failed trip to Turtle Tower on a Wednesday evening, my coworker, her brother and I ended up at Lers Ros Thai. Good thing is that a-many Yelpers that I had met before told me that it was one of the best places to eat some Thai food.

The great thing is? It's pretty legit. I think I've been way too accustomed to non-legit Thai food in Toronto, that this was just amazing.

Unfortunately, I had let my coworker and brother take the lead with regards to ordering, so I have a bad memory or what we had. I think we had the Pad-See-Ew, a salad, and something else. All I can tell you is that it was really delicious. The only problem is that my spicy tolerance has gone down the drain, so it was a bit difficult to eat. I think I may have to build up my spicy tolerance just to eat more here. Gadamn. It's good.
author: Joanne W.

description: This is favorite best authentic Thai food !!! I'm talking the real shit !!! Great service and yummy food!!!! Everything I ate there is two thumbs up ..
author: Lady L.

description:
Growing up in LA, I had access to some great Thai food (big Thai community in Thai Town/Hollywood). Ever since moving to the Bay Area, I have tried 10+ Thai places here, but always left disappointed. The food typically isn't Thai spicy and taste like Americanized Thai food. I came here expecting much less the same despite the raving reviews, but I was extremely delighted to discover that the food had authentic Thai spicy flavor. I give this place a 5-star rating for being the best Thai place I've had in the Bay Area.

Food:
Thai Curry Puffs: 5/10
I tried this based on Yelp reviews. For its $8.25 price, I would pass on this. The inside Yellow Curry Chicken is good, but the outside fried dough was very bland and didn't mix well with the filling.

Pad Kra Prow with Beef: 9/10
Delicious! This is the legitimate spicy ground beef like the original dish I'm familiar with in LA. The Pad Kra Prow I've had at other places in the Bay Area is usually bland or sweet and is served with sliced meat to accommodate the American taste palate.

Kuay Tiew Tom Yum Moo: 9/10
This was very flavorful, being both spicy and sour. Noodles were cooked just right. I was taken back to a small Thai noodle shop in Hollywood as I ate this.
author: John D.

description: Decent thai food at a decent price. Very hip/modern interior. I like the pad thai and chicken curry.
author: Juliana P.

description: This was absolutely awesome!! We were seated as soon as we came in the door, ordered 5 minutes later. Our food came out within 10 minutes at most - we had Chicken Pad Thai, and Kai Pad Khing (both entrees were under $15). I also got the iced jasmine tea which was refreshing. Everything tastes WONDERFUL! Highly highly recommend the Kai Pad Khing, and if you like Pad Thai, this was great - very thick peanut sauce. The service was awesome, they were like beautiful ghosts that just took care of our every need somehow without being seen the whole time. Felt like I didn't need to ask for anything, it was just magicked to the table. Got our for under $40 on date night - we say two thumbs up!!
author: Kellie P.

description: The restaurant is clean and the service is quick. The lunch specials are decently priced for the amount of food you get and the selection that is available.
author: Tia T.

description:
I love Thai food and could eat it everyday. I could eat here everyday. You must try the crispy pork belly.

We also ordered green curry with chicken and pad see ew. Both were delicious and rock solid.

You can probably skip the egg rolls. They were very basic.
author: Lee T.

description: Been here many times now, mostly for dinner but also for brunch.   The variety of dishes is much higher than at most Thai restaurants, and there are all sorts of interesting options from frog to alligator as well as reliable standards like the curries and noodle dishes.   Consistently good food and always super crowded.   For the lunch special, it was a blast from the past to taste the coconut candy dressing on the salad (you know, the multi-colored wrapper coconut candies from HK? That's literally what the dressing appears to be made from).  Kind of a fun touch.
author: Vivian W.

description:
Really delicious Thai food.  Everything that is not "white washed" is good, and pretty authentic.  

Alongside King of Thai, Lers Ros has some of the best noodles around.  The pad kee mao and Thai boat noodles are fantastic here.  The noodles are cooked perfectly, and seasoned with just the right amount of spice.

However, some of the other things like the pineapple chicken - you know, the "white people stuff" - don't even bother.  You might as well get them at a Chinese restaurant.

Stick with the authentic.  Terrific noodles here.  Really superb - in SF, it really is between Lers Ros and King of Thai.
author: Mark M.

description:
This place is in serious need of Hell's Kitchen and Gordon Ramsey
Their mgt does not care about customer service 
Ask Sara the manager why someone would post this? Especially after getting lied to several times awaiting a 3 hour food delivery.
Why would a restaurant want to lose a customer that would go on average twice a month?
author: Gary M.

description:
PRO: Been to this restaurant a few times and I must say the food is excellent and the service is outstanding. Simple and elegant decor with style.

CON: The seating is not comfortable. In the interest of space all the seatings don't have back support so not ideal if you have been walking the whole day or for older clients (grandpas/grandmas)

WISHING: The seats have back support.

Will definitely comeback if I am in the area.
author: Mao S.

description:
This is my third day in San Francisco, and ive tried most of the five stars rated restaurant on Yelp. The truth is, THIS place is really bomb.com

After receiving our food, our waiter and waitress made sure our food wasnt too spicy for us. They were willing to change it twice at no cost. Our water and alcohol was always refilled. 5/5 for customer service

The food is PACKED with flavors. Definitely tasted like authentic thai food. 

The crispy pork belly is definitely yummy. 
If you like fish sauce, the papaya salad has tons of flavors. 

Happy tummy, means happy woman.
author: Michelle V.

description:
After I had dinner at Lers Ros for the first time, I never enjoyed Thai food at another restaurant again. and I've been going to Lers Ros fairly often now.  

Larb Salad with chicken was probably the best Larb Salad I ever had. Their coconut based soups are delicious. The Chicken satay with peanut sauce is wonderful. Pad See Ew with flat noodles is also another favorite of mine. I always get a side order of brown rice with my entree. It's always steamy, warm, soft and delicious.  

Pretty much anything I have eaten here has been fresh and juicy and delicious. It would be worthwhile to note that they also deliver food. It takes about half an hour for it to arrive to Castro. Which is pretty good. My only complaint would be they put a little more salt than to my liking - mostly in the soups. But it seems, it's a part of most Asian cuisine.
author: Safak O.

description: Excellent food, really nice staff. Good vibes in the 'loin!
author: Michael F.

description:
Ive been on a pork belly addiction lately, if its on the menu somehow I have to eat it. Needless to say, it was on the menu so I ordered it. It was a little different than what I expected. The pork belly had just enough fat (looooove the fat) but it also had a crispy layer on the to to balance it out. They serve this with a serving of rice. If I ate by myself this would have been ample amount for a meal.. and then some.. Happy stomach, happy me!

We also ordered the duck larb since it was on the 7x7 100 things to eat.  First time having duck larb so I really don't have anything to compare it to but it was very rich in flavor. very good especially if you like duck. my only complaint is that I thought the lettuce wraps were cut a little small. (See picture) 

Also ordered the Pad Thai shrimp. Good  but it wasn't mind blowing. I suppose you can't go wrong with pad Thai. 

Oh and a little weird for me, they have some specials... Including alligator.. A little too weird for me to try but for those of you that are more adventurous!

Overall this place is definitely worth coming back to !
author: Victoria L.

description:
Yum yum yummy pork belly.  Small crunchy pieces of pork belly covered by a brown gravy.  One of their best dishes.

They also have solid Thai dishes--this is one of our go-to Thai restaurants in the city.
author: C L.

description: Really great food. Lots of interesting meats on the menu but we ordered vegetarian. Excellent fried spring rolls, Tom Kah soup, and Pad Kee Mow. Really well prepared. Top rate. And our server was super nice and helpful.
author: Jonathan N.

description: Just went there last night with 5 of my friends. All the foods we order was good except the beef Salad. The beef tasted a little bit bitter, maybe due too over cook ( I guess) , but over all we happy to are there.
author: Nudi S.

description: Get the crispy pork belly, you won't regret it.  Don't even try to pronounce the name of this place correctly.  I had to read an entire article on how to say it right.  The place gets kinda packed at dinner time (after 6pm).  Fairly priced and it's currently my favorite Thai spot.  Haven't had a bad experience and I've been to the Tenderloin location about 5-6 times now.  I was hooked on the pork belly for a while.  I think they put drugs in it cause I can't get it out of my mind.
author: Durty D.

description: I ordered delivery, everything was soggy from the delivery. It would have been okay if they would have vented items. $120+ and not worth it
author: Sierra F.

description: Lunch was good. You get two dishes, which is nice because you get to sample a bit. Friendly staff. Clean.
author: Ryan P.

description:
I know I wrote a tip maybe 2 years ago that this place has the best thai food I ever had. And yet each time I go, it's STILL the best thai food I've ever had!

Seriously. I came here again during Pride Week this year with a group of 5 and the wait wasn't horrible and the food was perfection. No one at my table spoke a word. We couldn't. It was just that good. Everything tastes so authentic ( even though it's probably not, since I'd never been to Thailand)! Even the "regular stuff" ( pad thai, BBQ chicken, tom yum soup..) I could maybe eat here every other day. 

After writing this review, I think I want to come here tonight for dinner! Haha
author: Krystal A.

description:
Mmm... winnah winnah, frog leg dinnah!

We got the following: Garlic Frog appetizer, Duck Larb (Larb Phed Yang), and Chicken Galangal Soup (Tom Kha Kai). 

Garlic Frog Legs: Nice crunch from the roasted garlic and flavorful without the accompanying sauce, but the frog legs themselves were a bit too dry. 

Duck Larb (Larb Phed Yang): Generous amount of duck, not enough lettuce provided to wrap the portion provided, and a little too salty if this is the only thing you order. Pairing it with the coconut milk chicken soup below helped :) 

Chicken Galangal Soup (Tom Kha Kai: coconut milk based chicken soup): SOOOO GOOD!! The velvety, buttery flavors were perfect with the thick slices of mushrooms. We should've opted for prawns instead of chicken, though. The chicken was a bit too dry and possibly overcooked in the broth. This soup was so perfect for a cold, rainy day!

Overall had a great meal and would come back for the Tom Kha Kai alone!!
author: Kathleen N.

description:
Look... I requested a big catering order to be delivered at 11:30.. Not 12... Not 12:15... 11:30pm. 

After calling the restaurant at 11:45 there was no apology, no "let me call the driver to see where he is", no sense of urgency. 

I use to run a restaurant... That's not the customer service you should have. I order lunches for groups every day and I would think twice before using you again. Very disappointed.

Management please take note.
author: Wanster L.

description:
We went for lunch here yesterday, Monday 9/21/15. First time for me visiting this location, but have been to other Lers Ros a couple of times before. We got seated right away, and after about 5 minutes we were able to flag down the male server to take our order. When i told him i wanted number 101 his response was "What is that? I don't know what that is, you got to tell me the name." After hearing that our party just looked at each other in disbelief. Is this guy friggin serious? Isn't it your job to know what these numbers are? How can a person that lazy be hired at your establishment? 

First of all, there's a reason you put numbers on your menu, which i believe is to ease the ordering process of your 100+ items that you offer. Secondly, the names on the menu is not the easiest to pronounce. The numbers corresponding to said hard names are supposed to help with that, i would think. What is so hard about writing 101, 107, and so on so forth?  Now i don't know if you require your servers to study the menu at all like at other restaurants, but the least he could have done was look them up himself before submitting the order to the kitchen. Then to make matters worse, when one of my colleagues told him that she wanted to order a fried rice, and asked what kind you have, guess what his response was? "We have many fried rice, you got to look in the menu." We received 3 sets of menu per person that consisted of one 6-page folded main menu, one back-to-back single page specials menu, and another single page drinks menu. It can be a little overwhelming to go through them especially when you don't have a lot of time to spend. Then he had the nerve afterwards to say " i don't think you guys are ready to order, i will come back in a few minutes." My other colleague was so livid and told him that he needs to come back with a better attitude. He responded, "Ok i will," with the fakest smile and sashayed away to the back of the bar area. 

I could go on and on about the lack of service we received throughout our meal, but these 2 incidents alone is enough to turn us off and convince us never to come back here again. This is SF Bay 2015, where good Thai food is a dime a dozen now. No one should put up with such bad attitude while dining anywhere. Ironic that on the wall it writes "Lers means excellence," but it was so far from it for us yesterday. Good luck coming here! Oh btw, the server's name written on the receipt was "Tumm" but not sure if that's him or the lady who ended up finishing the service. But I'm referring to the only male server working around lunch time yesterday.
author: Fikri S.

description:
GREAT LAST MINUTE DATE NIGHT PLACE!!!!

I wouldn't recommend the rabbit because I generally prefer them braised ... and they are fried here with some good flavors although on the drier side.

They happily switched out the beef for VENISON in yummy pepper sauce ... hella good. 

And the alligator was cooked perfectly with some fresh peppercorns... fantastic.  Great aromas, fresh flavors, wild rice a must.

Dinner was about 60 bucks with some Singha and fried banana.
author: Christine V.

description:
"I am NOT sorry for doing this to you guys." - May C.

This is what she, Daniel L., Valerie C., Anthony N. and Lers Ros Thai did to us:

Thai Curry Puffs * Chicken Satay * Thai Herb Sausage * Fried Pork Spare Ribs * Spicy Green Papaya Salad * Poh-Tak Soup * Red Curry * Green Curry with Chicken * Duck Curry * Tofu & Eggplant * Pad Thai Pak * Pork Belly * Chicken & Ginger * Kao Lao Ean Toon Soup * Pad See-Ew Noodles * Stir Fried Clams * Stir Fried Beef * Garlic Frog * Steamed Sea Bass * Whole Fried Tilapia

(THANK YOU!)

These TWENTY Thai-licious dishes were all beautifully presented, especially the Sea Bass and Fried Tilapia.  I'll definitely be back for those golden and crispy Thai Curry Puffs (like a Thai styled Samoa with peanut sauce and pickled cucumbers), the Thai Herb Sausage (nice pairing of lemongrass flavor and spice from the chili flakes), and Fried Spareribs drizzled in an orangey red Sriracha-like sauce.  I also really loved the Eggplant and Tofu with basil and chilis and the rich and flavorful Duck Curry.  

Next time I'll get two Thai Iced Coffees though.

(Two words:  FOOD COMA.)
author: Amy C.

description: I went with a friend and we loved everything we ordered! Will def be going back. Flavors were crisp, clean and indulgent. I was a bit disappointed that they had no coconut rice :(. But the menu is huge, so go hungry.
author: Christina V.

description:
If you are looking for real thai food, this place wont let u down. Thanks chef for making me feel less homesick.
Try papaya salad(spicy but so good)!
author: Tanya P.

description: Solid, affordable Thai with a buzzing atmosphere and very attentive waitstaff. I'm a fan!
author: Scott H.

description:
This place serves awesome Thai food at good prices. The area is a bit sketchy so did not feel great walking here in the evening (should have taken a cab instead) but my experience as a visitor in San Francisco was on the other hand that it is either way too touristy or sketchy, not sure were all the normal people walk around but guess everyone drives. Despite the location still loved the food here, some of the better Thai food I have had (outside of Thailand). They do actually also spice some of the dishes enough as well. 

Was a bit annoyed at the slow service before being seated, we had not booked but they said no problem 15 minutes and we should have a table. It did of course not take 15 minutes but rather 45 minutes and no real apology. I prefer that they say that it will take longer as we then could have taken a drink elsewhere and been back later. If that would have been handled better I would have given it 5 stars instead.

Starting to learn that dishes in the US always are to big we split two mains between three people and we still had food left so that further increased the feeling of great value for money. We had the Kao Pad Kai Tod (crispy fried chicken with rice and chili sauce) and the Pad Kee Mow (spicy pan fried noodles with chicken and vegetables). Both dishes were outstanding and the Pad Kee Mow really had a kick to it so loved it with some light lagers.

Great place and will perhaps try their other location if I am back in town.
author: Mathias H.

description: Holy smokes!!!  I haven't enjoyed eating like this in SUCH a long time.  Every dish we ordered was absolutely delicious.  Work colleagues and I came here because of the reviews and we WERE NOT disappointed.  We ordered a variety of dishes and none came short of being absolutely perfect.  I haven't been this full in years.  We were skeptical because of the area but were so happy we gave it a shot.  Wish we were local to enjoy again.
author: April S.

description: Excellent Thai Food at great prices. Located in the heart of the Tenderloin. And the gentrification begins... They delivered to my hotel which was just so convenient. My visiting Indian family could not get enough of the yellow curry which they just inhaled. I had the drunken noodles which I cannot get enough of. Will be back.
author: Pooja C.

description:
Hmmm pork shoulder.

That is the animal body part (oink oink) that you will be feasting on if you happen to order Salad #17 - the YUM KOH MOO YANG.

I asked the waitress with the beauty-pageant voice to make the dish moderately-spicy. Lets just say that my dress shirt was slightly drenched. But it was a good pleasurable pain haha.  I ordered brown rice to accompany the dish.

The flavors of this salad was just terrific. They provide heaps of this succulent pork shoulder in slices dusted with several spices. I tasted crushed star-anise and white pepper. I'm not sure what they use for the salt flavors (celery salt? fleur de sel? korean sea salt?). 

The restaurant is located in the Tenderloin section of the City. It's a far-cry from the Marina District, but I've seen way worse places in the U.S.

I left very satisfied with the imagery of wanting more soon.

A solid D-Man 4.0 stars.
author: Derek N.

description: Good thai! Be warned, a lot of the dishes had a chili kick to them. Really enjoyed their whole steamed fish, very tender and flavorful with a nice fresh texture.  I think it was their 112) Pla Kra Pong Nuang Manow (bass with chopped chili and fresh lime juice). You can definitely taste the lime in the broth. One order of $1.50 rice also was enough to give 4 people a decent sized scoop each with a little leftover.
author: Linus W.

description: I ordered 5 dishes with rice online and not only was the delivery order over an hour late, but it was missing the rice.  We ordered several spicy items like curry and ended up eating those without rice and went to bed hungry.  Overall it was a terrible experience, will not be ordering from them again.
author: Ulysses H.

description:
One of my superiors at work took out me and the other newbies for lunch at Lers Ros, and I had a really good time!  The food was excellent, as well as the service.  And the music takes you back to the day with all the cheesy '80s and '90s pop.

I had the pork shoulder, stir fried pork, coconut-milk based soup, pad Thai, and yellow curry.  Each one was better than the next.  I definitely recommend this place.

Read more: http://sexydishes.blogspot.com/2011/05/jewel-in-tenderloin.html
author: Vira P.

description: Very popular place to check out! Yum pork shoulder! Friendly service. their dessert mango with sticky rice also kills it! Nom nom
author: Mengze Z.

description:
This is now bookmarked as one of the best Thai places I've tried thus far!

We ordered Pad See Ew, Yellow Curry, and ended it with mango over coconut rice. Not only were our dishes spot on, the service was quick and friendly. 

I'm comin' back!
author: Brian L.

description: Great food at great price. Ive been to Thailand before and the foods here taste almost as good as the best in Bangkok. Dont forget to have singha beer as well
author: Tony N.

description: Worst Thai Ive ever had. Tasteless Hot/Sour......Lemon only taste/////Stale peanuts on sauce, Tasteless sausage app, no sauces, no service, worst curry dish......beef waz ok. I won't go on but I took friends from Austrilia, and was embarassed. Lunch specials were light on spices/ingredients. Overall , other than Spring rolls and Thai iced tea which were exceptional ---either the chef was ill or somthing. TOTAL LET DOWN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Nicklas M.

description:
Solid Thai food.

Good green curry with just the right amount of spiciness. The pork belly was slightly disappointing after reading all the rave reviews. While it had lots of flavor, it was a little bit too fried... overly crunchy for my taste. Still, it's convenient enough that I'll probably be back to try some of their other dishes.
author: Flora V.

description: Ok I have been wanting to check this place out for a long time! When I came back to SF for a few days, I was able to check it out! The restaurant was packed as we showed up on a Sunday night! The service is very quick and we only waited 10 minutes before being seated. I want to give this restaurant 5 stars for the food but I am reducing one star since a worker used a floor broom to clean a table and dust everything on to a floor and use the same broom to sweep it up! I do not think anyone should ever use anything that they use for a floor on a table where people eat! Ok! that said!, we ordered the papaya salad with shrimp, ground chicken and basil, shrimp paste fried rice, and fried pork belly! The papaya salad with shrimp was so good and so fresh! The shrimp really made a difference. I am not a fan of pork belly in general but it tasted amazing. Same with fried rice! I tried some and it was very amazing as well! The shrimp paste wasn't overpowering and it really worked well!  I highly recommend this place and I really look forward to going back! I just hope that they stop using brooms that they use on the floor to clean the tables.
author: Abra S.

description: Not as good as the reviews led me to believe but I still enjoyed the place.  I got the duck larb salad since I wasn't all that hungry.  It was the perfect amount of food and pretty good, but the duck tasted like the roasted duck you get at Chinese restaurants.  I enjoyed it, but it didn't really taste all that Thai to me.
author: Nina H.

description:
The food was absolutely delicious but we had to wait SO LONG until we were seated after our reservation time. 

Most of the dishes we ordred had just the right amount of spicy kick.  I especially loved the noodles and alligator. Curry was also amazing. The rice complemented each dish well.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
First of all, it's a pleasure to go to any Thai restaurant that doesn't have the words "Osha" or "King" in it. The scene de cuisine has gotten so predictable on the Thai front that I find myself defaulting to Vietnamese a lot. Lucky for Lers Ros that Pagolac across the street is closed on Sundays because Jamie W. and I would not have noticed this place except friends recently raved about it to me. No wonder since the chef here says the two magic words that are ambrosia to my ears - Pork Belly!

Located on an unsavory block of Larkin between Ellis and O'Farrell, Lers Ros doesn't look that impressive at first sight - drop tiles on the ceiling, formica tables but with a nice black finish, big spherical fountain to remind you of the Zen serenity of the Tenderloin. But it does feel more contemporary and welcoming to the bourgeoisie than a lot of similar establishments in the 'hood. Lots of temptations on the abundant menu including a whole array of game meats like venison, boar and even alligator in their signature dishes. 

We first went for one of their flaming hotpot soups - the $8.25 Tom Kha Kai, which is a coconut milk-based broth chock full of tofu cubes, hot red peppers, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, mushrooms, broccoli florets, carrots, and cabbage (see photos). The spices and the citrus flavor lent a certain sharpness to the milky flavor. The blandest of the three dishes we ordered was the $7.50 Pad See-Ew, which was basically a chicken chow fun dish with savory noodles mixed with green onions in a black bean sauce. It was good and hearty but none too distinctive on its own. 

The best dish - and no big surprise to me - was the $8.95 Pad Kra Prow Moo Krob, a sensational dish that mixes stir-fried pork belly chunks with the crispy rind and basil leaves and red peppers (see photo). So good that I thought I was in an upscale Italian restaurant in Bangkok and not at the Hilton either. I would order that again in a heartbeat. Service was what I would describe as mildly attentive - good at first but distracted by the neediness of larger parties as they took up more and more of the combined mind share of the wait staff. 

FOOD - 4 stars...2 out of 3 dishes were excellent, not a bad average, especially with a pork belly standout to knock your socks off...if you wear socks 
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...nice try at hip and contemporary, but it is the 'Loin after all 
SERVICE - 3 stars...attentive to spotty depending on how busy they get 
TOTAL - 4 stars...definitely a terrific find in a tough 'hood
author: Ed U.

description: This review is only for the Duck Noodle Soup. It is the best. I don't get anything else. Maybe one day when I have friends, I will be able to go with them and try some other dishes, but in the meantime, I can't stray from the best and risk possible disappointment.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Very disappointed in the service I just received, especially since I have been to the restaurant many times and had a much different experience.  My food that I just ordered was EXTREMELY spicy, which would be fine, except that I specifically requested that they make it not spicy.  Way too spicy for me to even eat.  And the other dish has noodles that have not been cooked. It's like one big noodle. 
I called to let them know and their solution is that there is nothing they can do.  After requesting a partial refund, and a long hold, they told me that they can remake one of the dishes. Would I like to come pick that up? Ummmmm...no.  I would not, that is why I ordered delivery.  Thanks but no thanks. I will not be ordering or dining in this restaurant again
author: Trish F.

description: I moved to Sacramento 3 years ago from the Midwest without having tried much Thai food. Since I lived here I've gone to many of the Thai restaurants in Sacramento and while very good none come close to Lers Ros Thai on Larkin in San Francisco. It is truly outstanding and the food is so flavorful with just the right amount of spice. The only thing stopping me from giving it 5 stars is the seating in this location isn't great. You have to often times wait and there isn't much room inside to stand so people are standing right next to you looking at their menus while you eat. I could barely move my arms without my elbow hitting someone standing near me as they waited for a table. I had the fried pork dish and it was awesome.
author: James H.

description:
To sum it up: Thai-riffic(ly better than my pun)
Returnability: Bi-Monthly
Superstar Factor: This sweetheart of a gem is an easy to love favorite who is sweet, spicy, sour, and salty in all the right ways.

Krapow (belly), mixed veggies, pretty much everything is great. Lers Ros has a few tricks (dishes -- like the krapow) that will knock you off your feet and the rest of its menu rounds out with solid and satisfying performances.

The flavors are on point. I have yet to have a disappointing dish. This is currently my favorite Thai food.
author: Jess C.

description: I just had a Lunch here celebrating Mother's Day. The crab fried rice and egg roll were delicious! Better than a lot the Thai restaurants that I tried before. This Thai restaurant is kids friendly. Customers service was great! Thank u
author: Mila N.

description:
Arriving at SFO, I had several bumps that kind of caused me to come later than I was hoping for, which means there weren't many places that would be open so late. However, my bestie friend had pre-order some Thai food, saying that it's probably going to be the best Thai food that I had, and he forgot that I went here 10 months ago.

The Pad Thai was pretty good; just that I didn't taste the sweet portion of the dish. Maybe it was there and I decided to shovel everything down my mouth without enjoying the flavors dancing around on my tongue. Portion was the perfect size, considering it was in a plastic take-out container.

Still, a good place to try out Thai food if you're in the city.
author: Tom T.

description:
Always busy, always tasty Lers Ros is a modern Thai spot that's great for big groups or dinner dates since it has a lively Oktoberfest style picnic bench seating section and enormous selection of food. The only dish I didn't like was the salted egg. The quail was ok, a little too crispy. The soups are great, the pad thai is a no-brainer, and there's always a ton of lime, lemongrass, and coconut flavors to get your fix. 

Note, if you like spicy food they tend to under-spice here.
author: Rafael S.

description: Amazing Thai food! Small little place in a not so good area, but well worth it! We had the coconut soup and it was the best I have ever had  I also had pad Thai and it was incredible. Some people think it's too sweet and it was sweet, but I thought the flavor was amazing! My boyfriend had a friend chicken dish with a sweet sauce and he loved it as well. The staff was super friendly and on top of everything. I recommend this place to everyone and I know I will be back next time I'm in San Fran!
author: Lindsey P.

description:
A bit disappointed given all of the great reviews I had read.  The decor is great and the service was good considering the large crowd inside.  The food, however, was just OK.

Since they have such lesser-seen meat dishes (rabbit, boar, frog, etc.) I think we were not ordering in the restaurant's niche.  Being vegetarian, the dishes we received failed to excite and were a bit below the spiciness and flavor we'd normally expect.  I'd recommend vegetarians look for a better option and for meat eaters to probably give it at least one try just for some of the more unique items.
author: Joseph R.

description: I just discovered Lers Ros and it is by far some of the best Thai Food I have had in San Francisco.  Authentic flavors, spicy, and fresh.  I ordered the Tom Yum soup as well as Green curry with Tofu and both were delicious.  I'm looking forward to my next order!
author: Jenny E.

description: Hands-down one of the best Thai restaurants I've been to in California. The food reminds me so much of my mom's cooking (I live thousands of miles away from her), so it's definitely special to me. I try to go there every time I get the chance to be in the city. The pad-Thai, larb-gai, and pad-see-ew are among my favorites. Parking and finding tables can be a little difficult, but I promise you that you'll forget all that after you eat the food.
author: Pim L.

description: This place will not disappoint if you like Thai. Good food, authentic staff, clean place. Portions are small. That is why I did not give a 5. Let it be known, I'm a big eater.
author: Anthony S.

description:
May b best Thai I've ever had! Literally everything was delicious: the pad Thai, pad see yew, mango salad, curry! I can't wait to go back.

just went here yesterday and we had the pad thai and chicken over fried rice. both were a good portion and we went at 6pm and didnt have to wait.

pad thai: really moist and yummy. some places make it dry which is a big no no. also, came with really fresh bean sprouts.

chicken over fried rice: a really common thai dish that they do a good job of at lers ros. the chicken is crispy!

tip: dont come after 7pm or else b prepared for a wait
author: Thach N.

description:
Darn, I had such high expectations - especially after reading all those stellar reviews. How in the world does a Thai restaurant screw up Pad Thai?!? Absolutely no distinct flavor!! Overcooked rice noodles, sauce was way too sweet, not enough sour and absolutely no heat? Chili was non existent in my Pad Thai, a huge disappointment. And to top it off they didn't even have chili oil - wth!! I had to use picked jalapeños (since when does a Thai restaurant serve pickled jalapeños - ugh). Hubby had the crispy pork belly, his review of the dish "I though I was going to lose a tooth" and "it was very bland".... neither of us finished our dish. 

First star for having Sapporo in a bottle and not a can. 

Second star for having a high chair.
author: Marlene C.

description:
Last night was the first time I actually dined in at Lers Ros. I usually have them deliver.

As expected, the food was as good, if not better, fresh.  I'm a big fan of their Tom Yum soup. Order with prawns because they use the big far juicy kind!  The mushrooms are fancy too :) the beef prad prik (a special last night) was too peppery but the meat was cooked well.  The pad Thai is yummy. When I had it delivered it was less sweet, which I liked. At the restaurant it was sweeter. If you like the flavor of line, I would definitely recommend the Yum Woon Sen salad. Glass noodles, ground pork and lime dressing go sooo well together!  The pork belly is pretty good and the pad kee Mao too.  And they're less afraid of making things spicy! A medium spicy will actually come out medium spicy.
author: Dina H.

description:
I tried this place because I saw it featured on Check Please Bay Area and I am glad that I gave it a shot. 

I ordered the original pad thai and pineapple fried rice and I was hooked. The pad thai was bursting with flavor! The fried rice was great too..it is a dinner must-have that perfectly compliments your entree. The only thing that makes me sad was the portion size. Kind of small.. probably good for only 2 people to share with no leftover. 

Unfortunately I was not that hungry when I ate here for dinner, but next time I absolutely have to the hot pot looking entrees that I saw everyone else ordering. 

Also, I would not recommend this location for large groups. The place is very small and cramped. It is also very loud..so prepared to scream across the table. 

Despite the ambiance...the food is amazing! Can't wait to visit again; maybe next time I will try to come during lunch time.
author: Kristen N.

description: Lers Ros Thai is usually my go to thai restaurant here in the city. Their menu is extensive and the food is authentic and top quality. Two of my favorite dishes here are the Koh Moo Yang (Grilled Pork Shoulder Salad) and the Larb Phed Yang (Duck Larb Salad). Yes there are both salads, but the flavors and textures in these dishes are so well balanced you'll come back wanting more. I love coming in a large group and ordering a bunch of dishes so I can eat EVERYTHING.
author: Cindy A.

description:
Hands down the best Thai in the city. It is great to see the quality of Thai food getting better and better!  Lers Ros will force other places to up their game.  

I owed this place and Osha reviews because I eat at these more than I probably should and my search to find better has yielded no contenders.
author: Brett S.

description:
Oh dear Lers Ros, what has become of you? Used to be sooo wonderful & has crumbled. Prices have gone way up, portions have gone way down, seats are uncomfortable & crowds are absurd.  Huge groups monopolize the place on a nightly basis. We just waited over an hour for takeout on a Monday! 
Best to just forego this place entirely for dinner these days as much as it kills me to say it. Come for lunch if you must but I don't see much advantage here anymore over a range of other good Thai places.
author: eric b.

description:
I've been to Lers Ros many times and they never disappoint! Prices are super reasonable, servings are generous, wait-staff is friendly, and food is delicious. I've been to the Lers Ros on Larkin, the one on Hayes, and the one on 16th Street and the Larkin one is my favorite.

Favorite dishes include the crispy spicy pork belly, the pad kee mao (very spicy!), and the pad kraw pow with chicken and definitely their garlic ginger rice :)
author: Sarabeth L.

description: You really cannot go wrong here. Anything you pick will be great. I especially love the appetizers. You could make a meal out of them. Very traditional Thai food, don't miss if you're in the Tenderloin. Only complaint for me is the noise level. If you like noisy restaurants, add a star.
author: S. G.

description:
Holy mother...

So I ate here once with a gf and I had the Pad Thai, I thought it was good but not too memorable.  When we ate here I had no knowledge of the menu or how good all the other food is.  Pad Thai is like a safety dish for me.  So one night a couple months later I searched "pork belly" on Yelp and Lers Ros pops up.  I look at the menu on their website and I saw "stir fried pork belly with crispy rind" SOLD.  Ever since then I was fixated on coming back to try this infamous pork belly.

I was finally able to return this week to order this pork belly dish I'd been dreaming of.  Let me tell you...this dish exceeded all expectations I had.  I think it was actually better than I had imagined it to be.  The pork belly rind is similar to Chinese roasted pork, the one thats usually hanging in the windows of Chinese deli's with the crispy skin on the outside, but this wasn't crispy skin, its just crispy fat.  And its some fucking GOOOOOOD crispy fat.  The generous portions of pork belly came served with a basil and red pepper sauce.  There is a LITTLE heat to the sauce but it won't make you break a sweat.  What really impressed me is how tender the pork belly was..and the crispy rind NEVER got soggy, even after sitting in the sauce for a while.  I ate this with brown rice and it was amazing.  I could order this every single time I eat here and not be sick of it.  Seriously.

My gf & I also ordered the papaya salad with grilled shrimp.  We made the mistake of ordering this spicy rather than medium.  I love spicy food, so does she.  We can handle all kinds of spicy food..but damn..we could NOT handle this salad.  They do not fuck around with chili here when you say you want something spicy.  The first few bites weren't so bad...but somewhere in the middle my head started to hurt and my mouth was on fire.  I guzzled 3 glasses of water and it just got worse and worse.  The salad was supposed to be refreshing but it ended up...not being refreshing, lol.  We sat there giggling at each other because it was so hot we could barely handle it.

We decided we need to return in a couple of weeks and order the same thing..but papaya salad MEDIUM.  Spicy NEVER EVER AGAIN.

I always thought Marnee had the best Thai food in SF...I've been eating there for years...I think Ler Ros is my new favorite Thai spot in SF!
author: Steph D.

description:
Made a reservation in advance, upon arrival we were told they had no record of it. I had made it a few hours prior online. Another woman beside us hade made one for a party of 7 and was told she was not on the list, even after she pulled up the confirmation on her phone.

 In addition, they had told me the place was wheelchair accessible. There's a huge step at the front- how is one supposed to clear that, especially in a power chair? The hostess just stared at us blankly, saying "oh yes, we can do wheelchair" while looking at my sister clearly stuck in the street. She offers to put us on the wait list as a response. Because of course that solves the problem of accessibility. We repeat this conversation a few more times until we get sick of the blank stare and give up.

The level of incompetence here is astounding.
author: Siena R.

description:
Delicious and creative. Had the alligator instead of frog.
Salads and silver noodles make for lots of low-carb options.
Inexpensive.
author: David C.

description:
Solid Thai restaurant choice. Four stars mostly due to service. Stand outs were the fried rice ( order this.. A must), koh moo yang ( pork shoulder appetizer), and fried trout with mango sauce. We also ordered the chicken red curry and pad see eww as well.. Good but nothing spectacular. 

Overall, would definitely come back. Great food, good prices, nice experience. The Thai tea was on point too! :)
author: Jennifer P.

description: Good food but what kind of waiter/waitress that force us to give the amount of tips that they didnt deserve? I went to this place with my friends last week. We splited our check by 2 (1 pay with cash and 1 with card) and give the tips in 1 check (the card one). We were waiting for 1 of my friend went to the restroom. The short hair waitress came up and asking us for tips on the 2nd check ina shameless way. I told her that we already gave the tips in the other one but she said that the MINIMUM ON TIPS IS 15% ON EACH. HOWEVER ON THE CHECK IT WAS "SUGGESTED TIPS" ONLY. She was standing there for a good few minutes to argue with us in such shameless way. What the hell was that attitude??? Learn some manners lady !!!
author: Kate L.

description:
this is the kind of food that makes you want to drop everything, throw your hands in the air, and yell out "godDAMN THAT IS GOOD!!" 

I'm hardly in the city, and I am definitely not usually in the Tenderloin. However, I had a meeting with a volunteer for a big project and afterwards we decided to reward ourselves with some good grub. My colleague exclaimed this was the best Thai food in the bay, and off we went. 

Thank. God. We. Went. 

We opted for the pad thai, Pad Kra Pow Moo Krob (crispy pork belly), brown rice, and some kind of stir fried greens. Everything was mind-blowingly flavorful, and I love that the pork belly had some serious spice and kick to the dish. Even the brown rice was good, and I hate brown rice. 

Service was attentive and friendly, and prices are reasonable. There is no reason why you should not be there, right now.
author: Angela L.

description:
Thanks Yelpers for leading me to a good Thai place for lunch.  The lunch special portions were huge.  I chose the ginger chicken, which was good- full of fresh veggies- sauce needed to have more ginger flavor, as I usually find the problem to be.  Also the red curry- again full of fresh vegetables, pretty good flavor and nice portion.  Served with huge bowl of brown rice and a small salad with a very tasty dressing that tasted like ginger sesame, or peanut.
