Do you know the weird sound that mayo makes when you scoop it out of the jar?  That is the sound of the fork going in the rice that night.  

Uncle Ben's 1 Minute Rice would have been better.
author: Amy J.

description:
Came here with some friends last night.  The food was not bad, but it wasn't all that great either.  I've had Thai food all around the Bay Area always in the hopes of finding something more inspired.  

We had several dishes including the red curry, sea bass, and fried beef strips. Each dish was pretty good, but I didn't feel like it was any better than the other well-regarded Thai joints in town.   That said, the service was attentive and the meal was reasonably priced.  

The only downside for me is the neighborhood which has the special TL vibe.  Be prepared to tip a crack-head for 'helping'  you find a parking spot.
author: Aasim K.

description:
A-OK is right. Here's the deal - the food here was very good. We had yellow currry (my fav), veggie noodles and my friends had a beef dish. All had great flavors and didn't leave you feeling super full and greasy like some restaurants can do. I don't recommend the fried tofu -- too much breading.

So, why only 3 stars? Well, when we walked in, the entire place smelled of fish sauce. I can cut them  break. Maybe someone broke a bottle in the kitchen and then poured it all over every chair... it was not good.

Also, the service was VERY attentive, and maybe even a little grabby. They were literally taking plates from us when we were still eating. There was no line, lots of empty tables... we had all the time in the world. Let me use my plate!

I could be convinced to come back... or maybe take-out's the option I'm looking for.
author: Gretchen S.

description: Very good, very reasonably priced.  It's not going to be the most memorable meal of your life, but it's going to be a good meal.
author: Amber A.

description: I had the duck noodle soup and it was delicous. My friend had the duck larb and it was probably the best larb I've ever had. Its a cute little place in a sketchy area but there were lots of cops around when we went so I guess we were safe? Will definitely come back but definitely not by myself unless I have pepper spray.
author: Sflady S.

description:
With all the Thai food to choose from in this area, this place is above par.  It has really bizarre food such as alligator but I didn't get to order that.  The quail was actually one of my favorite dishes.  Its a lot of work for a little meat, but its oh, so, good!

Come if you get a chance!
author: Y L.

description:
WOW! I just might have to consider this one of my favorite Thai places that I've EVER been to! And honestly, the only reason I came by was to eat an item off of the 7x7 2011 SF Big Eat list!

I was a bit apprehensive about having to eat the "Duck Larb" listed on the 7x7 mainly because I am not much of a duck eater. I've had duck and will eat it when I need to, but it's not something I prefer having. But I decided to suck it up.

I didn't know that the dish would be like a salad with lettuce on the side (yum lettuce cups!). I was very surprised when I got the dish: #25) a chunk of roasted duck mixed with rice powder, chili powder and lime based salad dressing, along with some leafy lettuce, basil, cilantro, red onions, scallions and a couple of hot peppers thrown in. It tasted like an explosion of flavor in my mouth! The lime dressing aroma was something you definitely couldn't miss!

I think if I could pick a favorite 7x7 item, this might just be it. And I've already done 67 of them out of 100!

On a non-food note, this place is also a good place to come to with very good customer service and a very clean restaurant. When i first came in, it felt almost cafeteria-like because of the brightness inside and the long chain of tables and chairs marking out the aisles. There is also a bar that you can sit at to eat (which is what I did).
author: Melissa D.

description:
Tom kha soup was great. 
Great service
Spicy tofu actually kind of bland thought. the tofu itself had not absorbed any flavor. it was like almost straight out of the package.

i loved their brown rice, and that they served it up family style.
author: Jeff G.

description:
Loved it...not in a great area but once you are in it is great. Fun place. Excellent food. Had garlic frog, chicken satay, yellow curry and red curry with prawn (a la carte). Service was good and with wine x 1 glass we spent $60 and ate well.
We think the food totally met our expectations.
author: Michelle M.

description:
I love you lers ros!!!!!!!!!!!

Everything is good! I'm so happy to finally found some place that sells REAL THAI FOOD. I love Yum pla dook fu *Crispy Catfish Salad*
author: Malisa W.

description: Legit thai food here I believe!  It was soooo good.  Everything we ordered was amazing.  I'd definitely come back.  I think must get would be their pork shoulder.  We came here in a big group and they situated us pretty quickly and order all came out perfectly!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Lers Ros is the best Thai Food ive had in the city. Its open fairly late, and has a crazy big menu, full of all kinds of traditional goodness!

We ate: Chilled duck salad, Thom Kai Soup, and Pad Thai. Everything was not only flavorful but each dish, particularly the soup had aromas that make you tempted to take a sponge bath in that spicy coconuty sour juice of love!

Go to Lers Ros and have fun enjoying great thai food and trying out new thai dishes you have most likely never tried before... There's over 100 things on the menu :)
author: Kevin D.

description:
this place makes most other thai restaurants so american.
THE best thai restaurant in bay area. you can take my word for it.
author: Bennet A.

description:
This is not of the best Thai places I've been to in SF...

I decided to try this place out with a friend because it received good reviews on Yelp and it was also listed in the 7 x 7 list. We ordered the red duck curry which was supposed to be one of their popular entrees. The duck was just alright...there was a lot more skin than meat and a bit on the greasy side. We also had their pad see ew and it was just so-so since the chicken was dry and there was not enough sauce included. 

Overall, the service was pretty good. The food came out super quick...within 10 minutes of placing the orders, which is impressive since it was pretty packed that night.

Three stars only since I have had better Thai food in the city!
author: Wendy T.

description: Thai food better than in Thailand!  Don't take it from me, I have heard this individually from 2 native thai persons that has eaten there so I had to go back.  I had the mixed grilled plate.  Chicken was moist and tender and is somehow able to capture that street charcoal taste and smell.  Sticky rice in a cute little straw box and wrapped in plastic, very hygenic.  If I had to pick one tiny nit picky thing, I do  not like papaya salad with shrimp on it, I feel like places have to do that so they can  upcharge, but why not just charge $6/$7 for just the papaya salad?  I know its a craft and I wouldn't dog you for it.  Just sayin...
author: Maya H.

description:
I went with everyone's suggestion and got the pork belly.  And this is why we have Yelp.  I wasn't surprised one bit.  It was delicious.   The pork skin was the best part!  Now to the service.  When I walked in, there were literally 8 Thai girls dressed in black.  I was promptly seated and served water and had my order taken in less then 5 minutes.  Would I go back?
Mos Def!
author: Tony K.

description:
Just came here yesterday, and since I'm finishing the leftovers from this place right now, I thought I'd drop by here..

#27: Coconut thai soup. This coconut soup was more sour than the usual ones from other places that I get it from. Had a lot of chicken strips in it though.

#35: Red Curry with Chicken (A La Carte): Pretty good. 4 out of 5 stars. It's pretty small, but enough for two people and it comes with rice. 

Pad Thai: MMMM!! Delicious. Sweet & sour. Just at perfect.

2 Thai Iced tea

= $41.65

Service was great! Although my experience at Thailand was of course better =)
author: Vivian L.

description:
The best Thai food in the city. 

Try the crispy pork belly...its amazing!
author: Leah Q.

description:
Pork belly--a delightfully substantial portion in the a-la-carte, enough for two people really.

Alligator--we were warned it would be "medium", and it was "medium" hot but it lasted 20 minutes after the last bite.  Delighted to see green peppercorns and small thai eggplant in this dish, but probably won't order again due to texture issues with the alligator.

Tom Ka Gai--had some interesting large mushrooms in it, either strips of King Trumpet or perhaps some regular oyster mushrooms, a bit sour but still quite delicious and not very spicy.

Service--mixed.  Zapped them on the tip (a very rare thing) for making us wait 20 minutes for the bill when the restaurant wasn't full after the bill was requested.
author: Seth G.

description: Best Thai I have ever had. Very good service. I can't even describe how good the food is. I had the appetizer sausage, pad Thai (stellar, absolutely stellar) and sticky rice with ice cream for dessert. This place is amazing.
author: Alexis p.

description: Came on a Friday night, was seated right away, the servers are seriously good and the food seems very authentic. It was too spicy for us whitys so the waitress brought us extra cucumber and a Thai iced tea on the house. A very nice gesture. All in all great service and food. Much better than the one in Hayes valley even tho the area is not the best.
author: Shane L.

description:
In town without a car, public transportation not convenient, Lers Ros Thai doesn't deliver at lunch, so I starved myself till 5 pm awaiting a transcendent delivered meal. It wasn't--but for reasons that can be easily corrected, so I will tell you what they are.

First off, the food just wasn't chili/spicy enough. I think that is a function of the anonymous voice ordering by phone. The papaya salad barely burned my mouth and the other dishes were chili-free. Corrective: tell them you like it spicy when you call.

Second, I ordered dishes that were just too close together in taste and ingredients: the Kha Nah Moo Krob and Rad Nah, both with pork and Chinese broccoli. Corrective: don't do that.

The meal still earns stars, wth a boost from the fast and friendly delivery.
author: Otis M.

description: Never Experienced such terrible customer service!!!! I was denied service because I brought in my service dog with me.The Americans with Disabilities Act, a person who is blind or has other disabilities has the right to bring a trained service animal to all public places. It was very rude and uncalled for how the servers AND manager treated me. They kept asking for more proof of my service animal even after the fact my dog had its proper vest and tags. They shouldn't even be asking for proof in the first  place! Under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), privately owned businesses that serve the public, such as restaurants, hotels, retail stores, taxicabs, theaters, concert halls, and sports facilities, are prohibited from DISCRIMINATING against individuals with disabilities. A public entity shall not require documentation, such as proof that the animal has been certified, trained, or licensed as a service animal. But they can not even bring up the issue of Certification, ID tags, Or any documents or poof that the Dog is a Service Animal. They have to accept my word for it under the law. It can not be asked for. It can not even come up in the conversation. That is the law. Wither the law is good or bad... That is the law. Once they know the dog is a Service Dog, they have to simply treat me like I don't even have the dog with me. They have to treat me like any other customers. Service can not depend on my disability or the dog. If i meet the "Normal" Requirements to stay there they have to let me.
author: Scarlet L.

description: My favorite thai place when I'm in the city. I love their assortment of noodle soup because not all places serve them. Their papaya salad is top notch with the added grilled shrimp. I also like their rice plates. Service is good and atmosphere is casual. They do free deliver with $15+.
author: Amy L.

description:
I've been here a couple of times, and the food was exceptional both times.  Great service.  My friends and I all had an enjoyable time.

My friend, not so lucky.  She got food poisoning the next day, and she thinks that it was this place.  It took her a couple of days to recover.  Apparently this wasn't the first time people got sick from here.

Nevertheless, I am still a fan.  I will keep going!  ppppppppffff... pussies.
author: Eugene L.

description:
This was the third stop on our tour de gorge San Francisco day, and I will have to admit, I was already stuffed coming to this place and was not planning on eating at all. My friends insisted that this place has amazing food. Considering he is my Northern California food guide, I went with him to indulge. The place is found in the Tenderloin district, which is not the nicest part of the neighborhood. The restaurant was fairly empty since we got there around 6pm, before the big dinner rush. This place is nicer than your average hole in the wall joint, it's clean and it has some flat screens where they are usually playing sports. 

We ordered the following dishes:
Koh Moo Yang
Tom Kha Kai
Kao Na Phed

The first course was Koh Moo Yang, which is grilled slices of pork shoulder, served with a chili powder sauce. Let me tell you, this dish is very, very tasty. The pork is juicy and is ultra tender. Dipping it in the chili powder sauce adds to the taste. SO GOOD! I would have been happy with just this one dish, but there were two more on the way!

Up next was the Tom Kha Kai, a coconut milk based soup with chicken , lemongrass and kaffir lime leaves. One popular Thai dish that I really don't like is Tom Yum Gai, and based on it's standard description of spicy, sour, lemongrass and kaffir lime leaf chicken soup, sounds very similar to Tom Kha Kai. I was very skeptical about trying this dish with my severe dislike for Tom Yum Gai, but what the hey, I was on vacation and up for anything. To my surprise, this soup was yummy. It was a mix between a panang curry and tom yum gai, and the combination of the two was deilcious. I forgot to take a picture when it first came out due to it being so tasty so the half eaten shot below was all I could get!

Our last dish of the night was the five spices duck over rice, served with chili and vinegar sauce, or otherwise known as: Kao Na Phed . At this point, I'm stuffed, but I had to make room for at least a bite of this. I only had one piece, but the one piece I had was perfect. The skin was crispy and the meat was juicy. Another dish you just cannot go wrong with. 

All in all, another highly recommended San Francisco gem. Just be careful if you go there after dark, the Tenderloin area is definitely not the safest area!

read more of my reviews at www.thekitchenfloor.com
author: Koji I.

description: The food was pretty good here. Actually it was really good. The only reason why it's getting 4 stars is because my waiter was not helpful at all. It's my second time getting thai food so I asked for the pad tai and asked for a side of rice and she tells me she wouldn't eat it with rice like she's the one eating it. Also they brought my dates food out about 10 minutes before mine. They should have brought them out at the same time. It's rude!
author: Jose L.

description:
By far one of the best Thai food places I've been to.

I haven't had anything here I did not enjoy, but I would highly recommend the duck larb and pork belly dishes. Can't get those anywhere else and taste half as good. There are plenty of Thai restaurants in the tenderloin but if you want a guaranteed good selection for a date or group of friends, can't go wrong here!
author: Mo P.

description: First time in San Francisco used yelp to find a restaurant near our hotel and noticed this place had the most visits. We had frog, alligator and pad thai. The service was good. They do NOT serve cocktails only wine beer and sake. We had a chilled sweet sake and it was divine! The frog was tasty but slightly over fried. Pad Thai was yummy. The alligator was a MISTAKE! Beware if you dont like chewing small bites for at least 5 min before swallowing, stay away from this rubberized dish. Sauce was good but the alligator is NOT worth the money. You were warned. Bon appetite.
author: Aireal M.

description:
The best thai food I've had in San Francisco and probably in the entire US.  This is the place I consistently order from when I'm faced with the option for ordering out for food

Pros

1.  Best Thai food ever - I've only had better in Thailand.

2.  Wide delivery area

Cons:

1.  Its in the Tenderloin.  If you can suffer through all the sketchy people then its fine.  If you're there with your mother and some crack addict comes up to her asking for a hit or a free blow job and that bothers you then I'd suggest somewhere else

2.  The restaurant is pretty loud.  They often have TVs and drunk people so its pretty short on ambience.  But then again most great asian food places are

3.  The Pad Thai is not awesome.  It's sad I know but you can get better Pad Thai at a chinese restaurant than you can get it here.
author: Peter C.

description: Very nice Thai in an otherwise shady looking street. The dishes are spicy and very nice. I look forward to going back there again.
author: Anwar H.

description:
Thank you Yelp for yelpers for your review on this Thai place!  Great food, good service for a good price.  Overall the best value on Thai food I've had in the area.  

They also have great lunch deals during the week.  If you're on a budget and want to try a few things, I recommend going during lunch!
author: Jamie V.

description: I've tried countless thai food restaurants in the city and in other parts of the country... but I have to say, this is the best thai food I've ever had. We ordered the curry puffs, pad kee mao, and yellow curry -- ALL were the best I've ever had. Will come back very soon.
author: Sahil A.

description: This is a pretty small establishment. We had to wait a bit for a table even though it was almost 10 pm. Food was delicious, ordered pad thai and yellow curry with brown rice. This is probably one of my favorite Thai restaurants. Parking isn't that great and the area is pretty sketchy. Food was great though, would definitely come back when Thai craving hits.
author: Linlin L.

description:
Food finally came after almost 4 hours of waiting. they charged full price, and the fold was cold by the time it got there.

The restaurant was literally .5 mile from where we were. unacceptable. will never eat here again.
author: Miles B.

description: Never been to the restaurant, just delivery. They have Isan sausage which seems rare outside of Thailand so I knew it would be great somehow! And now Lers Ros is the first place we order from when we got back from a 26-hour drive! Eat it!
author: Key A.

description: For Food is pretty good,worth 5star,if u eat there but for the delivery I only could say it's 2star attitude! It is not really the experience u want to enjoy... Their attitude is pretty bad when u order delivery , and also the food always not the flavor u want if u order extra spicy
author: Eva S.

description: Authentic Thai food! I loved the curries n spices.
author: Lore D.

description: Excellent authentic Thai food, some of the best I've ever had.  Papaya salad was very good, a little spicy.  Give it a shot!
author: Nick W.

description: I ordered the lunch special where you get two items and it includes salad and rice. The salad was very fresh but I wasn't too fond of the dressing. I got the spicy tofu and the Green Curry. I originally thought they would have fried tofu for the spicy tofu but there was only one or two and the rest was just sauce. The green curry was a little bland and I wasn't able to get the fullness taste of the curry. I would not recommend parking on the street because it's the Tenderloins and if you have a okay decent looking car then you might get jacked. We parked in the parking lot but it was very expensive. I would not recommend coming here if you have to cross the bridge. There are other Thai places that are way better than this one.
author: Lai P.

description:
*...i love to eat and I'm Thai

All my friends (Thais) and I start eating here since the first week they opened the restaurants. the reasons why it took me this long to write about this place 1. Lers Ros is every Thais comfort zone to enjoy real Thai food. I wanted to keep it that way... like it is our Thai secret place where we can just eat like cow and sweat like pig. 2. I didn't think Lers Ros need any more comment about its food. the food selection on menu alreay shows us how real this place is

anyway,  advices here for all yelpers to enjoy eating at Lers Ros

Take yourself away from your comfort zone...skip Pad Thai,Pad Kee Mao, Tom Yum and Curries (except duck red curry, THIS ONE IS DONE DEAL FOR ME. SO GOOD!!)-- go for roast duck laab--Tom  zap , BBQ pork shoulder, any fish related dishes are all good to go for...or ask them which dishes Thais ordered the most...

Thais don't do individual plate for person ( except noodles) ..we share a la carte or main dishes..If you have entier curry bowl or entier plate of food by yourself.they would be too much for one to handle with those greasiness and rich texture...why?!?!..because Thai foods were born to be HEAVY...healthy==maybe but not in way you want to experience THai food...and simple to understand the concept:

if we want something crispy--ok sir no broiling or baking..deep fried all the way..if you want curry--don't worry, please put as much as coconut milk to make it rich and thick...if you want stir fly or saute meals..please  make it sweet/salty or sour as much as you want. just make sure it's strong enough that they would not lose the flavor when I have it with rice...

hope this comment is useful and yes...Ler Ros is the best choice now
author: Yada S.

description: Been here twice in the last 3 months and could eat here every day.  This is not white people thai food.  This is the kind of thai food you eat and then wonder what the Hell you have been eating before.  The menu is overwhelming so a reason to go with a bigger group to try more things.  Wine list...totally reasonable.  Service is attentive and fast.  Don't miss their whole fried or steamed fish.  Both are delicious.  Their pork belly and pork shoulder dishes are fantastic as well.  I can't wait to go back here.  Just so consistent, so good.
author: Karen W.

description: Excellent food, and does not make dishes overly sweet as in many places.  The rice soup with dried shrimp is great comfort food.  Shrimp with vegetables in a tamarind broth has a great sweet and tart balance.
author: Dan C.

description:
When my bestie said this is the only thai place she'd go to.. i knew we had to try it out... :) She was right. Thai yumminess was had by all (vegetarians and meat eaters alike) 

they gladly sat us down at our table for 10 even before our entire party sat down. 

they also gladly separated the bill for the vegetarians and the omnivores... so helpful! 

TOM KHA KAI SOUP (w/ chicken)- yummm... comes in a big pot for everyone to try. it's the coconut milk based one. definitely spicy and would make your nose sweat, but a good way. 

STEAK SALAD - this was super spicy but soooo worth the order! It was packed full of seasoning and tons of fresh greens and onions... (it was so good, one of the girls saved the onions and sauce when we finished the rest of the goodness, to eat with her brown rice later on!) 

PAD THAI - the perfect balance between wet and dry, sweet and savory. 

PORK BELLY - not on the menu! but... it's like the chinese bbq pork - thit heo quay in viet... (not xa xiu) with the crispy skin, lean meat and yumminess. not greasy in the least. definitely order this. 

PORK FRIED RICE 
BROWN RICE - the right amount of moisture, and doesn't taste like brown rice, even though it looks like it, and it is.. 

PRAWNS and ASPARAGUS - good dish. nothing outstanding about it though. 

all of this fed 6 of us, and we had just the perfect amount. 6 dishes 6 people. stick to that rule! 

(I would dock off 0.5 stars b/c the waitress said it wouldn't be enough. she goaded us into ordered a 30 dollar seabass dish since this wouldn't be enough... thankfully - they "forgot to order" the seabass, and told us at the end of the meal. and wanted to know if we still wanted it, it would be ANOTHER 30 minute wait, when we were already stuffed from the rest of the food coming out...) 

overall though... the meal was great. and i definitely want to come back, next time i'm in Union square for some shopping.
author: Judy N.

description:
Solid Thai food. Some good and some not so good.  

I came here a couple of weeks with a pretty large group, so we got to try a bunch of stuff on the menu. 

We started off with the tom kha kai soup. 
I thought this was really good.  There was the nice background of lemongrass and some spiciness.  Be careful though, we had a person at our table eat an actual piece of lemongrass, which was not a good idea.  Hilarious when it someone else eats eat, but you don't want it to be you.

I think the best things on the menu were the pad see ew and the pad kee mao. The pad see ew was slightly sweet and soy-saucy.  The pad kee mao had a nice burn and a good assortment of veggies in it.

The pad thai was nice and fresh, but I felt like something was missing in it. Maybe not enough acid? Still trying to figure it out. Not the best I've had, but still solid.

We had several of the meat dishes as well including the ribs, but the taste of those all were pretty similar to me. All pretty equally tasty.

I would avoid the papaya salad with the raw prawn.  It had a lot of potential, but it had that old fishy taste to it.  Too bad because it really did look good.  If you don't like sweet, the yellow curry is also one to stay away from.  I think a lot of people at the table liked this one, but I wasn't really into it.  It was hard to taste anything beside sugar in this dish.

Service was efficient and friendly.  This place is pretty busy, and they know how to move people and out without being rude or annoying.  I think I would venture this way again if I were in the neighborhood but wouldn't make a special trip this way.
author: Jumi Y.

description:
This place deserves 5 stars.

Located in a sketchy area it maintains a clean well kept interior.

Service is excellent, always someone willing to help at the slightest eye contact. 

If you can't eat spicy foods like me, they'll definitely accommodate to your tastes!


FOOD: 
Crispy Pork Belly (#62?):$9-- Excellent excellent in terms of flavor and texture. Highly recommend. A little spicy. Crunchy and tender at the same time. Super fan of pork belly.

Steamed Sea Bass: $25 -- I love the broth the fish came with. The fish itself didn't have that fishy smell, and was perfectly cooked. Watch out for the bones! We cleaned our fish down to the last fin. 

Definitely be venturous and try out new things. The menu has much to offer.
author: Momo M.

description: Very disappointed. The staff was pretty rude and given the reputation of the restaurant, I was expecting much better food than what I had. The food was just average. You have plenty of Thai restaurant in the neighborhood that are much better than this one.
author: Manu R.

description: VERY disappointed with their home delivery. They took 2 freaking hours & all they could say was sorry. They could have at least given us some discount, a free spring roll or something to bring our business back?! Never again :(
author: Jays D.

description:
oooh... thai boat noodle! i've been looking everywhere for some decent thai boat noodle and Lers Ros has a pretty decent one.  The broth is very hearty and the beef slices are tender and good... none of that chewy sh*t!!  i like i like! but lemme tell u... their beef noodle soup is sssPICY!

also had their rabbit, stir fried noodle, and rice plates before and all were decent.  

and you know what's the best? it's like a good inexpensive place for yummy thai food... you know... like when Osha was before they became a chain
author: Kelly H.

description:
Solid 4-star Thai food. Their food was fresh and the veggies were crispy and not too soggy like many places. The flavors were very well done and all in all it is a good value for the quality.

I might have considered giving it 5-stars but I asked for and stressed that they 'spice' up the food. 'Can you please make these dishes extra spicy?' Sadly the dishes were pretty mild, but that didn't take away from the overall tastiness of it.
author: J. S.

description:
the best thing and regrettably the highlight of our visit is the nam phrik kapi or shrimp paste hot sauce/condiment.  lunch menu is not very authentic and honestly quality is not very good.  

the lunch special is a bargain, which you select two items for around $8. I went with kai yang and stir fried pork. The kai yang is generously portioned and well seasoned but unfortunately dried out.  The stir-fried pork was dry and too sweet. I opt for sticky rice but was deeply disappointed by how dried up it was. it tasted like leftover rice that they just microwaved for me.

the Mrs. ordered the tom yum noodle which came surprisingly under-seasoned.  it was not spicy at all, as in a 0 on a spice scale of 5.  

trying to save our lunch experience, I throw up a hail mary and asked for shrimp paste. to our surprised, the waitress responded kindly (with the oh you know nam phrik kapi?) look.  she came back with a plate of stinking good shrimp paste hot sauce and we thought we were making a comeback out of this lunch!

then I got greedy, feeling the heart beat I want to go for two to win it with an order of pad kee mao.  we were excited, we were ready to finish with a bang only to see the flat noodle embarrassed itself with a fumble in front of the end zone.  it was terrible, overly sweet and borderline uneatable as if the chef accidently drop half a bottle of sweet soy sauce in it. 

we left with disappointment, wondering what this could've been.  then I started questioning myself, is it me? maybe I need to do better with the play calling.  looking at pictures of duck larb, crispy pork, fried whole fish, I wonder maybe we just came at the wrong time and ordered the wrong food.

I should not have gave in to yelp hype and probably not even Michelin hype.  the lunch menu items were very underwhelming.  I do have hope though and would like to give this another chance, perhaps with more creative play calling next time.

oh the shrimp paste was billed for $7. thought that was a bit unreasonable.
author: David Y.

description: The meals & wait staff were 5 stars. So many options,  everything I saw around me I wanted. Food came quick and perfect presentation & taste. I swooned over the food. We came on a very busy Saturday night and it was hot inside, sat at a large table w/ other groups. They could use a more seating, elbow room- (at least when we came), but I was still very happy.
author: Alicia P.

description:
Came here with a group of friends to get our grub on. Just so happens that night we were there when Andrew Zimmerman from Bizzare Foods was there was his friends too. So it must be good then right? 

We decided to order:

-Alligator Dish (on the daily special menu)
-Fried Quail (on the daily special menu)
-# 19 Yum Nam Tok
-#31 - Tom Sabb
-#35 Red curry
-#77 Pad See-ew
-#111  Tom Yum Pla Kra Pong
-#62 Pad Kra Prow Moo Kro 

All the dishes really stood out. We loved the Tom Sabb, if you love tom yum soup you'd really enjoy the Tom Sabb, spicy too! Make sure you get it with the pork spareribs. The Tom Yum Pla Kra Pong (Seabass) was DELICIOUS. Its a HUGE fish that they bring out - the soup that it cooks in is so good! We had six people and we could barely finish the fish. Its huge (and it a whole fish with head and bones) so you will need to be skilled to eat it. 

I liked all the dishes and since the menu is so expansive at Lers Ros we came back the next week! The trip out is well worth it!
author: Julie F.

description:
This place is the best Thai food in the Bay area.  Wha wha whatt?!!??!  Best Thai food you say!?!?!   That's a pretty hefty statement.  I stand by it.  Even Van Damme couldn't keep me away with a split kick to the head.  I've been here a ton of times, and the food is consistently good.  I think I've actually gotten tired of the pork belly, I've ordered it that many times.  Their grilled pork shoulder is amazing( I think it's actually pork neck).  The fried trout is another must have, you can eat the whole thing, head spine, and fins.  They have an amazing pork liver salad with that sour thai marinade, if you're into offal.  It's not on the menu, so you'd have to request it.  

For the d-bags that rate this place on a long delivery time (who the hell orders tofu and curry chicken from an authentic Thai place anyways, live a little and try something new, perhaps one of the dishes that countless Yelpers recommend, instead of boring Thai staples that farangs always order.  I'm sure it was an off day, as I don't see consistent comments about lengthy delays.  For Steve S.  that made a snide comment about waitresses speaking English, he needs to get off his snotty high chair, I would never want business from a customer like you.  Stick to the suburbs and Applebee's, especially if a foreign accent in an asian restaurant in an asian neighborhood bother you.  Seems like no one else has problems ordering.

Oh yeah I saw Andrew Zimmern eating there this past Saturday!!!  I guarantee you he didn't order pad thai, curry and tofu!!!
author: Brandon L.

description: 1hr 40mins and food still not here. Called and they hung up on me. Won't be ordering from here again - rude and terrible service.
author: Sanj G.

description:
Since we were catching The Slackers show at GAMH down the corner, we were instantly sold on coming to Lers Ros Thai given that it opens till midnight (it does it every night) on NYE! What we didn't expect was how delicious the food was. 

This place's got some exotic creatures on its menu - frog, rabbits, quail and alligator (see the special menu insert)?! But luckily, they offer quite an extensive selection of dishes for vegetarians like myself. We shared Spicy Tofu (which doesn't look like much but was flavorful and definitely has a kick), vegetarian Pad Thai (tangy and sweet), and Pad Makuer Tofu (similar to Spicy Tofu except it's got eggplant) - all were really good. 

The prices were on par with other thai joints but the portions were quite a bit smaller. Not a bad thing as we've been binge eating over the new year weekend :)
author: Tiffany L.

description:
this could be my favorite thai place because they have many unique dishes that are also delicious.

i tried the duck larb, but it's not my cup of tea -- too salty.

dishes i really enjoyed and would order again:

- pork belly 
- pad see ew 
- beef and peppercorns 
- fish paste curry 

the big plus is free delivery, so i can eat in my PJs
author: Lisa H.

description:
Danger makes it taste even better!

This place serves dishes with flavor profiles that rival the best that Osha has to offer. With a variety of unique chilis highlighting your meal, Lers Ros adds a tinge of authenticism that is unmatched outside of Bangkok.

#25 - Duck Larb Salad (AMAZING!)
author: Calvin W.

description:
Finally! My life is complete!

We got the whole fried trout today! 

We ate EVERYTHING 'cept for the skin. We ate the head (eyeballs, cheeks, mouth), fins, spine, and tail but we left the jacket. LOL
author: Jacquee P.

description:
The food is good. They are always busy at night. 

One complaint: their tom yum kha is too salty. I've ordered it three times and it will never be the same as the first experience. I didn't realize how salty it was until the second time. 

To concede another point, they serve frog, venison, and crocodile which I think is interesting. I haven't tried any of it because I'm chicken, but thought you might want to know.
author: Kissy F.

description: Great taste - good service! We ordered Tom Yum Kung, Yum Khor Mooyang, and Pad Krapao Moo Krob. All are great!
author: Nan S.

description:
Great menu options here and apparently they're also listed on 7X7 and now I wish I knew about that before coming here. Their menu items are a little pricey than I would like to pay but they were actually really busy today for lunch. My personal favorite is Thai House Express and they're only a block up on Geary!

I order the lunch combo for $7.25 and it came with a side of two entrees, rice and salad. I got the pad kra pow (minced chicken with bell peppers, basil, onion) and bbq chicken with sweet chili sauce. My pad kra pow was good and tasty but the bbq chicken was really dry. The sweet chili sauce did not suffice. The rice was also a bit dry.
author: Connie C.

description:
A bunch of friends tried this place last night. Great food and great desserts but in a bad neighborhood. I don't know if I want to have dinner here too late at night...

We had an appetizer, which I cannot remember what it was. It's not bad but not great to the point that stays in my memory.  We ordered the shrimp fried rice. It was nicely done and very spicy. If you can't eat spicy food then order extra white rice on the side and mixed the fried rice on your own to tone down the spiciness.  I loved this fried rice.

We also ordered the sea bass and it was nicely done. I'm very picky when it comes to seafood. It's gotta be fresh, well seasoned and not dried. This dish got it all! The meat is white, which means it's fresh. The sauce is very tasty with a good kick of spiciness and lemon flavor but not too strong to cover up all the seafood taste. Finally the fish just cooked to the perfection that it is just cooked and moist in the sauce/soup. Very nice.

At last we tried the sticky rice and mango. Very standard and simple dish. I personally do not like desserts and I think that dish is good and I would order it again with friends. The sticky rice texture is a bit watery and we were in doubt at first. However,  once u tried it it is full of flavors in the harmony of sweet and a bit of saltiness. The mango was good too. I just don't like the location. May be I should check out other locations.
author: Ricki H.

description:
I come home from a delicious second dinner from Ler Ros to find out that I made Yelp Elite! It was the perfect end to the perfect day! 

I got to try Ler Ros's pad thai and lime chili steamed sea bass with a friend visiting from NYC, and Ler Ros did not disappoint.

 The Pad Thai was good, but what really knocked our socks of was the delicious, INCREDIBLY tender sea bass. We got the entire fish for under $24, and this wasn't a small bass..it was almost too much fish for two people and believe me I can eat fish. I just wish I had my camera to take a picture of the lovely dish. The lime and chili broth was a perfect compliment to the tender fish. It accented the fish nicely and but did not overpower it.

It's a definite must try! Here's to a new year of delicious food as an Eliter =).
author: Cindy C.

description:
The BEST Pad Thai I've ever had.

The BEST.


For me, certain dishes are the test of a restaurant, a benchmark, you might say. Bun in VN restaurants, hamburgers in American diners, and pad thai in Thai places.


So, that's why they get another star from me. the BEST Pad Thai I've ever had. Try it -- this pad thai will kick the socks off any other pad thai you've tried in SF. I betcha.
author: Yasi S.

description:
My foodie Thai friends introduced me to this mouth watering establishment. After reading the tips on 4square, I perused the menu's wide selection of exotic animals that made my heart skip a beat. Rabbit, boar, frog, & alligator, oh my!  After squeaking with delight, I asked my friends to please order as they knew best.

I highly recommend #12 green papaya salad with the raw crab. The last time I had raw crab was at a NY Korean restaurant and "this" brought back happy memories. Raw crab tastes like a happy face. In fact, I may have hummed while I licked the last tasty crabby morsel. 

We also had the fermented fish, the fishcake, the boar, and the shrimp. Since my friends ordered in Thai, I have no idea what the real name of each dish is, but I did learn the meaning of "flaming spice." After 10 minutes, my mouth was numb and I was sweating through my scalp. 

Thank god, we finished with shaved ice. Oh my gluttony goodness, I felt like one of the giant balloons from the Macy's Thanksgiving Parade as all the blood was gone from my head to aid in digestion.

Bottom line: Definitely try this place. It's authentic, affordable, and has great service. It does get crowded on the weekends so reservations are a must!
author: Sophie C.

description:
Super-di-duper good food, lovely setting. Somewhat clueless service (they ask to take your plate away about 10 tines a meal.) But really yummy.
 . . . 
Went there again recently. Has it gotten even better?
author: Antonia T.

description:
My friend swears by this place and I was so excited to eat here since its another night that I'll be working til midnight.  Yes tonight which is Thanksgiving eve.  I have to say it wasn't amazing but it could be colored by my bitterness that I've been working all day. 

I'll definitely try it again.  My friends and I had red curry, pad kee mao and the combination plate.  Nothing really stood out as fantastic but it arrived swiftly and its the night before a holiday so you gotta give them props for that.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Haiku ode to rabbit and quail:

Went back to Lers Ros
Next time, I will remember 
Don't get both dishes.

Rabbit and quail
While they're two different creatures
Taste too similar.
author: Hannah L.

description:
This is one of my favorite Thai places! I just recently went to the Hayes Valley location, and let me say that I definitely like the one on Larkin Street better. Yeah... okay... the one in Hayes is in a nice location, and looks a little more upscale, but the one on Larkin is not as crowded, and there's a Quickly's near by! I never had to wait for a table at this location ( I nearly waited an hour at the Hayes Valley location). 

I want to say that the prices are a bit lower at this Lers Ros.... but I'm not quite sure (I'll have to verify when I go again). I always get the Eggplant Tofu and a Vegetable flaming pot. So good! The food is more spicy here, which I like.

All-in-all, Lers Ros has delicious food and regardless of the location, very friendly staff.
author: Nadia M.

description: Oh yummy!!!!! Love love their pad see ew, fried tofu, chicken satay, stir fried pork belly, prawns, and stir fried beef. Food came out in a reasonable time and service was good. Would definitely come back and pig out like there's no tomorrow!
author: Karyn L.

description:
I almost got knifed, robbed and/or stuck with an HIV needle on the way here but it was worth it. As you might imagine, we walked here. San Fransciscans are lying liars. "It will only take 5 minutes" they say, grinning wolfishly. Let me interpret that for you... add a 3 in front of everything. Five really means 35. If it's 10 minutes, it will really take 310 minutes. 

Maybe I exaggerate but either way, after the walk I was ready to face plant into a. a bucket of water and b. whatever thai food someone wanted to feed me. I was delighted and appalled at the extensive menu. How the hell was i supposed to decide? We over-ordered all over the place and then my excursion into thai-mania began. 

Fried tofu, tom yum soup, papaya salad, some prawn business, other chicken business. This was a week ago and I've killed off some brain cells since then but one thing remains: If i had been stabbed, I would have taken my bleeding body to Lers Thai for a bowl of that soup before going to the hospital. 

It was holy shit good. The service? Abysmal. Really. Don't be meek, be demanding -- don't feel bad. You have to. The food is worth the psychic suck of having to flag someone down.
author: Kelly S.

description: A little too spicy for my tastebuds but overall the food was ok. Nothing to write home about...and the wait here is entirely too long.
author: Tina N.

description: Overall: really enjoyed this place, worth the wait, Wontons/puffs appetizer was awesome, came with great peanut sauce.
author: Natalie F.

description:
OMG! This lovely restaurant has over 100 different items on its menu. Thank goodness I went there this evening with some friends who have become regulars at this restaurant. We got there in good time -- around 7 p.m. After we were seated and began ordering appetizers, a large number of dinners of all walks of life began showing up. As we were enjoying our soup and appetizers, a large line had formed to be seated. 

The staff is very friendly, attentive and efficient. 

This lovely restaurant represents what good things can come to the Tenderloin, which has been going through a renaissance of sort in recent years.

The five of us order about a dozen different entrees. Some were spicy and others were sweet. The squid soup was lovely. The papaya salad was good but a bit spicy for me, not for my friends. The string bean beef was delicious but a bit spicy for me. The spinach beef with peanut sauce was really good and a good antidote for the other spicy entrees like stir fried quail. The pad Thai was nice and starchy -- it calmed my fiery palate and tongue. All in all, a wonderful restaurant that cooks and serves up delicious Thai food.
author: Peace L.

description:
The menu was diverse and included a lot of items I'd never seen before.  We were getting take out after a show at GAMH so wild game wasn't on my mind but the descriptions sounded tasty.

We got Tom Yum soup and the yellow curry.  Both were hearty portions and well flavored.  I don't know why my favorite Thai places have to be in the crappiest neighborhoods.
author: Seong P.

description:
Warning- my friend tried to steal my thunder with her review but mine is continuing as drafted!!

DELICIOUS! I was going to the warriors game with a friend and we needed to grab food quickly before jumping on BART, so I did what I normally do. Take a look at my yelp bookmarks nearby and see if there's something I've been wanting to try. Thankfully Lers Ros was nearby. We placed a to-go order dashed to BART ate the papaya salad while waiting for BART and finished up outside of Oracle. 

FOOD:
green papaya salad with grilled prawns- I wanted spicy my friend wanted medium. Luckily medium was spicy enough to burn her lips. Medium shouldn't mean no heat! I could have gone without half a head of cabbage filling up the to go container. I liked that the paypaya was cut into thicker strips. Prawns were a great addition. I would definitely go back for this and ask for it spicy :D

Pad Kee Mow (not Pad-see ew ) with chicken- glad I was able to convince her to mix it up from the usual Pad Thai. Very good and better than I've had at other SF Thai places even after eating it lukewarm 30 min later. 

stir fried pork belly with crispy rind and basil leaves-  the combination of fatty, salty, crunch pork just sings to me. 30 min later the pork belly was still crunchy. I wished I could have eaten it while hot. 

they have a 120 item menu with awesome looking critters such as alligator, venison, frog, duck etc. If you know anything about me, you'll know I'm all for trying new animals. I can't wait to back and try more items from the menu. 

Open until 2am daily and free delivery over $15- I'll definitely be ordering from or stopping in here sometime soon. Also very reasonable. Under $10 for most plates.
author: Mike K.

description: I was lucky to stop in here just before the rush. I thought it was pretty bumpin' for a Monday night at around 7 when I stopped in but the place had standing room only by the time I walked out at 8. Fortunately the service was quick and the food was sp-ic-cy. I had the prawns and asparagus special. Thick pieces of asparagus stir-fried with prawns in a chili-garlic sauce. The brown jasmine rice is super good here as well. There's lot of crazy adventurous stuff on the menu if you want to go that way, frog, alligator, boar. In fact, the menu is so big you might have a hard time figuring out what to get. I'll definitely be planning a trip back to learn more about what Lers Ros offers.
author: Stephen S.

description: Love this place!!! The crispy pork belly is just amazing, the duck salad is #2 but it could get a bit spicy! The servers are super nice and the restaurant has a great vibe you totally forget your in TL while u eat in. Definitely try it out!
author: David L.

description: Ate here last night and really enjoyed the food.  So much better than other thai restaurants in the city.
author: Candace H.

description:
Hailing from a hometown lucky enough to have one of the biggest populations of Southeast Asian people in the US, it's hard to impress me with Thai. 

Although it's not the best I've ever hard, it's way up there for San Francisco. I love how close it is to Van Ness movie theater. Killer combo!
author: Nicole d.

description:
I attended preschool and first grade in Bangkok, and am picky about my Thai. There seems to be a trend for many Thai restaurants to increasingly cater to what they think are American tastes in Thai food. (Jalapenos in Thai food? Uhh. Really?) That trend led me on a search for restaurants serving a more authentic Thai cuisine. 
If you think Taco Bell is representative of Mexican cuisine, you may not "get" Lers Ros. And in advance, I forgive you. My mom used to crave that icky American-style candy red Chinese sweet and sour pork, back when we were living in Hong Kong. 
We've been to Lers Ros twice now and I've been in heaven both times; ordering fun things you just don't find in the Americanized Thai restaurants. Even if you are trying to be safe and order the standards; the Pad Thais, the red currys; these are far better at Lers Ros than you will find elsewhere. 
I wasn't expecting much given the near-Tenderloin location, but the inside is clean and impeccably decorated. The service was excellent, the food presentation outstanding. The prices are quite reasonable; all the more important in a city where it is increasingly difficult to find a good meal that is not in the "Google Millionaire" price range!!! 
So, Five Stars; as good as it gets!
author: T S.

description:
LRT is not your typical thai joint.  the flavors are robust and out of this world.  they have dishes that are quite uncommon, and never on a regular thai restaurant's menu.  

we started with chicken larb,  shared pad see-ew and the infamous #62 pad kraw prow moo krob.  if you were to get anything, i would suggest #62 -- only if you eat pork though.

i feel i may be jaded eating thai from this point on.  any other place would not be the same, and would be without.
author: Sheri N.

description:
went through the biggest muthaf*ckin ordeal to get the dopest papaya salad on the west coast. trekked through the tenderloin, found the most diminutive parking space, jumped through hoops and over hookers, made my way through cracks in the sidewalk and crack fiends, all for the green papaya salad with prawns. and damn was it worth it. perfectly ripe green papaya, in the sweetest and spiciest dressing, all over chunks of tomatoes, jalapenos, green beans, and tender butterflied prawns. 

the rest of my order was pretty off, ordered the green curry with veggies and the chicken fried rice. poor ordering on my part, but i wasn't thinking so clearly after fearing for my life in the tenderloin...i owe lers ros another trip to try the cray shiz on the menu. but the papaya salad? totally worth the adventure.
author: Sylvie C.

description:
Problem numero uno: the name.  It is some kind of secret handshake deal.The real name, which may mean "horse blanket" or "we gouge hipsters" in Thai  is pronounced Lert Rot, but it is spelled Lers Ros, causing no end of merriment to somebody, probably the sign painter.

Food wise,it is  hard  to know what all the commotion is about. I had the appetizer ribs (hard to eat, fried to a leathery exterior) the admittedly touristic sweet and sour pork (not their crowning glory) and the utterly average cucumber salad. It was all ok, but nothing to write home to Bangkok about. It would definitely be the best Thai restaurant in Kingsburg, though. 

This is the second Thai restaurant in town about which all knowing white people have assured me that their never identified "Thai friends" swear it  is just like home. If true, maybe food in Thailand ain't that great. More likely these Thai informants are apocryphal, sort of like the campers over the ravine who told my friends they just saw Bigfoot getting out of a flying saucer.

The service blows. Asking for extra Costco paper napkins, which are handed over with great reluctance and only  after a vigorous investigation, is like asking the Turkish government to admit the Armenian Genocide. Getting a refill diet Coke, ditto. And forget about Thai hospitality. Maybe these were Cambodians and Vietnamese  trying to make Thais look surly.

When a restaurant is so popular with unwitting cretins, see, infra and supra, why try being pleasant?

But I will don my cretin gear and try the duck some day. Maybe.
author: john d.

description: This place has some of the best thai food in SF.  It's definitely in a sketchy 'hood, but don't worry, unless you are a tourist, you'll be fine.  I usually go for the chicken pad thai, and it's up there as far as the best pad thai dishes I've found throughout my world travels(although sadly, I can't say I've been to thailand yet...).  This place gets SLAMMED on the weekends and is usually very busy at normal dinner hours during the week, so be prepared to wait around 1 hour or go at 'off-peak' hours.  Delivery is a good option here, it's usually reasonably timed(on average about 45 minutes for me, but I'm pretty close to them).  The prices are good/average, but for the quality of the food it is well worth it.  Portions are also very good.
author: Yan L.

description: Not bad, but didn't blow me away. Then again, I ordered a simple dish - Kao pad with crab. It was good though! Would def come back to try other things. Nothing too too special based on this visit though.
author: Arlynne S.

description:
Flew in from Seattle and arrived pretty late so thanks to my lovely "sister," we settled in here right before closing. I was very thankful that he took me here because the food was fantastic! They offered items on the menu that you rarely find in Thai restaurants. Needless to say, I was besides myself when I saw the Garlic Frog, alligator, rabbit, and boar!

Although my sister has dined in here several times, he never ventured in trying unfamiliar items so, with his saying, "get whatever you like," I decided the Garlic Frog ($9.95) was going to be a good starter in helping him branch out his taste buds. I didn't want to overwhelm him by ordering other "exotic" food items. He did like it even though there were minor complaints. I didn't care because I got him to taste something different which he ended up liking. We also ordered chicken satay ($7.95); chicken was juicy and tender; KRA DOOK MOO PAD PED (Tender Pork Spare Ribs $13.95) which was absolutely delicious and satisfying, with brown rice. 

For drinks, we ordered the HANA-KOHAKU "PLUM SAKE" ($15.00) which we shared with each other. I could have easily consumed it by myself, but, I didn't want to be a "lush" as he often accusingly calls me. 

The food was so good and I guess my appetite was quite big that night that all of the food was gone; even so much that the waitress outwardly commented on my healthy appetite. Of course, she did it behind my back and told my sister. Regardless, the clean plates were an indication of how yummy their food was. I definitely would come back. 

The service was pretty good but then again, it was near closing, and there weren't too many other diners...

They close at 11pm so if you happen to be craving up-scale Thai food that you can't find anywhere else, do come here and make yourself comfortable!
author: Doc V.

description: Being new to the city, I was looking for a Thai restaurant to satisfy a craving for Pad Thai. I Yelp'd locations near my job, and everywhere was closed at 3pm! So, admittedly, the thing that pulled me to Lers Ros in the first place was simply the fact that is was open. The all-day hours are already a huge plus. The location has a clean simple design. The staff is absolutely attentive. We were quickly approached by our server and our water glasses never went empty. My friend ordered the chicken Pad Thai and I ordered the tofu and veggie Pad Thai. We tried each other's dishes and both agreed that this was among the best Pad Thai we've ever had. And we eat a lot of Pad Thai.
author: Arturo G.

description:
Their duck larb salad and pork belly is as legit as most people say it is. It's so good I think I'm gonna take my family back here in the near future just so they can try it.

Me and my friend came here on a friday evening right after work and were surprised at the amount of waitresses they had serving the restaurant. 

Excellent service, great food, and decent prices. Get a cocktail across the street at Olive, then come here for dinner afterward. Can't go wrong with this place.
author: Eric L.

description:
We saw good yelp reviews for this place so we tried it after a beautiful day at the Asian Art Museum. Boy was it a mistake! 
The service was pretty bad. Fast, but not friendly and not every helpful.
The veggie rolls tasted like something out of the grocery store.
The curry had hardly anything in it
The seafood pad see-ew was pretty good, but there wasn't enough on the plater to go around.
The thai ice-tea was like drinking water.
The fish cakes (which we ordered after we had completed our meal) was like cardboard.
Bottom-line....keep going up Larkin. Anything has to be better then this place.
author: Esperanza T.

description: Came here on a Friday night because I have heard great things about Lers Ros Thai and really wanted to try their pork belly. We were able to find parking about a block away. Just make sure not to leave anything valuable in your car as you are parked in the Tenderloin.. We waited about 10-15 minutes to be seated as the restaurant was packed. As I was scrolling through the menu, I noticed that they had alligator and rabbit listed. I was debating on whether to get it or not, but decided to change my mind and not take the risk as I may not like it. We decided to share the Pork Belly, Roasted Duck Curry, and the Sticky Rice with Mango for dessert. The pork belly reminded me of the roast pork I eat at home. It was a bit salty and dry at the same time, while other pieces were crispy. Nonetheless, the dish was a really big portion. For the roasted duck curry, I wish there were more pieces of the duck. The curry was pretty decent. I was just way too full that I barely ate any of the sticky rice with mango. There was so much sticky rice! It was pretty yummy and authentic. Can't really go wrong with it. I am only giving it three stars because I felt like I was not too big of a fan. Maybe I did not order the right dishes or maybe I guess I had a really high expectation of it.
author: Philana C.

description:
My girlfriend and I were celebrating valentines day and our anniversary, and were going to go to Jimmie Bar Ristorante to have a romantic and classy dinner.  However when we got there at 9PM they were already closed!  Their online website said they closed at 10PM.  SO we ended up walking a block or two and stumbled upon Lers Ros Thai and there was a 30 min wait, so we decided just to wait since it was cold and we were tired of walking around the tenderloin area. 

It was actually a 10 minute wait instead and we were sat down right away.  We ordered chicken pad Thai, and Pad Kra prow with beef and got it mild since it came to order as spicy.  The food came out and everything was one word, AMAZING!  We both did not expect the Thai food to be that great, however, we were wrong and were so surprised that we found such a place.  We were lucky!  The waitresses were all so respectful, nice and attentive.  The food was full of flavor, and the drinks were very good also.  We will be coming here again very soon.
author: Tony T.

description: The pad Thai with shrimp is too legit to quit! When we are feeling take out, this is our go-to spot. The actual restaurant is really cute inside as well - we definitely plan on dining in soon!
author: Jess L.

description:
I agree with the chorus, Lers Ros is the most authentic Thai I've experienced in the Bay Area.  I'm pretty spoiled by ten years in LA (shout-out to Palm Thai and the Thai Elvis!) and six months in Thailand, and Lers Ros brings back happy memories.  The smoky pork shoulder (#9) is a revelation and the Pad Thai is some of the best I've had outside of a dusty Bangkok sidewalk stall.   Soups are excellent too.  Bring a Thai friend to order off the insider's menu written on the blackboard (in Thai only) if you're really brave.

We went on a Sunday at 6:30 and didn't have to wait at all - there was a bit of a line around 7:00 but it quickly died down.  Our service was friendly and efficient, though as others have remarked, don't order everything at once unless you're in a real hurry.  

Great place for authentic Thai grub in a casual (but not divey) atmosphere.
author: Katy M.

description:
Really 3.5 stars.  The place gets SUPER busy so be prepared to wait.  We made reservations ahead of time, so I think that might've helped us get a table quickly.  Or maybe we were just lucky with our timing?  Not sure.  This place is definitely overrated though.  I've been to lots of Thai restaurants and I thought this one lacked in flavor.

I think we got the coconut milk soup and it was really bland.  I didn't have more than one bowl because it wasn't that appetizing.  Not enough substance in there either.  The green curry was SUPER spicy.  The spices overpowered any other flavor that dish might have had.  Someone in my group also ordered the fried rice, and not very memorable either.

Overall, I was just indifferent about the place.  Kinda expensive for the small portions they give you.  I'm sure you can find another Thai place with better food, better prices, and where you don't have to wait to be seated.
author: D N.

description:
One of the better Thai food spots in SF, simply because they have very unique house specials that you can't find elsehwere.

Must gets:
Pork Belly - it's their most popular dish and is extremely crispy on the outside (fatty) and tender on the inside... if you're on a diet skip it, but it is oh so delish.

A unique short rib sour soup that I've never had before (forgot the name) that has a delicious broth I could sip on for an entire meal.

Red curry chicken - only average.. i'd skip it

Pad see ew - average, nothing special

We also saw: snail, rabbit, bison, frog and other gamey delicacies I didn't feel like eating, but for those who want to try, go for it!

And they have 2 HD TV's to watch sports. For 5 people - $13 each after tip and tax.. not bad at all
author: Chuck N.

description: Everything in this restaurant is pretty tasty.  I agree with the highlights that the duck larb and pork belly is scrumptious! Definitely a top Thai restaurant in town. Worth the price. Friendly staff as well. Place does get pretty packed so it's a good idea to have reservations.
author: Carrie T.

description:
I really, really, really hate giving bad reviews...but I feel that this is necessary. 

So the other night we decided to try this place out. After reading the reviews, I said to myself, "This place must be decent! We'll have to try it out! Oh and look at that massive menu! Amazing!" Boy, did I get the experience from Lers Ros Thai and NOT a good one.

I ordered for delivery, a very small order for 2 people which consisted of 1 appetizer and 2 entrees. It took 1 HOUR & 22 MINUTES (yes, I timed it) to get delivery. 

When I made the order the woman on the phone said said, "15 minutes for delivery." I even repeated what she said, "You said FIFTEEN minutes? Really?" And she said, "Yes 15 minutes delivery." An hour later I call and she says, "No, I said 50 minutes. It can take anywhere from 50 minutes to 1 hour and half." Um, if that was the biggest crock of sh*t I had ever heard from anyone as far as delivery time goes. It's not like we live very far from the location, I can drive to their location in less than 10 minutes.

I called back twice within that 1 HOUR & 22 MINUTES that I was waiting for my food (once at the 45 MINUTE mark and second at the 1 HOUR mark), she didn't seem to know what she was doing. "Just wait another 5-10 minutes they will be there." - Second call - "Just wait another 5-10 minutes." What is this a canned response when you don't know what is going on with your delivery person?

The guy finally arrived. Seemed like a decent sort and was relatively apologetic. But seemed to blame it on other things rather than his own punctuality. Now, I understand that sometimes things go wrong, but a call would have been a nice courtesy, "Hey, we'll be a bit longer..." If they had done that they would have gotten a 3.

Now lets talk about the food.

My food was gross - I asked for VERY SPICY and I got mild. The tofu was barely cooked and the portions were scanty. My boyfriend liked his yellow chicken curry. It tasted decent over rice. 

The appetizer, was gross. The fried tofu tasted hardly fried by the time we got it. It was soggy and rubbery. 

I'd be willing to go to the location itself but not order for delivery. The delivery is terrible. 

If I do decide to risk my sanity by going to this place for food again, I will hopefully be able to write a more positive review.
author: Sara M.

description:
I think my singular visit to Lers Ros Thai has totally spoiled me on this cuisine. Perhaps forever. Or until I actually get my ass to Thailand.

First though, let me set the scene. After a pretty damn long walk from Yelp headquarters (sorry, my fellow CM's) through a semi-sketch neighborhood and lots of interacting with the locals (who apparently call Lers Ros "Leroy's") we finally arrived. 

Starved, parched, and frankly relieved to get there in one piece, we turned to a gargantuan menu and it took us a while to collect our thoughts and decide what to order. There is a daily lunch special menu, FYI, but nothing totally appealed that day. We settled on papaya salad, golden fried tofu with some kind of crack-based dipping sauce, basil shrimp and tom ka soup with chicken. The soup was by far the most outstanding - the flavors were spicy and complex, and the coconut wasn't overwhelming or heavy which often happens in this dish. My only regret was that we didn't have a place to store leftovers, otherwise I totally would have been taking everything to my home sweet hotel.

Service can be....leisurely....so if you're in a hurry, you best let them know and that might help. We were there long after the lunch rush and even though there were maybe six other folks in the restaurant, we had to ask a few times for our drinks and bill. Restrooms are upstairs and a little grungy, but that's not why you go here. Right?

Cab it home, ya'll. You can walk off all that food some other time.
author: Laura L.

description:
Excellent pork shoulder appetizer and THANK YOU for not dousing it in sugar like other Americanized Thai restaurants do.  It was spicy, refreshing with citric juice with just a hint of sugar.  

Tried the stuffed squid soup which was just comforting.  Had the pork belly entree and that was the only disappointment.  It was a bit chewy and not that tender.  Reminds me of the Chinese BBQ pork roast except in a Thai sauce.  

Very friendly service but they are understaffed so wait for the menu and wait for them to take your order even on a Tuesday night.
author: Yvonne Y.

description: Nice place in the tenderloin.  Their lunch special is $9, you get this little salad, some rice, and a choice of two items.  My bro got the giant chicken with garlic pork.  I got red curry with ginger chicken.  The food is cooked well and the spices they put in it are perfect.  They had the TV with ESPN on.  Nice lunch spot.
author: Matthew P.

description:
Quaint place with friendly staff. I had friends order and I just ate and enjoyed. Every dish was good, surprisingly good. I remember having the deep fried fish, and satay dishes, rice, etc, and all tasted awesome, like a party in your mouth. 

I am still waiting to go back for 2nds. Doubt you can order a bad dish here.

4 stars for the food alone.
author: Mike W.

description:
Great Thai, only eat it on site. Have been there several times in person at both locations. Loved it both times

For reasons I cannot understand, Lers ros just can't get deliveries right. Tonight was the second time I placed an order with them. I waited an hour and a half last time so I alotted an hour and a half for dinner to arrive. It has been over an hour and a half now and I'm still hungry and out some amount of dollars unknown to me. 

Btw- i was put on hold and dropped twice before i put my order in. And i was not told what my order total was. Thanks Lers ros
author: Ulrick M.

description:
Made a reservation on a friday nite and visited. The greeter/waitress could not find our reservation but seated us after a short wait.
Tried a few specials, including the garlic rabbit, entrail soup and "real" fish cake. Also the special gravy noodles and cucumber salad.
The soup was thick with liver and kidneys, rich and slightly musty. We liked it but don't  order if you dont like organs.
The rabbit was small chunks of bone in flesh, flash fried. The bones were a major distraction and the nuggets tasted like they were prepared some time before and reheated. Not very special nor very garlic infused.
The fish cake was filets of tender white fish napped with a peppery lemongrass based sauce. The whole stems of fresh peppercorn were a nice touch. Gravy noodles were rich and full of sliced pork , gelatinous noodles underneath. The cucumber salad was mild, very fresh. 
Service was efficient and discrete. Sound level was high.
author: Kelly K.

description: Loved the food the first two time I went, third time was alright. Still great food and fast service.
author: A S.

description:
Awesome thai food. More awesome because they deliver to my place.

food: they offer great food blasted full of flavor and spices. At other thai places, the hot is muh, but here I usually have to request mild because the spicy level is off the chart.
They also have a lot of thai food I can't find elsewhere or can but they do it some much better here.

Some of my odder favorites: 
10: garlic quail, I usually hate eating quail because of the bones, but the way they fried them with the crispy garlic is perfect and makes me  eat them bone and all.

12: papaya salad with raw crabs: other places, I find the dressing too tart but Lers Ros makes their with more fish sauce. The flavor of the raw crab is strong, so be prepare to like concentrated crabby taste with their rich orangy-yellow "fat"

15: raw shrimp salad: simple raw shrimp undone with lime based dressing. don't get it if you are on a date as it has raw garlic. 

Delivery is usually a hour to Russian Hill on a weekday, maybe addition 30min on a weekend.

I took a star off because I wish they had a better delivery ordering system set up.
They are old school with calling in to places the order. Last time I was placed on hold 3 times when they got other calls.

If they set up a online ordering system that was automatic, I would give them 5 stars.
author: P.V. H.

description:
Lers Ros is my go-to spot when I'm craving Thai food and I'm too lazy to go out. They offer free delivery for orders of $15 or more and accept credit cards for delivery orders. 

One look at their online menu is mind-boggling and confusing. Ive tried 10-15 dishes. Here are the memorable hits and misses:

Pad kra prow moo krob: Their famous pork belly dish. I was really excited about this dish b/c it seemed like a thai version of lechon kawali (Filipino deep fried pork belly). Lers Ros takes this dish a step further and stirfries deep fried pork belly with chili, basil and a sweet sauce. I was disappointed that the crispness of the fried pork belly was a bit soggy, but I attributed this to delivery. I plan on trying this at their restaurant location. 

Steamed sea bass: A whole steamed sea bass served in a coconut broth. The fish was very fresh and tender and perfectly accented by the light broth. This was a hit with my family and the favorite dish of the night. 

Pad thai: Pretty standard. I prefer my pad thai to be sweeter. 

Bbq chicken: YUM! I order this without fail every single time. The chicken is  flavorful and perfect with the Thai chili sauce. It remains surprisingly tender when served as leftovers the next day. 

Pad kee mow: My bf's favorite noodle dish here.  Broad rice noodles, soy sauce, fish sauce, garlic, meat or tofu, bean sprouts, and various seasonings. Chili and basil give it a nice kick!

Yellow curry: Delicious! After all the chicken is gone, I like to save the curry broth and eat it with rice the next day. 

I've also been to the restaurant location and was pleasantly surprised by the classy decor and attentive service. Lers Ros is a solid go-to spot for Thai food, either delivery or at their restaurant location.
author: Monelle A.

description: Too spicy for me, but I still torture myself to eat here just because their dishes are authentic and great! I always order the crocodile, rabbit, boar dish. I mean if you are just going to order the conservative stuff, no need to go here and wait in the line right?
author: Diana C.

description: Best Thai food ever.  I'm from LA, we have plenty of Thai food here, and I can truly say Lers Ros is one of the best Thai I have ever had.  If you're looking for authentic Thai with amazing flavor try this place out.
author: Prosoeur K.

description: We went here for lunch and I love the hole in the wall authentic type atmosphere. The food was really good, but nothing crazy special. The quail was kind of dry, but the noodles that we had were very good. For authentic thai it was delicious. Mild spicy is super spicy FYI.
author: Alissa N.

description:
This place is amazing! Flavors are very complex and never disappoints. 

For starters I tried the Larb Phed Yang (roasted duck larb) and the Koh Moo Yang (pork shoulder). The duck larb was amazingly good and a must try. The pork shoulder was smokey and you know it can only come from a wood burning grill. Either that or they have one hell of a trick up their sleeves. It reminds me of the smokiness of Nopa's pork chops and with the dipping sauce it just adds another dimension. 

Had the Pad Kee Mow (spicy flat noodles) with chicken and Tom Kha Kai (coconut milk based soup) with shrimp for the entrees. Pad Kee Mow wasn't anything special from what I've had before. The Tom Kha Kai comes in a showboating flaming pot which I'm sure can gain points if taking a date. The soup itself looked like it was going to be extremely spicy with the peppers and chili oil floating around in the soup but the spiciness was offset by the coconut milk. 

Lers Ros Thai is now my go-to for Thai food. And check out the worker who takes phone orders. I saw her on two phones taking orders while ringing up a to-go order for another customer. Talk about multitasking!
author: Eric L.

description: I have had a few dishes here (pad kee maw, crab fried rice, green curry) and everything has always been tasty, but has not lived up to the reputation this place has as the best Thai restaurant in the city.  That being said, I would never turn down an invitation here.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
I saw Lers Ros on Check Please Bay Area.  Rave reviews from all the participants and great looking food made me want to try this place.  I had the Tom Kha Gai and a chili chicken dish.

The Tom Kha Gai was very good, although the "half" portion may have meant "too much for one person by half".  The chicken, on the other hand, was dry, and little more than it's name on the menu - chicken and chili paste.  I had expected a wonderful thai sauce - sad face.

I suspect I ordered poorly - I should have asked the staff for guidance in my selections since I didn't recognize many of the items.

I would try it again, but won't rush to do so.
author: Andy B.

description: Very delicious. We had shrimp papaya salad and five spice duck, both were great.  The location on Larkin is a bit sketchy but the interior is very nice. Finally, the wait staff were very efficient and professional.
author: Harry P.

description:
UYE with yelpers from LA, Stockton, SF and the East Bay!  

What a plentiful feast.... Everything was pretty darn good except for the mussels which were absolutely disgusting. I don't know what the restaurant was thinking...  Thanks for the warning Anthony.  Now I realize why you told me to try just one.  

Everything else though was tasty and impressive including the frog legs which people didn't realize were actually frog legs until the other Daniel L announced it afterwards. =P  

And for $27 per head for endless plates of delicious Thai cuisine that filled all 27 - 30 people?!  Now that's a deal!  Kudos to Daniel L, Maybelline C, Anthony N, and Val C for another successful UYE.  And thanks Manabu for the tour of your "totally awesome" views from your rooftop terrace.
author: Danny L.

description:
I ordered delivery from this place and they said it would take about an hour to be delivered. We live in SOMA and it was a dinner order for two people. 

After two hours, we still didn't have our food so we called back to see if they were coming and the girl on the phone assured us that it would only be another 15 minutes. We ended up calling back another two times and she said the same thing...15 more minutes...

When the food finally arrived 4 hours later it was room temperature and kind of soggy. They didn't apologize or offer us a discount. 

We were really hungry so I guess it tasted alright, but it wasn't that great. Even if it had come on time I don't think I would have ordered it again. 
 
Bad times :(
author: M M.

description: Food was good, defaulted to this spot after unable to locate another Thai place. Place was clean, don't think they want you to stay long, chairs (little benches) are uncomfortable.  Hd the Kad (chopped chicken with basil), wish they offered different dègres of spice.  Did ask and received the tray of spices but the jalapeño peppers instead of hot they had been sitting in vinegar . ( glad I like vinegar).  Overall will try again.  Where is Racha Thai ?
author: Christine B.

description: This place is small, but the food is GREAT! Went here with my husband and a friend visiting from out of town. We all three got different things and all three were fantastic. Also the Thai coffee was out of this world. A Papaya salad came with my meal and that was the highlight for sure. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for some good Thai.
author: Rachel T.
