In the past 2 months, I've been at least 6 times and I've gotten the stir fried pork belly, pad thai, pad see ew, vegetarian green curry, papaya salad with prawns, stir fried boar, crispy chicken, tom yum koong, and tom sabb.

I think the standouts were the pork belly, tom yum koong, stir fried eel, and papaya salad. However everything was only a notch from greatness; it stands to reason that this is all dependent on mood, the spiciness level perhaps due to the weather, or how much you can tolerate on the can the next day.

Imported and premium domestic beers are fairly cheap a 3.50 a pop.

The only drawbacks to this place are the fluorescent lighting during the day and general lack of decor - but who cares when the food is this good.
author: Anthony K.

description:
Overall, it was OK.  The Pad See Ew was pretty good.  

The portion size is on a the small side.  

Half of the food we ordered came so late.  We waited for another 15 minutes for it! not cool when you're hungry.
author: Miss B.

description: Authentic thai food, mostly and pretty tasty too. Make a reservation cause they're always busy.
author: Mary S.

description:
More like a 3.5 but I will give them a four pending on tasting some of their more exotic dishes. 

We had the coconut lime chicken soup. It was awesome. I had the lime sirlion and it was good but should've been hotter and cooked a bit more then medium-rare. Lastly we had the yellow curry with tofu and this was good but it is probably better with chicken. I will go there again. YUM!
author: Genaro R.

description:
i had dinner here the other night with a few friends and was quite impressed with the array of dishes they had.  they serve a large variety of beers including thai and japanese beers along with sake and wine.

food:

duck larb: best dish of the night.  i loved how spicy the dish was with the dried red peppers and the flavor from the red onions and spices.  i haven't had duck larb anywhere else.  

fried chicken with fried rice: the standard dish, the chicken was good and so was the rice!

red curry: we got this dish with chicken, it wasn't that spicy but it had a lot of flavor.

pork belly: my friend was raving about this dish.  it was good but not spectacular.  the skin was a little too crunchy for my liking.

papaya salad with crab: the salad was spicy and very flavorful but the raw blue crab in there kinda freaked me out.  i like my papaya salad traditionally without crab.

they deliver so that's a plus!  i'll definitely be back again or call for delivery.
author: Carli F.

description:
Two words =  'Pork Belly'

Four words = 'Get the Pork Belly!'

Tell me you won't dream about it for weeks afterwards.
author: Kristina A.

description: Great Thai food! My date and I shared the duck salad and pork belly. The food came out super quick and everything was really tasty. The atmosphere and prices make it a nice place to go for a date without having to break your wallet.
author: Matt J.

description: This is one of the few places in San Francisco where I've found authentic Thai boat noodle or kuay dieu reu. It originates from the villages of Thailand where it is served in small portions, the soup has blood and herbs added to it and tastes like nothing you've ever had before but blending the four main Thai flavors of sweet, sour, salty and bitter. Both the pork and beef are great, although the pork has a slightly sweeter taste. I usually go for this with a fresh young coconut when I come alone, and always get the steamed fish when I eat with groups. Expect to wait a bit on Fridays and Saturday nights, it gets crowded here.
author: Mark Y.

description: Unremarkable spring rolls and chicken satay. May try other dishes next time.
author: Inigo M.

description: I came here today with cravings for authentic Thai food. I went to Thailand for two weeks and made a point to eat at only authentic places and not fall for the tourist Thai food places. Anyways, about the service first. When we came into the restaurant, one server was ready with our menus and a smile. She asked us how many and then proceeded to set up the chairs - no wait time!! After a few minutes, another server came and took our time. He was very patient considering we kept changing our orders and displayed a sense of humor. In the end, I ordered the Tom yum noodle soup and my companions the prawn pad Thai. The Tom Yum tasted extremely authentic but wasn't as spicy as expected. Pad Thai is extremely hard to make well, so I was pleasantly surprised when I found the pad Thai was not too wet and the prawns cooked just right. Needless to say, I finished every last bite of the Tom Yum noodle soup and the prawn pad Thai. The neighborhood was a little sketch so I wouldn't recommend coming at night, but otherwise a solid restaurant!
author: Cindy N.

description:
Delicious! We went for a 11pm dinner the other night and throughly enjoyed ourselves! We were so hungry we asked our super sweet waitress to order for us. 

What she delivered to the table:
Papaya Salad with Shrimp * Green Curry with Fishcakes *Beef Flat noodles *Fried Pork Spare Ribs 

We were in heaven. My favorites hands down the papaya salad and green curry. I can not wait to go back and try more dishes...I cant believe it took me this long to find this gem!
author: Rachna P.

description:
This place is pretty awesome.  Before eating here, I don't think I really knew what authentic Thai food was all about.  In fact, I didn't really like it because I thought it was a little too sweet. I think I've been eating the Panda Express of Thai food until my eyes (and taste buds) were finally opened by Lers Ros Thai.

The flavors are insane. It was like an explosion of salty, sour, spicy goodness in my mouth.  I haven't tried most of the menu yet, but the Thai sausage, Thai curry puffs, and red curry have left me wanting to go back and try the Tom Yum with whole sea bass, alligator, and something equally delectable.

I've also had the Pad Kee Mao, but I'd have to say it isn't one of their better dishes.  I'd go here more for the "exotic" dishes that you can't really find at other Thai places.

All in all, great place.  Definitely will be going back and will definitely introduce to friends.
author: CJ K.

description:
my new favorite thai!  

pork shoulder
deep fried flounder
pork belly

chang beer

enough said!
author: Kevin L.

description:
I was waiting to come here with Thai food experts, my parents!! Haha. Anyways, we came by last night to try it out...

Parking-found parking close by, I DO NOT like this area. Run into where I need to go and straight back to my car! But it is the TL and thank goodness the sun was still out. 

Decor-it was ok, not impressed but not turned off either

Service-very sweet staff, but thats most Thai ppl for you. I don't think I've met a bad one yet.

Food:
Eggrolls- blah. Mom makes better ones, perhaps I'm a bit bias too.
Yum Talay- it was good, Flavorful enough. Forgot to tell them no no on the damn onions though.
 Rest of the fam got: Kuay Tiew of seafood, pork, and beef...they all liked it. Guess I'm the only one not in the mood for Thai tonight.
author: Lola D.

description: I guess that American people don't really know what's Thai food suppose  to taste like, the chicken basil dish is very sweet and no basil, pork shoulder is lot of fat. This is not a four star restaurant but maybe for some people that really don't know Thai food.
author: Angkana P.

description: The food here is good but the service needs a serious face lift!  Went here on two occasions with Asian friends and both times the seating hostess refused to seat us because we were only 2 people and the numerous empty tables that she refused to assign to us were being retained for possible crowds of 3 or 4 people!!!!  Its amazing how cockeyed this kind of logic is...would you rather serve customers who are already there or piss them off in anticipation of bigger groups that may or may not show up?!  After negotiation, we finally got seated at a table for 4.  The next thing I observe a Caucasian couple (male and female...party of 2) walks in and they are immediately seated at a table for 4 without a whimper by the same hostess!!!!  And I ask myself....racial discrimination?! Hmmmmm......
author: Donna D.

description:
In somehow, lunch combination today was weird...

(btw, I've never order this before)

I went there with my friends, they ordered chicken satay combo for 2 ORDERS..what we've got was 4 CHICKEN SATAYS AND 1 SCOOP OF WHITE RICE.

So we were very doubt if this was 2 orders already??   We've asked waitress who replied this was combined for 2 orders already...

wth...

We were very shocked and tried to ask further info but waitress left us and shook her head on the way...

:(

So disappointed with this good place...
author: J H.

description:
Ridicuous wait!! There was a huge party when we arrived, so we waited about 30 minutes for our table of 8. Luckily, we got a drink beforehand, so we just stood outside chatting. This place is packed like a sardine can. Everyone is bumping into each other and not minding it at all. The fast asian waitresses are like ninjas. One minute my rice bowl was gone and another it reappeared. They are quick to change your plates, switch bowls and utensils.

Our table decided to do family style with everything, which we were glad to do since all of our food came out in different times. The soup noodles came out way before the curry dishes and other entrees. We started off with some spicy shrimp and cabbage dish. Of course, it was super loud inside, so it was hard to hear from the other people from the other side of the table. Although it was spicy, it wasn't unbearable. It was also a little sour, so it opened up my appetite for the soup noodles. The tom yom came in a flaming pot, there was fire coming out in the middle!! Get any closer and you might need to tattoo your eyebrows on afterwards. I got the meat stuffed cuttlefish soup noodle. I would have to say it was very interesting, the meat was good and soft, but the cuttlefish was pretty chewy. I did like my clear broth with fish balls, tofu, and napa cabbage. It was soothing and countered the spicy appetizer really well. Then came our chicken skewers .. always tender and just enough curry and paired well with the peanut sauce. I think next was the pad siew (noodle dish), which I love already. The only thing that was a disappointment was the rabbit dish. It was overly fried, which made the meat dry. It's normally pretty juicy and tender.

Also, try the duck curry. Just enough spice, but great when soaked in the rice.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Best Thai in town. Pork belly can be hit or miss. Steamed fish is always good. Menu can be overwhelming. But great food.
author: Christian A.

description: The food was very unique.  I had the frog and could have definitely just snacked on that all night.  The seating was kind of annoying since we had to sit very close to people in bench style seating.  It was really busy when we got there, but it died out almost immediately as we were finishing our meal.  There were a lot of unique foods on the menu, and I would go back to try them.
author: James S.

description:
The food was really awesome.  We got to try 8 different things because there were a bunch of us and about 6 of them were super awesome.

This is one of the two Thai restaurants in the city that a Thai friend will eat at.  The entrees are $7-10.  Don't know how that gets two dollar signs.
author: John A.

description: Absolutely delicious food!  The waitresses are so attentive and polite.  You don't feel rushed to get out of there.  It may be a bit noisy during the evening, but the food is worth it!!!!!
author: Liza P.

description:
this is some damn good thai.

the more people you show up with, the more dishes you can get to share. the sliced pork appetizer was my standout, i didn't order so i can't name it exactly.
author: Ameer N.

description: Parking is fairly easy in this neighborhood.  If you're lucky, a energectic pedestrian may be waving you down to park at a public parking spot for a quick buck.  At times it may be pack.  Very friendly Thai staff for the full Thai experience.  They serve exotic dishes here, kind of has that Asia flare to it.  I tried the Garlic Pepper Rabbit, which was pan fried in small pieces and served with a very spicey hot sauce.  What also went well with the meal was the sticky rice, crab papaya salad, and Pad Thai.
author: Jimmy N.

description: I actually didn't have a very good experience here, which I'm kind of sad about because this place got such good reviews. I ordered the chicken green curry, and the chicken was just so dry that I couldn't really enjoy it. I definitely want to come back and get something else, though. Probably can't go wrong with a noodle. And I'll stay away from the chicken.
author: Jamie C.

description:
Tried this last night for delivery and it was very good!  I had the red curry with vegetables and tofu, and my husband had kee mao (pan-fried noodles).  Both reasonably priced at about $8 each.

The minimum for delivery is $15 -- not bad, and rice is $1.50, rather than $3 or $4 as it is at many places.

$20 for dinner for two, including tip -- not bad!  A nice break from Osha's prices.

We'll be ordering again!

---

Update after 2nd time ordering for delivery: the food was, once again, very good, but I ordered at 10pm on a Monday and didn't get the food until 11pm.  I was disappointed by this wait time and hope it isn't the norm.
author: Molly P.

description: Looove Lers Ros - I've sampled a decent variety of their dishes and they're all good, but I'm always craving that pad thai.
author: Sue D.

description:
went for a late night snack.. food is pretty good but definitely not 5 stars. i'd say borderline 3.5-4.
curries were good but nothing memorable. convenient as they open up fairly late and a better option than osha!
author: Anthony S.

description:
Hands down the best thai food i have had in San Francisco. Also the opinion of my girlfriend who is Thai and her family. Whenever they go out for thai food this is where they go. Thats got to say something for the authenticity of what happening in the kitchen. Crispy pork belly with broccoli and stir fried morning glory are 2 of my favorite side dishes.
Open late as well so you can beat the crowds by dining later than usual.
author: kenny d.

description: After having spent some time in Thailand, I learned how Americanized most of the Thai food I was eating before was, and became more selective when I returned home. I was craving Thai food on a recent trip to SF, and thank goodness I found Lers Ros! I'm always a sucker for curry puffs, and they did not disappoint. The sauce they were served with was awesome too. Next up was the Kang Keaw Wan with chicken (green curry). It was deliciously flavored and medium spicy was just enough heat. After that we tried the Pad Kee Mow with prawns. A touch salty, but still awesome and flavorful. We finished up with the mango and sticky rice - yum! The restaurant was packed the entire night, although tables move quickly, so you probably won't have to wait long. Like the others have said, the neighborhood isn't the best, but it was worth it. I would highly recommend Lers Ros for a fantastic Thai meal at a good price. ($50 for 1 app, 2 entrees, 1 dessert, and tip)
author: Christine P.

description:
Spicy and delicious! Not your run of the mill Thai place.  Casual place in not the nicest 'hood. BUt food is great, so who cares!  Don't sit by the door on a cold night--it's freezing!

Wed dinner, 8pm, no wait.  Had the spicy fish cakes, which were...spicy. Loved the sauce, drowned my ginger rice in it (ginger rice = yummy).  Also had the fried pork belly w/crispy rind. This isn't something I'd normally think t o order, or anything I'd come across at other thai places.  but I had to b/c I just read so mucgh about it. It was yummy and different-- savory, crispy (a bit chewy crispy).  also got the pad thai, which was just ok to me.  A bit clumpier in consistency than I like.

I would definitely return to try other things.
author: Caroline I.

description:
WHAT THE HELL HAPPENED TO THE FOOD AT LERS ROS TL? I used to love this place so much, would recommend Lers Ros to locals and visitors full heartedly. Now flavors in their dishes have diminished so much that it now tastes like THAI CARDBOARD! yeah what the hell Ler Ros? Fix your flavor profile. 
Eating there used to be a total Thai food eating adventure. The Thai flavors jumped out, no, punched out, in every bite. When they asked, don't think they do any more,  if you wanted a dish spicy, medium or mild, and you asked for hot- it was authentically THAI SPICEY HOT. Their dishes had that wonderful spicy, sour, salty and so fragrant Thai profile that one other Thai food place had. It was magic. 
Sorry magic, proof, gone. But people who heard what it was like are willing to stand in line for what it used to be. I'm kinda sad because i had some amazing food there for years. 
If they get their flavor back, let me know.
author: flashegirl e.

description:
All right yelpers, I've ben living in Thailand  for 18 years, well actually i'm Thai. I have to say that this place rocks my taste buds real hard.

From a real thai dude, this is the best thai place in SF. 
All of the thais here are saying that this place is really the best.
For real, their food tastes exactly like what i had in bangkok.
 
   Tip for none-thai eaters : forget the old  green curry, try gang-som-cha-omm-todd, a thai old shool spicy soup w/ thai style herb omelet and shimp. Man!!! it's  awesomely dilicioso!!!.
   
   If you like pad-kra-pao ( the stir fried basil dish) ask for kra-pao-moo-krob, crispy deep fried pork stir fried w/ basil.
It will take your taste buds to bangkok after the first bite.
 
   ohhh!! just so you know, they also have some crazy food for you to try as well. the last time i went there the spacial was alligator satay. If you want to try, ask your server cause they write it in thai on a board  on the big refrigereter. 

   So if you want to eat the real thai food this is the best place to go for. Ask the server for recommendation, tell them  that you want to eat like a thai. You know, thai food isn't just about pad thai or green curry chicken. There are so many good stuff that you might haven't tried yet. Then if you are tired of the same old thai food you always order, come and you won't be disappointed.

Trust this thai dude and you'll see the light!!!!
author: tim t.

description:
I came to this place based on the high Yelp reviews and I was not disappointed. I tried to come earlier with some out-of-town cousins, but they weren't to keen on going to Civic Center/Tenderloin. Oh well. On my recent trip here I didn't even see any prostitutes, drug dealers, or skateboarders coming towards my car in the opposite direction down a one-way street. Yep, saw that once, at morning rush hour no less. My friend was busy texting, but must have caught something out of the corner of her eye because after skate girl passed, my friend said "Was that just a skater coming down the middle of the street?" Yep, you weren't hallucinating. Back to the review...

This place has an extensive menu! Seriously, this is probably the biggest Thai menu I have seen. My medium-spiced food was spiced perfectly. None of that weak shit here thank you very much. Those sensitive to spice should take heed though. It was too much for my friend. Sometimes I wonder if she really is Pakistani? Severaly of her white boy friends eat far spicier than her, and she grew up with it. 

For the more adventurous out there, they server Alligator, Venison, Rabbit, Wild Boar, and Frog. Ribbit! Ribbit! I didn't try any of that, but maybe in the future. Having just gotten back from a trip to Thailand, Cambodia, and Vietnam, I wasn't too surprised by any of this. Alligator in particular was pretty common on menus over there.

Oh, this place is staffed to the max! I could swear there were 5 waitresses working there, for 5 tables! Yeah, service was quick and efficient.

I will be back!
author: Ken L.

description:
People who don't like this restaurant, probably do not like real Thai food. Lers Ros and Sai Jai Thai definitely hold it down in the Thai food category on this side of Fillmore Ave. 

Lers Ros has many authentic Thai dishes you would be unable to find in any other Thai restaraunts. Though many people may find their Americanized dishes dissapointing, they actually taste a lot closer to how they actually would in Thailand, which is actually, delicious.

I recommend the Grilled Pork Shoulder with chili sauce as an appetizer. The rice porridge is really great (especially when you have a cold). The Papaya salad with salted crab is great. I have tried tons of things, and loved them all. But be warned, everything here is Spicy. No joke. 

There must be a reason our Thai friends drive all the way from the East Bay to meet us here for dinner, and why its become such a popular hangout for so many Thai customers.
author: Jay M.

description: Cant get enough of this place !! Huge selection of food and so far everything has been great. One item that is a MUST try though -  the Tom Yum Koong soup. Just trust me on this one..
author: Sunni B.

description: This is one of our spots for Thai food.  Fired rice with veggies is excellent, big portion for one, though(around $8-10). Unfortunately, they don't have just plain fried rice, which I  think they should as many other Thai places. Love their garlic frog and garlic quail (appetizers). They have 3 kinds of fish, we've tried 2 so far - OK. On your way to try the third one. Fried banana with ice cream and cristal chesnut dessert are yami! Service is very quick, unless they are super busy. The only thing is that sometimes it's hard to be understood by servers due to language barrier.
author: Anastasia B.

description: If you're afraid of spices but want your instagram friends to think you're a foodie, this is your spot! The square plates make it "upscale", and you don't have to worry about mispronouncing the dish names because as far as I can tell, no one in this restaurant has been to Thailand. Easily the worst restaurant on the area.
author: Jim S.

description: Absolutely the best Thai place I've eaten stateside! While it's in one of the crappiest parts of town, the waitresses are cute and nice and made me feel special each time I came to get my take-out of delicious red curry (kang deng) with pineapple, and Thai eggplant. The best dish available. Definitely miss this one!
author: Benjamin T.

description:
Disclaimer: I only had it catered to an event, so I can't comment on the service or seating.

Food: It's very good! It was catered to our function yesterday and even though the food wasn't "fresh" out of the pot, they tasted great ;-)

There was enough "heat" and definitely enough flavor in all the dishes served - chicken satay, vegetables with peanut sauce (on the side, thankfully), sliced beef with spicy "vinegrette", chicken coconut curry, and a few other yummy dishes that I can't remember the names of. I'd love to go to their restaurant and try the other dishes out soon.
author: M C.

description: My wife and I went and they Charged Me Twice for the same meal on my credit card. When I received my credit card bill at the end of the month and saw the duplicate charge they Refused to give me credit for the duplicate charge and said they did not do it and it was the credit card companys fault. I called my credit card company and they called them with me on the phone and they still refused to credit me  I left a good tip for my meal felling sorry for my server Cherry and they double charged me for that!!!!
author: S B.

description:
SO much food!  My friend an I had lunch here yesterday, and I have to admit, there's definitely a reason why I keep coming back (besides the fact that the space inside is so clean and spacious that I forget that I live in the Tenderloin).  The food is great!  

I've been to Lers Ros several times already in the past month.  It's a good and reliable Thai restaurant with good food, large quantities (for lunch I always have to take portions of my food home as leftovers), and cheap prices (consider I have to take food home, that's like two meals for the price of ~$8-9.  Not bad.). 

The lunch specials let you choose two dishes to go with rice, and it comes with a salad.  I ordered the red curry with pork, as well as the Kai Yang (marinated barbecued chicken, served with sweet and sour sauce).  My friend ordered an eggplant tofu dish (pad makuer tofu) and the yellow curry with pork.

We first had the salad.  I think this was the weakest point of the meal.  The dressing was a little too sweet and overpowering.  I'm not sure what type of dressing they use-- a derivative of sweet and sour sauce, perhaps?  It's a simple salad-- just cabbage and some shavings of carrot-- and the dressing was just too strong for the simplicity of the salad.  I would recommend toning down the amount of sweetness in the dressing.

However, despite the salad, all our dishes were excellent.  The red curry was just spicy enough to take the edge off the cold from outside without being too spicy (SF weather has been-- well, SF weather has been, period.  It blows cold a lot, and it has definitely been blowing very cold and wet recently), and I really enjoyed the smokiness of the barbecued chicken.  It was an entire leg of chicken-- which is a TON of food for me.  So I brought half a leg of chicken home.  My curry, on the other hand, was too good to save, and I polished it off in record time (much to the dismay of my diet plans).  My friend finished off ALL her dishes.  In other words, she loved it.  :D

Ultimately, this place is excellent.  The food is flavorful, the restaurant itself is clean and spacious (none of that squished, Tenderloin muck bleeding in!), and the service is good.
author: Jeanne Y.

description:
This is the only Thai place I've tried so far, and it was bomb. 

The Pad Thai (classic staple) was solid, hot, and a delightful blend of vegetables and meat. 

So this stays on top of the pyramid until something else better comes along.
author: Abel L.

description: Some of the best Thai I've had outside of Thailand... Cannot go wrong.  Enjoy!
author: Jacob A.

description:
Wound up here on a early saturday night (7:30pm).  If you get here any later, you will surely be in for a wait.  Get here early!

The food:  Amazing!  There were 13 of us, so we got to order many plates.  Because there was so much food, I didn't get to taste it all, but everything I tasted was amazing!  Whenever I'm in town, i'll be sure to this place again.  I even took a few locals who were surprised by the food.  Amazing.  6 stars!

The Staff:  Friendly, helpful, prompt.  Don't remember and empty glass.  5 stars!

Decoration:  Plane Jane.  Don't go here for the decore, but go for the friendly service and amazing food!  2.5 stars

Overall: The food and staff easily over come any decoration issues!  A "must eat" place for those who love Thai.  

You must get the Tom Yum soup!!
author: MItch S.

description:
We went to this place on 3-31-09 it was half full , we ordered BBQ chicken(very good) and mix meal with noodle, chicken,beef (very good) 
the last dish was a curry with veggies(very good). service was very good , the place is a little dark but some people like it like that. other things you should know, it is located at the tenderloin you WILL see street people when you walk to and from the restaurant. along with massage parlors. 
parking is OK not really that hard. total with drinks $29.00 no tips.
author: Howard J.

description: Best thai in SF. Everything is great, very authentic. There is a secret thai menu as well. You really can't go wrong, plus they deliver! Go for the stewed pork leg with mustard greens, as well as the crispy pork belly with basil, to name a few.
author: Bass T.

description: I want to thank all of the staff at Lers Ros for taking such good care of the 25 people in my group today.  The service was impeccable and the food simply amazing.  Lers Ros is a great location with fabulous food.
author: Catania G.

description: Best Thai food I've ever had!  You gotta try their Pork Belly(Pad kra prow moo krob) and food are also very affordable.  The restaurant gets pretty packed so, if you live around the restaurant (Civic Center, Hayes Valley, Nob Hill), you should def get it delivered!
author: Norio I.

description: OK, been to the one in Hayes Valley but after seeing them on "Check Please" I wanted to try the Tenderloin location.  Food was even a little better here, but beware - when it's busy (and it was nuts the night we went) the service can be slow.  Took ages to get our drinks and our order taken.  But hey, that's the price for popularity, right?  Food is AMAZING. Most authentic thai I've ever had outside of Thailand.  I'll be back.
author: Carmen K.

description:
This place is clean, well lighted, has a bar setup in the front, which puts it ahead of most of the other shops on the street.  

Boar, alligator, frog, quail and snake are among some of the choices on their extensive menu.   I would suggest looking at the menu beforehand, cause there is so many options and it takes a while to look through.   There is a shortened lunch menu where you choose a couple dishes.  Overall, tasty
author: David T.

description:
Where to start?  This place is Maaar-volous! I've been to this establishment twice, where the first time I was like "okay, near the 20th Century tittie bar and the neighborhood...not the best."  But I was SO impressed with the atmosphere, the service and the food, even with the stuff that made my mouth burn so bad it went numb (it's the Squid salad appetizer...do not be fooled.  It should have that robot from Lost in Space flailing about screaming "DANGER! DANGER!") LOL! 
   
    Aside from me being a super gringo (or Gringa for those paying attention) in that I can't handle anything really above their medium spiciness (which is my "AHHH! HOT!"), I love their food.  They're the only place I've seen in the city  thus far that has on their menu fried Frog(Super delicious but watch for the bones) and alligator(which I've heard is extremely good and in a perverse way, makes you feel good eating it because you know if it was between you and the Gater in a fight, you'd loose).  Their menu has the English translated name of the food along with the thai written name and all after a number, because who likes to try and pronounce a word(s) and look like a jackass when you butcher it?  Super big plus.  
   
  Their coconut milk curries are so good...I had the green one (number 36) and yes, medium spicy, but HOT for me.  I asked the waitress her opinion and she said that that one is her favorite among the curries.  Last time had a 37 with the roasted duck and yes, it was also beyond expectation. I recommend trying any of their noodle dishes, even the soups, as I've had one of them, but now as I look at the menu, I can't recollect which one I had.
   
   Mmm...another great point is their beer selection.  Though limited, super good beers at a super great price for imports and specialties (Sapporo, Singha, and others are $3.50).
  
   So just try it...it's better than Thai Stick and I'll say second-to-none with traditional, creative, and satisfying food for a little dinero.
author: Veronica S.

description: Called in for to go order. They had my order ready to go in a bag and I picked it up and got home. No fork or napkins inside and I have no utensils due to just moving. Haven't even eaten the food yet. Automatic one star.
author: stephen c.

description:
Coming from a former Thai restaurant employee I am very picky on my Thai food damn it. This place defiantly is in the top two! 
We got there around 9pm on a Saturday night. The place was packed, we had to sit at the table directly in front of the door. Which wasn't so bad once we got our food b/c it was hot! 

We got the drunken noodle (thick pan fried noodle Basil) pork & green curry chicken, Which was yummy & spicy. The service was nice, the girls always kept my drink topped off. 

I will be back! Oops BUT parking was a B*****
author: Jovita M.

description:
5-star rating is for their food because I wouldn't go there for the ambiance.

This is the best Thai food period.  With every bite, I said, "I can't believe it.  I've never tasted Thai food like this."  The food is fresh.  Most Thai places mask their food with heavy sauces.  This is unlike any Thai you've ever tasted.  Refreshing goodness.  Healthy and tasty!  The fact that the place was a mob of Thai customers says something.
author: catherine g.

description: This was my first visit and I went alone, so I did not get to try much.  The pork larb was really good.  I would have liked it a tad spicier, but next time I will just ask for it that way.  I was craving pad Thai, so I got it, notwithstanding the wide selection of interesting and unusual dishes on the menu.  The texture of the noodles was perfect.  Just perfect.  This dish can be maligned, but it is really good at Lers Ros -- if you are in the mood for pad Thai, go there.  I cannot wait to go back with my husband so we can try more dishes.  So much better than other Thai places.  Totally worth a trip to the TL.
author: Amber B.

description: A friend of mine, loves this place.  Because of this, I've been here lots of time.  The food and the service is always outstanding.  I can't say its the best thai I've ever had, but it is certainly more than decent.
author: Lawrence C.

description:
I don't think I've ever actually had bad thai food in San Francisco. I've been eating thai for years at various places, and even stayed in Thailand for 2 weeks eating food all around the country....

So what is up with this place?

Kao Na Ped (roast duck over rice) was a complete fiasco... a sour tasting sauce, with NO spinach or veggies... when i asked for thai spiced soy sauce to dip it in, what I got was a dark, sour tasting sauce....

The Pad Thai wasn't any much better... no pad thai I have ever seen in any restaurant... 

I don't know about this place.... and I certainly wont be going back
author: V T.

description: I ordered the dark larb and thought it was okay. It was good, but it didn't merit the recommendation from 7x7 in my opinion. Would I go back? Yeah, but not anytime soon.
author: Emmanuel C.

description:
Ok, so Yelp works.  It actually works.  My yelp pal, Derrick V. told me about Ler Ros Thai. Since it is just down the street from my normal tendo Thai dinning spot, The Thai House Express.  

The vibe here was also laid back, inexpensive and tasty.  I tried the Pad See-ew to compare it with the Thai House.  And it hit the mark.  The food was very fresh and delicious.  And the service at Lers Ros was great.  We had two young Thai watresses refilling our tea and water attentively. Cozy. The restaurant was pretty empty at the time.  So this may have been the reason.  But regardless, they were taking care of us well.

My only minor complaint here is that they don't have the same hot sauce that they have at the Thai House.  But the food was great and I grabbed a menu at the bar on the way out.  Wow, they deliver and provide catering as well.  Awesome new discovery........
author: Georgio N.

description: I still miss the old Lers Ros, they've cut portion to less than half, food is saltier and prices have gone up by $4
author: A C.

description: Yummy thai food. Courteous staff ! Took off 1 star because the mango sticky rice - which is a staple at all good thai restaurants ...was not any good
author: Mary T.

description:
I can not say enough bad things about this establishment. I will review dishes that were ordered.

First, my friend ordered the quail. Now I am not an expert on quail, but I know that it should yield at least half of an edible portion, and not just fried bones.

Second, I ordered pan fried noodles. I chose to play it safe considering this was my first time at this place. I have eaten at many Thai restaurants and pan fried noodles is something that takes skill to MESS UP, pause. The definition of Thai food does not mean something drenched in Tamarind Chili/Pepper. 

Lastly, I tried the yellow curry. My gripe with this dish was that it was 75% onions, and 25% everything else. This dish also had a little kick to it, which is unexpected since yellow curry is usually the least spicy of the curries.  

Ultimately, I gave this restaurant one star due to the fact that multiple people at my party proclaimed this to be the worst Thai food they have ever had, and have sworn off Thai food since the time we all ate there (3 months ago). Personally, it took me about 1 month to recover due to the fact that the sound of Thai food made me think of my horrendous experience at Lers Ros Thai.
author: Richard D.

description: Another excellent place for thai food in the city.  Love their duck salad, great taste tho on the fatty side cus it's duck.
author: Happi Y.

description:
I seriously almost blew a gasket eating here.

I, along with my better half, have a fairly high tolerance for spicy food and literally had tears streaming down our faces for the duration of our meal.

The green papaya sald was phenomenal as was the spicy basil tofu- just spicy as FIERY HELL.

The waiters know whats up and will stand by with water pitchers awaiting to quench the fire your mouth will be engulfed with.  Unfortunately nothing abates that fire...my lips burned through the night...
author: Gabrielle J.

description: Their five spice chicken fried rice is THEEEE BEST! I'll be back... but I'm never in TL unless I'm going to Turtle Tower cuz the streets smell like pee and B.O., but I will try my best! :D
author: Wendy L.

description: Terrible customer service, too hot inside, not enough room on the tables for all the plates and food and kept getting bumped while I sat by the wait staff. Just terrible. Food is not very authentic either.
author: Hafiz L.

description:
This one is easy: DELICIOUS!!!!! Absolutely! 

We were there for a friend's birthday dinner last weekend. The place looks pretty low-key and it was packed. Also, it is hard to find because the biggest sign out front is written in Thai. Remember the address!!
Now the most important part: The food is the BEST THAI FOOD I have ever had outside of Thailand! All six of us agreed! Their menu is very diverse and different then at your standard Thai restaurant.
The flavors are... AMAZING!!! Very authentic! Very nice spice to it! Just like in Thailand. I am still dreaming of the seafood soup we had...
And the prices are very reasonable too.

We will be back soon, Lers Ros!!!
author: Stefanie S. J.

description: I still like this place very much, but in one year, it increased the price of the steamed sea bass from $15.95 to $23.95.   Is that really necessary?
author: Wakako U.

description: This place's foods are delicious, but! when they say spicy for any food, take it seriously! lol... I really recommend this place to taste a good thai food.
author: asli c.

description:
Wow! This was delicious. We had the pork belly (#62), pad kee mow (#76), duck salad (#25), and possibly the catfish salad (#26 - this one was a little puzzling as we couldn't find the catfish... but it was good, whatever it was). So, overall, the seasoning on all of the dishes was outstanding. I have to admit that I had been a little nervous about all the comments on how unusual and spicy everything was - I like spicy stuff but not if it's too hot (for me) to enjoy. But I really loved all the flavors on these dishes - especially all the lime. The pad kee mow did have a little bit of a burned flavor but it wasn't bad or overwhelming. The meat in general was not the best part of the dishes - it was fine, rather than incredible, on its own, but the sauces and seasoning more than compensated. Having said that, the duck was excellent. It was mainly the pork belly that wasn't perfect - it was a little tough, but definitely still tasted good. I can't wait to go back and try other things - the menu is huge and I'm sure there's a lot more I'd like.

The service we had was very good - the waitresses were very friendly and kept our water glasses full. They could have been slightly more prompt with taking our order, given that the restaurant was maybe a third full, but that's a very minor complaint. Independent of this, I'm looking forward to figuring out their delivery radius.
author: Lisa K.

description: My boyfriend and I hit up Lers Ros Thai at about 1am on a Monday morning after a concert. As we were walking I noticed it definitely isn't in the best neighborhood, and it IS a bit of a hole in the wall, but the atmosphere once you got inside is fine. We were the only ones in the place, so our server was very attentive. My pad thai was perfect and just the right amount of spicy. The food definitely hit the spot, and was pretty cheap to boot.
author: Kristen B.

description:
I want to like this place.  They aren't that close to us, but still deliver, and do it right on time.  Portions are huge, prices are relatively inexpensive and there are a ton of menu offerings.

That said, there was not one thing we ordered (sum tum, tom yum, duck curry) that inspired me to keep eating.  Everything was more than a bit off.  The sum tum had too many dried shrimp, the tom yum was impossibly spicy (after we requested mild), and the duck was spindly and chewy.

I know once you've been to Thailand, the Thai food in the US just doesn't compare.  However, I've had far better meals at Thep Phanom, Koh Samui and the Monkey, etc.
author: S C.

description:
I already feel like a regular here and receive warm and friendly welcoming smiles upon returning, sometimes two nights in a row. The food is great and spicy, really SPICY so, if you're not into it ask for something mild and order a Thai Iced Tea too -- you'll still definitely need it, if not it's just yummy to drink.

Everything I've had was fresh and savory: sausage with fresh chunks of lemon grass, garlic frog (plum, juicy, garlicky!), green curry, crispy chicken with ginger/garlic rice (YUM!), spicy catfish (comparable to Sai Jai) and the Tom Yum rice noodle soup with pork, fishcakes, meatballs. Mmmmm. But my favorite thing to get here is the rice soup with crispy pork and chili - a blend of creamy, crunchy, salty and spicy and warms you up two ways. Perfect for this chilly weather.
author: Charm N.

description: I am a Thai food junkie. I would happily eat it every day if  I could afford it. Lers Ros is the best Thai that I've had in the Bay Area. It's a modern, clean restaurant situated in the not-so-clean, not-so-modern Loin. It feels like an oasis when you walk in, a shining star in the ghetto. I don't remember everything that we ate (and their website won't load the menu for me for some unknown reason), but the Tom Yum Goong was great, chicken satay awesome, and the pork belly was to die for. I will definitely be back.
author: Melissa A.

description:
The fried rice was probably the best I have had in the city, and this compares to all the Asian restaurants in San Francisco.  I ordered it with crispy chicken with fried rice.  It was quite good around $7.50.

The pork shoulder is crunchy on the outer layer, and gelatinous in the mouth.  Yummy! :-D

The portions are generous, the price is low, the food is great compared to the Thai food at this level.

The waiters are attentive, and unlike a lot of the Thai restaurants where they have greasy floor, this one feels quite clean.

I would definitely come back again.
author: Jason W.

description:
Summary: Good food, good service, fine lay out, good prices :: highly recommended

There was a pretty good size group of us and the servers took fine care of us. 

For me it was the food that won me over.  The som tam (green papaya salad) and sticky rice immediately took me back to Thailand.  The sticky rice even came in the same containers I'd had there. I personally prefer less sweet som tam, but that's just a preference (I liked Norther Thai cuisine more and this was largely southern)
The others in my party had the curries (spicely delicious), and fried rice.  Raves all around.
The decor was simple, but fine; though the bathroom was a little hard to get too.
Prices were pretty good and the portions not huge, but filling

If you're looking for (fairly) authentic and delicious Thai food, definitely stop in!
author: Aaron D.

description:
Went here for lunch on a Sun afternoon to try the duck larb that was on the SF 7x7 top 100.  There were two of us, so also had the pork belly to round out the meal.  Both were winners. 

Overall, one of the best Thai restaurants in the Bay Area.  Would love to go back and try more dishes.

Tenderloin location is not the best, but we were there in the daytime so not a big deal.
author: Christopher C.

description: Quite possibly one of the worst Thai dining experiences for me ever.  Maybe it was because we were there late, about 30 minutes before closing, but the food left much to be desired.  For appetizers, we ordered the fried tofu and vegetarian spring rolls.  The tofu came out tasteless, though the sauces helped.  When I bit into my vegetarian spring roll, I found a hair and immediately alerted the waitress.  We got a new batch 5 minutes later, and three of us had trouble eating it because the insides were way too hot.  Myself and a friend ordered the panang curry (medium) and ended up tasting super hot.  My friend started coughing half way through because of the spice, and continued that way for 10 minutes.  There seem to be a lot of great reviews on here, but just telling it the way I saw it...
author: R. R.

description:
The food is authentic and delicious, which is what keeps me going back on a weekly basis--I'm addicted.  While I understand that people don't flock to Tenderloin restaurants because of the "service" experience, there's definite room for improvement.  I'm not holding the restaurant to the same expectations of high end restaurants or anything, but think that basic principles should be honored: (1) people should be seated in order of arrival.  (2) food should be delivered to those who ordered first.  (3)  apologies (at the very least) should be offered when mistakes are made.

On a recent visit, I arrived with a ravenous hunger and ordered the two dishes I was craving.  Shortly after, a girl walked in and sat at the next table.  After a few minutes she finally made her selection, and I overheard "curry" as one of her choices.  When my food came out, the server brought it to her table, and she, in a hurry, began to eat.  I politely informed the server that I think my order went to the wrong table.  No apologies, no explanation, another long wait for my food.  In the meantime, they brought out the other customer's order and gave it to her, in addition to my order that she was already eating.  What the what?!  I was the one who was not only starving, but now had waited about 15-20 minutes for my food.  When my order finally appeared, there was again no apology or explanation.  

Another visit brought another observation.  The restaurant has a great lunch special deal where you can choose two dishes for a set price.  I went with some friends on a holiday, and we were told that there is "no special on holidays".  Fine, we just ordered from the regular dinner menu.  However, during the same lunch service, another table requested the lunch menu from a different server, and was able to order from it.  While I don't mind paying the $2-4 price difference per dish, what is infuriating is the inconsistency--don't all customers deserve to be treated the same?
author: Tom C.

description:
Ass kicking Thai delivery, that's still relatively new to the hood and rivals my favourite joint, Bang San.  

My benchmark dish is the Pad Kra Pow. So on my first time trying out their delivery this week, I was pleasantly surprised by how deliciously spicy and basil-y their version was, definitely some of the best I've had delivered. I look forward to iterating through their extensive menu, packed full of stuff that I've never seen on other Thai delivery menus. And they're open till 2am!! So none of this we-close-at-10pm bollocks! 5 Stars!
author: I. O.

description:
Fried sun-dried beef, coconut milk soup, curry duck and stir fried pork belly with crispy rind and basil leaves were very good.  Only let down was the whole fresh sea bass in spicy and sour soup.  The fish was not really fresh (maybe frozen) but the sauce was good.  What a waste!  Overall great food and will surely go back.  

More like 3.5 stars.
author: Mario S.

description:
Absolutely the worst and most uncomfortable service I ever experienced at any restaurant in my whole entire life!!!! I'm not exaggerating!

I dined with a total party of 7 and we showed up around 5:45 pm. We did not have reservations and it seemed like they did not want to seat us because we had no reservations even though the restaurant was half empty. 

Only about 2 parties from our group did not show up on time and they kept bugging us constantly about when they would arrive. Only about 10 minutes had passed and they came by at least 3 or 4 times urging us to order (even though the two people still had not showed up). So we actually went ahead and ordered before they got there. After we received our food, they kept coming over literally every 2 minutes to see our progress. When my friends showed up, they sat down for less than a minute and the waitress came over and asked them what they were ordering. 

Throughout the meal they kept coming over to our table and looked over our food to see whether we were almost done eating or not. They did not come over to ask whether everything was okay, how the food tasted, or if we needed anything else. They were trying to kick us out fast in order to make room for other customers. They did this to us because we had no reservations and I noticed they did not do that to any of the other big groups either. It doesn't matter if we made reservations or not because we are still PAYING customers!

After some of us finished eating, they took away the plates but then they also tried to take away plates that were still half full and rushing us out! At this point I was extremely irritated and It pained me that they had to charge us gratuity because if it was up to me I would have given them $0 tips if I could. 

The food is okay and a little more expensive than other Thai restaurants that I've been too. Also, not as delicious. However, the food wasn't terrible, hence the 2 stars. I definitely do not recommend this place.
author: T H.

description: Amazing! The best Thai food in the westcoast! The best padthai in the country!
author: Tanasan S.

description: you know things here ain't what they used to be. the service was minimal. the food was mediocre, cold, and devoid of the wonderful tastes that you would expect with thai food. not worth the effort to drive here and park.  i came because of the check please tv show.  i won't be returning.
author: phil m.

description: My first time here and definitely not my last. So good.. That it convinced me to write my first review on Yelp. I had the Red Curry w/ Duck with a side of brown rice and shared the Spare Rib appetizer with a friend. The red curry was definitely the best I've ever had. Better than Krung Thai back in San Jose. It had a good texture that wasn't too thick or thin.. Delicious. The spare rib appetizer was light and super crunchy (which I loved) and came with a sweet and spicy sauce. I will definitely come back here when I am in the area or even drive here because its totally worth it, especially if you love Thai food. The servers here were very attentive and friendly. Thumbs up!!!
author: Rosanna T.

description:
Simply had the Pad Thai tofu. Not the best pad thai ever but decent enough. Would have liked more noodles but I got a whole bunch of sprouts.
I was a party of me so I took at seat at the counter which was perfect.
author: jason h.

description:
Good lord this place was great. Best Thai I've had in a long time -- ever better than some I had in Thailand. I'm glad someone told me about this place -- otherwise never would've known about it. Very authentic

We ordered the duck salad, the papaya salad, sliced beef, yellow curry with chicken, the fried whole trout, and whole sea bass in a spicy/sour broth. Probably a few other things as well, but each one of these (especially the 2 fish dishes) were incredible.

I hope they deliver to my neighborhood.
author: Pete M.

description:
I have to give this place another star, and it's certainly not because this place has been discovered by 7x7 and all the rest of the flock of sheep.  

The standard Thai staples in American Thai restaurants are so much better here.  I never liked Pad Thai before trying it here.  Tom Kha soup at Lers Ros puts other restaurants to shame.   It's less sweet, and more flavorful.  The lunch specials are fantastic.  The beef salad is one of the most delicious things I have ever had.  The deep fried fish is really tasty and great.  

I think my earlier review was harsh because I was trying too many different animals and other things that are very new to me.  It's a delicate balance finding the right dishes that are not too Americanized (their Pad Kee Mow is mediocre and bland, as is some spicy basil shrimp we ordered).

Lers Ros, please don't Americanize your dishes!  And, I'm still mad about that woman ruining my dessert!
author: Amy D.

description:
"Lers Ros"... sounds like gibberish from a sailor 5 sheets to the 
wind, not like the name of a thai joint. But Thai it is, and super 
legit. How legit? 1. the green curry is bangkok-street-food hot, not 
spiced for the farang. 2. they don't stop at beef chicken pork... 
frogs legs or quail anyone? 3. The crew says things like "if you want 
food for the tourist, the yellow curry not spicy". Shhhh, no one tell them they don't live in Bankkok anymore! Let's keep it real
author: Eric T.

description:
The BEST Thai in San Francisco. Completely obliterates previously conceived notions of Thai food. The only problem is, you leave spoiled.

The Larb is obscenely good, btw.
author: Jonathan H.

description:
This place was great, and judging from many Thai customers, they served genuine Thai food. We had a large party so we ordered many different things to try. Everything was very tasty!

We started with the crispy quail - yum!
then sweet potato dumplings - yum!
chicken satay - yum
tom gai soup - yum! (With enough shrimp for all 6 of us in the party)

For entrees we had
pork leg stew with pickled cabbage (oh my super duper yum yum yum!)
pad se ew with beef (yum)
pad ke mao with chicken (yum)

And I can't remember what the others ordered. Service was decent, decor was decent, price and taste outstanding!

I was so excited to eat my pad se ew leftovers for lunch the next morning. But on the muni back home, someone told me they were hungry and pointed to my leftover bag. They looked disadvantaged (don't know if they were just down and out or homeless) so I couldn't say no, but I really had to think a few seconds about it before giving up my food to him.
author: Leslie T.

description: Yes!!!!!! So good, got sold out at the movies and yelped Lers Ros, ended up to be a great night.
author: Patrick H.

description: The service is excellent from the moment you step foot into the place.  The food is even better!  If you're hankering for thai.......you MUST eat here.
author: BigCity D.

description: I have to give it to Lers Ros Thai b/c they accommodated my 20+ person birthday lunch on a Sunday!  We took up the entire middle of the restaurant, and the food came out great-no long waits.  I decided to go safe and get the fried chicken!  This is not your KFC/Pop-eyes deal but nonetheless delicious!  I had the dried catfish salad, or sampled some from a friend's dish, which was a nice starter to the meal.  People varied in what they ordered.  All I can say is that my bday was a great meal!  It was super affordable too!  $9.25 for my fried chicken dish, and of course, after everyone throwing down $1, both my husband and my dish were paid for (Hey, he asked for only .50 throw in, lol), but due to affordability, when people threw it, we were set!  This is a great place if you need to accommodate a lot of people and within walking distance of Pandora =)
author: Steph W.

description:
Hands down- the best restaurant service in town- 
We came in for a quick dinner on our way to an event downtown. The places was packed when we came in, but we were seated quickly. They also have a full bar offering drinks and food. We ordered Padthai, Tom yum soup, and pork belly rice. I asked for my padthai to be cooked spicy, but apparently they couldn't do it. The waiter offer me to bring the chili on the side instead. We ordered the soup to be spicy, and it was really spicy- NO kidding- usually when we go to Thai restaurant, when we ask for spicy- the food would come in mild in my palate- BUT not in this restaurant- . Do NOT ask for SPICY unless you can eat 10 thai chili - in one bite- The soup was a little bit bland, but maybe because it was too spicy that I couldn't taste anything else-. The pork belly rice plate was ok according to my friend- good, but not excellent. We didn't order the fish special- which everyone seems to order - maybe next time. Price wise- slightly more expensive than regular mom's/pop's Thai restaurant. Average tab- 15-20 dollar per person without alcohol drink, which this restaurant offers.
author: Bibi B.

description:
We tried this place for the first time Sunday afternoon for lunch. We were in a hurry so we simply ordered Tom Yum Noodle soup with pork and a plate of fried rice. The fried rice was delicious but slightly on the oily side. The noodle soup was really delicious. The broth was well balanced, not sweet, and you could flavor it to your taste with the spicy condiments on the table. 

I also really love that they have rice soup on the menu with accompanying dishes like salted egg and omelet.

I am really excited to go back and try some other dishes. This place tastes more truly Thai. San Francisco finally has some Thai restaurants consistent with the balance of flavors and style you would find in Thailand.
author: Thanya S.

description: The food was fabulous!  There is an obvious attempt to blend traditional Thai cuisine with something else (French?).  Nothing tasted overwhelming; but, rather, just delicate enough for the taste to come across and delight the palate.  Service was excellent.  I highly recommend the pork belly......
author: Jack W.

description:
Dropped in for a quick meal.  Fast, cheap, clean - oh yes, attentive servers too.  I had the Pad Kee Mow (think Pad See Ew but el fuego!!!) and Green Curry with Prawns.  For two, it ran us $23 incl. tip.

Was adequate, solid, but just that.  Good  thai place for the neighborhood, but nothing to write home about...
author: Daniel W.

description:
Lers Ros seems like a pretty nice spot tucked away in a somewhat seedy neighborhood.  Very plainly decorated, the staff is friendly and the menu is huge.  I mean like, it's one of those numbered menus, and the numbers go up into the 70's at least.  It's open late (until 2am, I understand), and the food is fine.  That's most of what you need to know.

I had the sweet and sour chicken and while I wasn't blown away, I thought it was pretty good.  My associate Aaron V. had the stir fried pork belly and we both felt it was a little overwhelmingly rich.  Go figure.
author: Oliver N.

description:
I loved the beef salad...but be prepared, it's insanely spicy. The pad see ew was by no means outstanding...and it is one of my absolute favorite Thai dishes...so, wahhhn wahnnn for me.

The curries were pretty good. I'd head back there if it weren't for the fact that I have one too many other Thai places to try in SF. It was vegan friendly...
author: OKAY O.

description:
The only reason I'm not giving a 5 just yet is because I haven't dined here enough to give it a 100% and I'm stingy with my compliments.  HOWEVER, Lers Ros is on its way there.  No doubt.

Pretty authentic Thai food.  Good portions.  Beautiful presentation.  Spicy IS spicy here (just a heads up).  Everything here is super flavorful, just the way I like it, so it's probably not very healthy.  I always try to standard signature ethnic dish from a restaurant to get a sense of what the food is all about.  For Thai food, I suppose Pad Thai is it?  I liked it and would order it again when I'm not feeling particularly adventurous in the palate.

I have yet to try the alligator and rabbit and venison here...
author: Tokki M.

description: Cute spot, but the food was just okay.  AND, the wine was just dreadful (please steer clear).  Apparently missed ordering a 7x7 item so I might go back, but not high on the priority list.
author: Judy L.

description: This is my go-to Thai restaurant and they deliver!  Their specialty dish is the #62 Pad Kra Prow Moo Krob.  It's a stir fried crispy pork belly dish that is flawless, each and every time I order it...... it's pure heaven on a plate.  The rind is perfectly crispy and the inside tender.  I always order this with the intention of keeping leftovers, but I scarf the whole thing in one sitting.  The Pad Kee Mow is another favorite as well as the Papaya Salad with shrimp (VERY spicy -brings tears-to-your-eyes).  Aside from the delicious dishes, the service is great and delivery is fast.  Highly recommended!  In fact, I think I'm going to place a call right now.....I'm hungry.
author: Jennica S.

description:
You really can't go wrong with Lers Ros.  I came here for lunch not too long after it opened, ordered some red curry and a beer, and remember being really impressed.  The curry was very spicy and delicious, quite easily the best I've had in the city.

Last night I had my second meal from Lers Ros, but I got it delivered.  The food got here in less than 20 minutes, which is amazing!  But here's the best part (about the delivery) - the driver's shirt said "Bumper to BUMP HER on the THREEWAY."  

Anyways, I got my food - grilled shrimp green papaya salad, and pork belly with crispy rinds and basil.  The salad was amazing - spicy, flavorful, and very fresh.  The pork belly was also quite good, and I was surprised at how crispy the rind was despite having been in a delivery container.
author: Joseph N.

description: My favorite Thai place. My only two gripes: they don't de-vein their prawns. Pretty nasty. So I avoid ordering prawn dishes, which is a shame because those are my favorite. Also, their pad thai isn't very good (also one of my favorite things). It's clumpy and overcooked, and sometimes tastes a little funny. These two problems alone may actually tempt me to try another Thai place soon. EVERYTHING else is amazing though, which is why I give it 4 stars and not 2 or 3. I've only eaten in the restaurant a couple times. Mostly I get delivery, which I crave on the regular. It takes will power not to order from here once a week because it's so fucking tasty. Their prices have gone up a couple dollars per dish recently, but it's still very much worth it. But it does keep me from ordering as much. Maybe that's a good thing...
author: Betsy W.

description:
Delicious Thai food AND they deliver.  I was seriously craving some Thai noodles this weekend but did not want to leave my house, no worries, Lers Ros came to my rescue.  

I had read some reviews about the wonderful exotic and some what unusual menu at Lers Ros, but I had no idea that they would deliver the standards to my home.  I ordered the tofu pad see ew, which may have suffered a bit from the delivery since the noodles all seemed to clump together.  But even through the noodle block, I could taste that the flavor was still spot on.  My boyfriend had the yellow chicken curry and the portion was huge and satisfying.  The best thing we ordered was the fried chicken over garlic/ginger rice.  This seemingly simple dish was so flavorful, and even through the take out process the chicken kept it's crispy texture.  Sooooo good.  I will definitely be back.
author: Dana H.

description:
Went there twice and never failed me. The first time I check out this place. My gf and I got a fried frog legs, Cat fish pad path and Krang Som Cha ohm todd. All done with authentic Thai ingredients and original Thai test. I have to give a 5 stars to them. 

However, I'd over look on one of the starter dishes. The fried rabbit, I have to go back and try it next time. But I was also told that if you were born on the year of rabbit, you should not eat it.
author: Chris S.

description: Thanks to yelp we found this wonderful Thai restaurant. Pulling up to the restaurant it was a good sign that folks were waiting to get in and the place was packed. Luckily we arrived just as a large party was leaving and within minutes we were looking at the menu. It was difficult to choose the dishes we wanted because everything sounded good and waiters kept going by with tasty looking dishes for other tables. The staff was friendly and helpful and we enjoyed our meal immensely. Very friendly service.  Duck Larb is quite tasty.  Fish cakes, moo phing and green papaya salad, all solidly first rate.  If you are looking for good Thai this is the place.
author: James B.

description:
Lers Ros Thai is really five stars but my Thai heart 
is in Chicago at Sticky Rice, 
Of course, I got the pork belly and crispy rind.
As good as yelp advertised.
I also got the Green Curry, which was spicy, creamy, and rich.
Portions were on the larger side.  -and the price was affordable.
My new favoriteThai place in SF
I can't wait to try out everything else on the menu
and they deliever late!
author: Jake H.

description:
One of my new favorite Thai restaurants -- not because they serve your typical Americanized, watered-down dishes, but because of their fantastic authentic homecooking that most non-Thai would never consider ordering. Come later in the night, and you'll find the place packed with the local Thai's, a sure sign that the food is good.

Ignore the curries and the stir-fried noodles (although I'm sure they're probably delicious). Instead, try the boar or the 1000-year egg simmered in a super spicy basil broth...complete with green peppercorns still on the branch. I haven't had food this good (or spicy) since I was in Thailand.

The steamed whole seabass with a spicy citrus sauce was heavenly, especially on these chilly San Francisco nights. 

The decor is simple and the service attentive. Menu prices are average and sometimes cheaper than other Thai places. There are oftentimes large parties dominating the space, but you will always be accomodated. 

Just a word of warning: when the house specials say "spicy," they aren't kidding! I've never walked out of there without purple lips.

(While the restaurant is wheelchair accessible, the restrooms are not. They are atop a maze of stairs that lead deep into the building.)
author: David N.

description:
Just ordered some thai food for delivery from here and it was great. It arrived 10 minutes after I ordered which was awesome, nicely packaged up and the food tastes good. Free delivery and good prices. The portions seemed small at first but I found there was a lot more food in there then it looked like, it was just all pretty compact. I always like it when I have enough for seconds, which I did.

Oh and no communication problems either. I wanted some changes on the meals and everything came as I ordered it.
author: ben e.

description: I'm addicted to some of their dishes particularly to  crispy pork belly...and they've been testing my tolerance for spice - so far I'm loosing ...;-P
author: Dupa B.

description:
Tried take-out/delivery from this place recently and can say it is okay.

They tend to be generous with their food portions.  I ordered the stewed pork with greens as well as the shrimp with basil and garlic.  The food was good and delivery time was great.  However, I had a difficult time understanding the woman taking the order.  To ensure I received my order, I repeated a lot of the same information (credit card number, street address, phone number) until I heard the woman repeat the right information.  That just added unnecessary strain/stress for a very simple task.

This place is better to pick up at.  The food is fairly authentic with some dishes, but I'd definitely say I've had better Thai food in the city elsewhere.
author: Jenny K.

description: Delicious, better than average Thai food. Pad Thai was tasty, but the seafood curry was superb. The spicy chicken was a bit too hot, even for spice loving wife. A great find, thanks to Yelp.
author: Sterling B.

description: This place is phenomenal! It has specialties and flavors you won't encounter at your ordinary Thai joint. I think you'd have to fly to Bangkok for food this good. Try the duck larb for starters!
author: Adam R.

description: Best Thai food I've ever had, and I've had a lot! My fiance and I went to San Francisco to celebrate the New Year. She's originally from Thailand, so of course we were going to have to try the Thai food in SF. We were going to be staying in the city for a total of four nights. So, on the first night, we checked out Yelp for some Thai places and found Lers Ros. The reviews were high and my fiance said the pictures of the food looked very authentic. We walked from our hotel, the Intercontinental, and got there in about 20 minutes. The only reason I mention this is because if any of you are going to try this restaurant and are staying close to where we stayed do yourself a favor and take a cab! It's not that I don't like to walk, but we found out the hard way that you have to walk through some pretty sketchy areas. Some parts of the walk reminded me of a smaller version of skid row in L.A. Anyway, the walk was definitely worth it as both the food and the staff at Lers Ros were frickin' awesome! And since we were not driving I was able to have my favorite Thai beer, Singha. The food was seriously so good that we ended up eating dinner here 3 of the 4 nights we were in SF. And as all of you know, there is no shortage of restaurants in the city. But when you find a place with seriously perfect food and a restaurant full of nothing but the best staff ever, why go anywhere else? My fiance and I reminisce about this restaurant at least twice a month. Just about every time we eat Thai food we end the meal by saying "It was good, but not nearly as good as that place in San Francisco!" Not sure when we'll be back to the city, but when we do, this will be the first place we go! And we hope at least some of the staff is still there so we can say hi again!!
author: Phil S.

description:
I went here for the first time tonight and was impressed.  I had the sliced chicken with peanut sauce and spinach.  My husband had a curry and we shared the fried tofu with hot and sour sauce as a starter.  All of it was quite good and very reasonably priced.  

The wait staff was attentive, but not too.  The food was especially well-presented; we had a seat in the back of the restaurant where we were able to see everything coming out of the kitchen.

The place seems popular.  It is a Saturday night and we went in about 6:30.  Very shortly afterward, every table was full!

Free delivery is offered with a min. $15 purchase and there is a clever catering menu on the take-out menu that would be nice for a group of friends.
author: Elli F.

description:
I only have a brief review of this place because I ordered take out.  I ordered the pork belly rice plate (#62) and the 5 spice duck with rice.  Between the 2, I would say the pork deserves 5 stars and the duck gets 3 and therefore, I give this place 4 stars.  

Reasonably priced and I was generally impressed with the quality of the food, I'm definitely going back.
author: Rod C.

description: It's been a long time since I was here so I can't remember exactly what me and my friend had except for Phad Thai, but everything was wonderful!  The atmosphere was also great.  Looking forward to going back at some point.
author: Angela R.

description:
Love this authentic thai restaurant. This is as good as Thai food gets outside of Thailand.

Our favorite is the Catfish dish. So yummy!
author: Sheila S.

description: The best Thai food I've had in the USA!  Only in Thailand have I had anything to equal the food at Lers Ros Thai.  The service, from a huge staff of young, well-trained, uniformed and attractive Thai servers-- all of whom spoke good English, was phenomenal.  The only negatives are the noise level (loud,) the fact that's in an unattractive location (the down-and-out, Tenderloin,) and the atmosphere. You don't go there for the latter; it's not fancy or elegant.Though it's comfortable and aesthetically pleasing. You go there for the outstanding food and service! First rate on both, I'd say.  They've now got three branches in SF. I went to the one on Larkin, as it was an easy walk from the Hotel Nikko where I was staying. What a find!
author: David B.

description:
We adore Lers Ros! We found it after a very disappointing Vietnamese meal nearby in the Tenderloin... we were walking by, and there was a line of people outside. Even more interesting, the people eating/waiting were a mix of Thai families and non-Thai yuppies. 

The food is phenomenal - full spice, in both the hot and flavorful sense. The curries, larb, soups - all great. I have been asked in other Thai restraunts: do you want it Thai spicy (I assume meaning the level at which they would serve it to Thai people). No questions here... it just comes out "Thai spicy". Mmm.

And, now that we have a baby, we are thrilled they deliver. It has taken between 20 and 45 minutes, but importantly, when I have placed the order the ETA has been accurate. And free is nice too.

This is hands down our favorite Thai, eat in or out.
author: Katie K.

description:
Their iced chysanthemum tea is good- I like those big mugs with big chunks of ice. 

The yum pla dook foo and other yum's (salads, lime-chili dressing) were missing some sugar to balance out the fish sauce and lime. 

Tom yum soup was served in big traditional steel pots with the flame underneath. Very cool. Tasty shrimp.

Decor is nice, clean, and simple. The bathroom is a trek- go up the stairs, make a right, a left, a right, and then a left into the bathroom. 

However, I think I got an MSG overdose about 10 minutes after I left the place- I have a headache, vomited, and my heart is racing. Maybe it's because I typically avoid MSG, so I'm super sensitive to it? I don't know.
author: anocha s.

description: I did not physically eat at lers ros thai, but the bartender at chelsea helped us order a pad thai and this thai sausage appetizer via delivery. Surprisingly the p/thai tasted very delicious and shared the thai sausage with chili peppers.  I believe this is probably one of the best thai restaurants in sf.
author: Jer W.

description:
Love it!  I found this place on yelp when I was searching for a good thai place in the TL.  It's new, but the food is really good and really cheap!  The background music is weird; it went from 50 cent to Hakuna Matata from the Lion King...very odd.

We had the peanut chicken, a green curry with prawns and some sort of awesome soup.  It was ALL really spicy - so be warned.
author: Megan H.

description: Delicious eats at a great price, great service, open late.  Best chicken satay and Pad kee mow soooo delicious!   Will go back.
author: Maggy L.

description: I come here a lot. Great curries and coconut milk soup! The spicy beef salad is awesome. Good service. My only complaint is that the chicken dishes dont have very tender meet - often kind of dry and funny tasting.
author: Tiffany B.

description: I've been in this restaurant 5 times and I have yet to experience a decent meal.  One time, I ordered the marinated barbequed chicken, served with sweet and sour sauce.  At first, I got excited when I saw the portion was big, but as soon as I bit, the chicken tastes like it's been cooked twice.  It was hot but dry. Another time, I was going to order the Lers Ros Special combination plate for $17.95.  I requested if I can have steamed vegetables instead of the sticky rice because I'm diabetic.  The answer was "No", the manager recommended I order another vegetable dish for $8.95. I left and never came back.
author: Adam B.

description: Ordered food at 8:00pm tonight, $68.00 worth of food.  Told it would take 45 minutes.  Called at 9:00pm and was told it was probably on the way, called again at 9:15 and was told it was on the way and "we are really busy" (not my problem) when I called at 9:45 again I was told how busy they were and it was probably on the way.  At 10:00pm called again and as I was waiting on the phone the food arrived.   I asked what they would do for me, they said they would not discount the order.  I could pay full price or send the food back.  I did not try the food because I was so offended that I waited 2 HOURS for delivery and they would rather throw the food out then make me a happy repeat customer.
author: Meg G.

description: Went here during lunch the other day. The Vietnamese place down the street was packed so our group of 7 wandered in here and were seated right away. The food was great and even moreso, very reasonably priced (they have a great lunch combo).
author: Roxy B.

description:
#62. Pork Belly. That is all.

Seriously, though that dish was so delicious. And so was everything else that we ordered during our trip to Lers Ros. But, especially the pork belly. It's cooked so perfectly, the meat so tender and flavorful with just the right amount of fat. It is pretty oily, but to me, that's heaven. And the sauce it was in was amazing, I was soaking all my leftover rice in that after I was done with the meat. It is spicy (for me since I'm a total wimp when it comes to spicy food) but I managed pretty well til then end when it was just rice and sauce. Then it got pretty painful heh. Family ordered bbq chicken and catfish rice plates and they enjoyed both very much. I got to taste a little, and I would definitely try the catfish next time I'm here. Also ordered the pad see-ew, which was pretty standard. The noodles were kinda sticking together and the chicken was a little dry, but it's not as sweet as other places', which is totally a-ok with me.

It is a little more expensive than other Thai restaurants I've been to, but I think they make up for that not only in the quality of their food, but also in atmosphere and service. The place is well lighted and very clean. I usually don't really care too much about service, as efficiency is my only concern. But I was impressed by Ler Ros' servers. They were nice, attentive and efficient, much better service than in some fancier, more expensive restaurants I've been to.

I can't wait to go back and try the quail and rabbit!
author: Amanda K.

description: Worst Thai food I've ever had. Delivery took about 1.5 hours. All of the sauces were broken (oil separation)  including the curry and peanut sauce. The fried tofu was soft and had a dirty fryer  oil flavor. The pad se ew was a giant glob of noodles -- just terrible. I'm seriously questioning how on earth this place could be rated at all on yelp let alone holding the number 1 spot. Also they forgot to deliver our drinks.
author: emily b.
